review_content: This is a great place to stay if you're visiting Louisville or just driving through. Rooms were very clean, hotel staff was helpful and had quick answers to questions about the area. WiFi works well but is slow. One thing to note, if you're a light sleeper, you may want to ask for a room on the west side of the hotel as the east side of the building is very close to the highway off ramp.Hampton inn is pretty consistent, but this location wasn't as good- (I was torn between 2-3 stars, but chose 2).Although I was upgraded to a suite for free, the service was just *fair*. Nobody was rude or anything, but I felt like I was interrupting everyone- as if I were inconvenient to them.Some Hampton inns are updated, but this one did not appear to be. The room was clean, but the walls had patches of stuff on them- scratches on the doors & furniture. The HVAC worked, but the housing was in disrepair. The workout equipment was obsolete and in severe disrepair. (The towel bin hadn't been restocked and the water cooler didn't work at all). I'd stay here again, but it would not be my first choice.Okay so we are on the road from KC and looking for a Hampton. We found this one tired as ever they gave us a room but when we got there it had hair every where on the beds? Under the sheets, bathroom. Even on the decorations in the bathroom. Really? So we went to exchange the room and she gave us another room but guess that room had hair under are sheets and on the bathroom floor. Look like how's keeping was cleaning the room with a hair mop smh. We were so tired we ended up getting sleeping bags to use on the beds. It was just Nasty.This hotel chain is usually really good nationwide however, this is the exception.The customer service here is fantastic.  The staff is friendly and warm.Unfortunately, the rooms are a bit run down and the walls are paper thin.  We were also here for work while they were under their "reconstruction phase" to be fair but that's all I have to go on for this hotel.If you just want a roof over your head this is the place for you.  However, if you are looking to feel comfortable and happy, perhaps try another hotel/chain.AVOID. Worst Hampton I have ever stayed at. Boarder-line Run-Down. The only positive thing I can say is check in was a breeze, and that is because the desk clerk seemed to be the only person there that cared. Breakfast. incompetent layout, quality, and availability. Awful. Room cleaning LAZY. Not once changed sheets or the stained bed-spread. Really? 2-days not trash removal from room. Room missing items, trash can, do not disturb, enough hangers. Gym: WORST EVER. ALL MACHINES BROKEN. Never have seen ever in a Hilton chain. Blatantly CHEAP MANAGERS!Will NOT stay at this one ever again nor recommend.Currently undergoing a renovation, the property is a little rough around the edges.  My only real complaint would be the tough traffic patterns to get into the property.  The room was clean, the staff is exceptionally personable.There are better choices. The staff is great but the rooms are lacking. Comforter was lumpy. Carpet unfinished around air conditioner and lime scale build up on faucet. I will look for other accommodations next time I am in town.The girl at the front desk was super rude when checking in. I thought she was having a bad day, which happens, but apparently every day was a bad day for her. I just don't care to deal with that after a long day at work. No, thank you! Other than that, rooms were clean but super outdated like most Hampton Inns.No sheets.  No apologies.  We were woken up very early by the housekeeping guy knocking persistently and saying "hey" over and over.  And they have a terrible breakfast. I'm paying more for a better hotel from now on.Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Room was fairly clean but the pillow case has disgusting stains on it. Walls are paper thin and I got to enjoy my neighbors television all night so keep this in mind when booking. Wi-fi worked well and was complimentary. The breakfast, also complimentary, was pretty decent but stains on the chairs. Phone would not connect to front desk at all for a wake up call and had to actually go to the front desk. The desk clerk was great about helping with local food delivery options and even gave me a coupon. Pros and cons. Needs more attention to cleanliness details but very accommodating.Great customer service by all except the owner. Room had bed bugs! Were moved -front desk was great-but family had to be split into 2 rooms. Next morning the owner changed the compensation promise and was incredibly rude. Too bad. Have contacted Hilton for resolution.This would get 5 stars but it's an old hotel with nothing decent close to it.   Staff was awesome but everything is old minus the medium size flat screen.Very friendly staff. The place was clean. Free wifi throughout. Decent free breakfast. Great location for Louisville tourism. We'd stay here again if ever in the area.Very clean and a great locationOne of the more popular places in New Albany. Place was booked when I showed up, but thankfully there was a cancellation and they moved me right into that room. The hotel is beautiful and very clean. The rooms are quite spacious and comfortable. Moderately priced. They have breakfast and sometimes serve other buffet style meals around dinner. Food was QUITE good too! However... The beds weren't anything to brag about. I slept in a better bed at a hotel that cost me half the price. So, if you don't mind a remotely uncomfortable sleep, check this place out if you swing through New Albany.

Very clean hotel, friendly staff. The rooms were nice and clean. The hotel is in a good location, close to the interstate and several restaurants.Several items for breakfast. I will stay here again.I made a second visit at La Quinta it is still very clean and the staff very friendly.I stayed at this La Quinta in June 2015 and my experience was great.  I saw some poor reviews; however, during my stay, I got nothing but great friendly service!I worked with 2 employees during my stay.  Sadly I forget their names, but, a man checked me in, and was very helpful.  We had a problem with our room where our door just didn't seem to line up well to close.  Without a question he moved us one room down.  A nice lady helped me check out and she was also very nice.Sadly I slept past the free breakfast, but, I have stayed at many La Quinta's and it's usually your standard buffet breakfast which isn't bad at all, and best of all, free!Although I missed breakfast at the hotel, luckily there are many restaurants very close by!  Cracker Barrel was where I went for breakfast, and there is also a seafood place and many other choices nearby!One thing I love about La Quinta's is their pet policy!  FREE!  I travel with my dog and sometimes my dog & cat.  Some hotels charge insane amounts for pets!  I am happy every time I can find a La Quinta in the towns I am staying so I don't have to pay tons extra for having a dog.Overall, the building and rooms are standard La Quinta.  Basic, but clean.  At under $100 per night, with pets, this is my go to hotel!This LaQuinta is an excellent value-oriented property with clean, comfortable rooms including refrigerator and microwave.   Front desk was very accommodating.  We brought kids once and they enjoyed the small indoor pool.  While this is not the newest LQ decor it is nice and not dated.  There are 2 chain restaurants on the same road and plenty of fast food around.  I use this one when I need to be in East Louisville.  Of course it is pet friendly with a very reasonable pet policy.  The breakfast is standard LQ fare of fruit,  cereal,  waffles, and those prepared eggs with pastries.   By booking  well in advance I found rates very favorable.David Kloop is the manager at this location and could use some schooling on his social skills.  We witnessed some bad behavior while he was checking in a guest prior to us.  And, while I came in to the building during the middle of the discussion.    I quickly realized when he was checking us in that this guy obviously hates his job.  Too We're very clean - appears to be a new hotel, breakfast each morning was excellent. But even after a week - David had a very poor attitude.  We won't stay at this location again.Pros: Pet friendly, comfortable beds, okcontinental breakfast, and decent rate. Cons: Rude staff, zero water pressure, and a filthy indoor pool that smelled like creek water and looked like an outdoor pool that had not been cleaned in 15 years.Upon check in we had to yell for the clerk to help us. She was unfriendly and acted like we were interrupting whatever she was doing in the back office. The clerk in the morning was just as rude. We love the La Quinta, but we won't stay here again.Avoid this place if you are a dog owner and don't want to be treated like fourth class. When my wife and I checked in with our ten pound beast last Saturday, we were informed by "Doug" at the front desk that we were not allowed to enter the hotel through the main door with our dog. Rather, we were told, that we were to enter through a side door and we were not allowed to use the elevator. We completely ignored Doug, of course and entered all we liked--with our dog in tow--through the main entrance. I have never been treated like this anywhere I've stayed. Ever. It was incredibly insulting, particularly when La Quinta advertises themselves as "pet friendly." To add insult to injury, this second rate hotel is very over priced.One note: there are two Doug's here. The Doug we dealt with is just a front desk clerk. The other Doug is apparently a manager. He was not on-site during our stay, but he will be getting an earful. We won't ever be back.My husband and I have stayed in multiple La Quintas and this is one of the BEST ones we've stayed in. We stayed in a suite so we had a pull out couch. We didn't use it but it was nice to have a little sitting area. We also traveled with our 2 pets, one cat and one dog and they welcomed them but told us to come through the side door so we wouldn't disturb anyone. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the staff that waited on us was spectacular!Not only is this a clean, convenient hotel, but the staff is also first rate.  We stay at this hotel about 4 times a year.  During our last stay we forgot a pair of shoes in the room.  When we realized that we had forgotten the shoes, we called back to the hotel and talked to Gary who informed us that he had mailed the shoes back to us at his expense.  Thank you Gary for the "above and beyond" customer service!  Highly recommend this hotel!Not a bad place. Just a good hotel room with nothing spectacular. The free wifi either work great or terrible. Good for dogs. Free continental breakfast. Not bad for the value.LOVE LOVE LOVE this La Quinta......We had a room reserved with double beds because at the time that is all they had but when we checked in they had a King Suite available and needed our double bed room so they upgraded us for free.This room was amazing!!! It had a jacuzzi tub, fridge, microwave, the works. The bed was real soft and the room was extra clean.I really liked that the area around the hotel was really clean and nice. Plenty of restaurants to choose from.If I ever pass thru again I would love to stay here again.We try to always stay at La Quinta because we travel with our Aussie Shepherd. This one is one of the best, very nice rooms and very clean. Staff is very nice and helpful and the breakfast is great for travelers.  There is a large field behind the hotel that is great to let our dog run after a long day in the car. And plenty of great places to eat very close, love this area.The quality of La Quinta's varies widely.  Yes, this one does have the comfortable beds and for that I'll give it the two stars. However, there is practically NO water pressure, at least not in room 215.  There were children running screaming down the hall by 9am -- Hey, you little urchins, it is six in the friggin' morning in California! Then a half hour later the maids knock on your door and yell "Housekeeping", like there is no way to give them a print out of the people who have already checked out.  They want you out of there. Their reported fitness center is apparently a room with two machines . . but I never saw it (and I looked).The front desk is not particularly friendly.  I mean, I was standing in line to check in and he answered a phone call ahead of me.  Hello? I'm actually here in the flesh - if I started ringing annoyingly would you afford me a higher priority? I said something . . as nicely as I could and he obliged but noted that he just hoped the person on hold didn't hang up.  Oh . . that's right, you already HAVE my money. What really galled me is that I'd switched from the Downtown Hyatt to save a few bucks on my last night in town.  I literally saved $23 on the room . . . $13 on the parking.  That means that for just $36 more dollars (shop through travelocity), you can be smack dab in the middle of downtown, have an actual fitness center open 24 hours on premise, a larger room, better bathroom, actually shower, 18 floor hotel . . . I mean, it is worth $36.  This place isn't awful but for over a $100 with tax on the very outskirts of Louisville, it should be A LOT better.

Nice place to stay. We did two nights. The rates were good. Rooms were clean, linens were clean and rooms were just as described on site. Location was right by major expressways and had lots of restaurants and shopping near. Location is about 20 minutes from downtown Louisville. There is also a Starbucks and bar right in the lobby area.Cue the standard review - the bed is comfortable, the room is clean. Price is trending a little higher than I think is worth it for a place like this, but...depending on the area, that sort of thing happens. I do agree with some other reviews - for this kind of price, I feel like I ought to get some breakfast included with the room. I definitely would have at a competing Hampton Inn. So there's absolutely nothing here to avoid - I'd say let your hotel loyalties do the talking, and if you value breakfast, find a Hampton nearby.What can I say about my visit to the Courtyard by Marriott in East Louisville other than "A Perfect Stay"...Upon arrival I was greeted with "Welcome" and a smile...The lobby area was very modern and NICE!! I had requested an early arrival and arrived at 1pm and was promptly checked in with no problem (normal check-in is at 3pm). My room was on the fourth floor overlooking the courtyard and pool (nice view).  The room was immaculate and I LOVED the red accent walls behind the bed and in the bathroom. There was no fridge or microwave in my room like at some of the other Courtyards that I've stayed in but since I was only there for one night it was no biggie. My room was right around the corner from the elevator and I heard nothing... It was very quiet in the hotel. The bed was nice and comfy (not too hard or soft)...The water temperature/pressure in the tub/shower was awesome...There is a Cuisinart single serve coffee maker for those like me who like that one cup of coffee in the morning...The hotel is very close to lots of stores and restaurants, a lot within walking distance. Overall it was a most perfect stay and I will definitely return to this hotel when I come back to Louisville.So, the lobby is nice but same sub-par Marriott rooms. Awkward set-up of bed/tv positioning- not ideal. There's an in-room balcony but it's not accessible. Had to hold down the toilet handle for a full minute to flush every single time. Icky shower with moldy curtain. And the room smelled funny when we arrived. Happy to have an outlet next to each side of the bed for easy phone charging. Friendly staff. Wasn't too far away from the derby.Our stay here was average- expected more for what we paid - noisy rooms with a gap under door so heard hallway noise as well- very nice lobby and check in- friendly staff - rooms were outdated but clean- close to several restaurants!Good: Nice hotel, rooms clean and friendly staff. Bad: The lack of an included hot breakfast when other hotels in this price-point include it, and the free version of the in house Wifi is so slow that it is unusable. I suppose this is to persuade you to pay for the "advanced" service.  In this day and age, charging more for usable internet is inexcusable.Great hotel, very clean and accommodating! Free wifi, computers to use, and extravagant lobby! Breakfast is great and there is a Starbucks in the lobby as well!Very Nice hotel at a great price!Clean rooms.  Bathroom was immaculately cleaned.  Decor is the same as every other Courtyard.  Towels are like SANDPAPER.  Comfy lobby.Newly renovated lobby. Nice.  Rooms still in crappy old scheme but at least it's reasonably priced.I stay at this hotel every week since the end of September.  They recently upgraded their lobby and it is much nicer. The rooms are clean and they have large tv which makes it nice.  They need to install wireless and my understanding is this is in the works.

From the time you walk in and the front desk staff greet and check you in then you walk into the large clean room you are saying Yes I am glad I picked this hotel. You then go down for drinks and a meal WOW the bar tender and wait staff are great. Then when your meal comes out to perfection you say to yourself SCORE!This is a Great Hotel and I stay many nights from High End to the Hampton brand (which are very good) this is now one of my favs in Louisville.From one happy Diamond MemberI travel a lot for business. This is the friendliest and most helpful staff I have encountered. The breakfast is great and the dinner items  are delicious. Great service.C'mon I do like Garden Inns.This one was perfectly located for work. Right across the street.Gotta love rolling out of bed and going to work.The room was clean and fresh.Can't ask for more.The staff is so friendly and helpful. Real customer service is so rare these days, and I'm so grateful and impressed by these guys! I had an allergic reaction to the sheets (forgot to call ahead and ask what detergent they use to wash their sheets, and I'm allergic to most detergents), so the next morning my skin looked horrid! The staff was so nice when we called. They said they would change the bedding and towels with a hypoallergenic option, and said they have bedding washed with different allergy-friendly detergent for this very case (probably something along the lines of Tide-Free-and-Gentle or All-Free-and-Clear.) They changed the sheets within a couple hours, and even apologized! I was impressed because people who are allergic to everything (like me) should have known to call-ahead. They were very kind, and some hotels don't even offer a hypoallergenic option. Also, for breakfast they made custom-made pancakes just because I asked if they were making any more. The tray was out of pancakes, which was understandable since I was late getting downstairs after trying to calm my skin and let allergy medicine kick in. I asked if they were making more, but never meant for them to make more if they were wrapping up breakfast. They made two huge yummy pancakes for me! Again, multiple employees here are just fantastic.  Overall wonderful experience!Best breakfast in Louisville. Homemade scones and cinnamon buns. Oh my, it's a heavenly breakfast.Breakfast is FANTASTIC!! Homemade raspberry scones, sticky buns, hash, buttermilk biscuits. I think I've died and gone to heaven.  Good thing I hit that treadmill first. What a breakfast!Clean, Nice Staff, Quiet and full food service.This Hilton Garden Inn on Crittenden Drive is conveniently located; low traffic area, but close enough to great restaurant strip on Bardstown Road, and other tourist venues. The hotel rates are reasonable, good facility for those on business trips. The staff are nice and cordial; very pleasant dispositions.This location is good if you are:A) At the convention centerB) Wanting to be close to the airportThe hotel is nice, clean, and current. If you are going to a convention this hotel will fill and fast.Negatives if you wish to go downtown you will drive. If you want to go to trendy restaurants in old town you will need to drive. If you like Cracker Barrel, then you are just fine.Anything but the convention I am downtown.located near the airport,  difficult to get to.  No free upgrades for breakfast. the shower was luke warm,  and the air conditioning made weird noises.  Room was clean, and the bed firmness adjuster was broken.  The only good, was that I was leaving the next day.Large spacious room. Nice lay out with friendly staff. Small pool and very small fitness center, but enough to do the trick. Biggest down side is restaurant. would have been a solid 4 or 4.5 but the restaurant brought it down. I choose the Garden Inn because it had a restaurant and bar. This way I could get dinner after I arrived and have a few drinks with out having to worry about driving. I had the Smokehouse cheddar burger. It was ok, but nothing great especially for the price. Typical low end restaurant burger. Had 2 glasses of red. I asked for the "freshest" and was brought the Sycamore lane which I assume is the house wine at $6. It tasted like it had been open a long time (a few days at least) with a taint and slight carbonated feel. Definitely old. I asked for the Malbec for the second glass; $12.50 and was extremely disappointed. It too was old. Didn't want to seem like a snoot so I ate the cost of both. Very disappointed. Lesson learned only order beer or bring your own!Had Breakfast this morning. If you are a Hilton Honors member and get it free it is OK. If not, GO NEXT DOOR to Cracker Barrel to get great food at a reasonable price! Eggs were watery, was not ready at 0600 (still cooking the scrambled eggs for the line. Wait staff friendly and helpful Although waitress kept chiding me and 2 other fellows for being on our phones so much. We were all at different tables and eating alone. I like to clear my email for work during breakfast while having coffee allowing me to be up to speed before my first meeting. I don't need to be told by Mom about no phones at the table, since the Garden in is trying to get business clientele as customers.Excellent hotel. Very clean. Lots of meeting space for groups of various sizes. Indoor pool was appropriate temperature. However,  the hot tub apparently had a leak. Maintenance kept adding water daily. Don't expect a lot of upscale dining within walking distance. You'll have to drive on in to downtown.Very nice hotel and pleasant and helpful staff. I just spent one night here but the property was well appointed and maintained.  I would certainly recommend this hotel if you are in the area and want to be near the airport.Been waiting 40 minutes for Shuttle to hotel. Called 3 times. Every time told 5 minutes. This is why I use MarriottAwesome place with amazing staff.  Traveling with family member with a disability ..very accommodating!Nice rooms, awesome staff, Amazing bartenders.This Hilton Garden Inn is super friendly, clean and actually quite stylish! My room and my bathroom was quite large, and even had space for a desk and a small sitting chair with an ottoman next to the two Queen beds - and it didn't feel cramped. The bathroom was stocked with Neutrogena products, which I thought was much better than the usual hotel junk.There was quite a large selection of breakfast foods, including: cereal, fresh fruit, omeletes made to order, scrambled eggs, bagels, toast, cinnamon buns....you get the idea. I think that the cooks came out every morning and asked us how our breakfast was and if we needed anything. Wow. The hotel isn't downtown, but it's very close to the airport and right next to the Six Flags Kentucky that has been closed for apparently three years. It's also quite close to the expo center, which was especially convenient for the purposes of my stay there.I had a huge room, which was clean and quiet.  Not much else to ask for.  The staff was friendly (and one of them was a hottie) and the AC was cold.  The bar downstairs left something to be desired and I never really tried the restaurant.  There wasn't much in the way of selections for beer or wine at the bar, although the bartender was really friend.  Bonus is the free shuttle to the airport, which was quick and without incident.Typical clean, modern HGI. I stay here whenever I'm flying out of the airport.I swear that I could tell you about all the dumpy hotels in Louisville - this year alone I have already found 2. This time I decided to stay near the airport and there were alot more choices. The hotel was fine. Although very close to the airport my room was quite. Maybe once I heard a little air noise but Im used to living in a busy area so it doesn't bother me. Liz the concierge was kind enough to fill my request to provide me a room on the top floor.  The hotel is very close to the Fairgrounds/Stadium other than that there is not a lot in the immediate area but 2 major interstates are less than a mile away so it's easy getting from one end of town to the other. the ramada inn in the same block looked dumpy. There is fairly new super 8 which looks good. Lots of hotels in the area but i believe you do get what you paid for. Yea the bathroom had Neutrogena it's better than some of the other toiletries you receive. Plenty of parking also.Nice size rooms, friendly staff and adequate restaurant but two big negatives: Check in took 15 min. One person for a big line. And twice there was lukewarm water so showering was impossible. Would not stay again.

I recently had a 3 night stay for a business trip at this location. They are currently finishing up a remodeling project of the entire building. The staff are friendly the continental breakfast has a large selection. The rooms are nice and clean and the beds are cozy. Will definitely stay here again is business brings me back to this area l.So my sister had come West from D.C. to visit and we decided to make a trip to Louisville. This was the hotel we had stayed. The hotel at first glance is very hard to find as the name is all the way on the other side. If you were coming down into metro Louisville from I-64, you would definitely not see it. You have to literally go around because the front is facing West. The check-in was quick and we got to our room, which was not too bad either. What I did find was weird was that the closet, because they put it perpendicular to the wall, kind of constricted the walkway, into the room. In other words, when you enter, the sink is on the right, then you have the closet facing the sink and then the bathroom is in that alleyway created by walking between these two. But rather than use the wall to align with the sink wall,  it stuck out into the walk way. The closet door was hard to open as well because it was one of those pull away (kind of like a restroom on an airplane deal). The room did have a nice HD plasma screen and the view on the 6th floor was amazing (could see a full view of the KFC Yum Center). The amenities were nice as well. The pool was great lengthwise going from  3 ft. to 5 ft. deep; however, the width was terrible. On Saturday, I was the first one in and then all these people started coming in and I was like "Dang, how am I going to make room, while still being able to swim?" It was as if I was a big ass fish in a small aquarium. I could only get in one stroke from wall to wall! The continental breakfast was pretty sweet. They had some hot food (gritz, waffles, scambeled eggs, sausage and vegetable stir fry) as well as the regular cold (cereal, bagels, yogurt, etc.) Things that were not included in the rating, but a big WTF. Okay so in the room, the wall facing me had this outlet thing that they were trying to blend in with the rest of the wall. What I was trying to figure out was why the other wall, beside it had all these other things sticking out? It seemed as if they like half assed it. You will see in the attached pic. O_o The tried to blend in the outlet; however, the fire alarm, speaker, and sprinkler system were all visible and those stuck out the most!FANTASTIC hotel.  I cannot recommend it enough!!The continental breakfast in the morning was delicious and plentiful.  I like how they had a fridge down there to KEEP the cold stuff cold.  Not just a bowl with ice.  Sometimes that doesn't cut it when it comes to yogurt or milk.The rooms were really nice and well-kept by housekeeping.  They were accomodating at the front desk when my friends and I wanted to be by each other.  Each of us were traveling with kids, and they were very sweet to them.  They were all really patient with us when we met in the hallway so our kids could fall asleep (only one complaint-woot!! lol).Check in and check out was a breeze and the hotel is very centrally located.  I would definitely stay there again!Disclaimer: I have not stayed overnight here.But: I have been to several multi-day professional continuing ed classes here and gotten a feel for the hotel overall.The breakfast is solid.  Make-your-own waffles, bagels, muffins, oatmeal with add-ins, cereal, hardboiled eggs, yogurt, danishes and a few microwaveable options like sausage biscuits (convenience store type) plus coffee, tea and juice of course. The place is clean.  Newer hotel and it shows.  Small indoor pool, small weight room both appear clean and nice.  Small patio outside and a dining/working lobby inside.  Staff is friendly but not obtrusive.  Responsive to the needs of their clients like refilling coffee, unlocking doors, restocking bathroom items etc. Overall very good staff. Rooms appear nice, I've seen them while maids are cleaning them and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there.  My colleagues who have stayed there have had no complaints. My major complaint is location.  Dang that location is impossible to exit at rush hour- Blankenbaker light takes 2-3 turns and I-64 towards the city is horrible.  So if you were staying here and wanted to go to dinner closer into town or downtown, it is very annoying.  Not many local or nicer restaurants right close by, all chains like fast food, Cracker Barrel, Ryan's, and such.  A bit farther away there are more choices at least.  And it is walkable to nearly nothing of interest for the average tourists.Great look, clean rooms; however probably the first room in 20 years that didn't have a mini fridge. First time at a Fairfield, but an avid Marriott fan. Not the hotel to choose for a week long business meeting. Rooms seem quite small in comparison to competitors. Don't misunderstand, this is not a bad hotel, they are very nice here. I'm just a hotel snob an expect a higher level. HI express is a notch up in value for the dollar if budget is an issue. Louisville Marriott east is the premiere property in the area fir all brands and is only 2-3 min away. I will return to what I know at the Marriott next trip.I've stayed here twice.  Feels relatively new.  Courteous staff.  Proximate to a good range of fast food eateries.  Close to some major highways.  Seemed relatively busy.Pro's-  Feels new and clean-  Good value-  Hi-speed internet also available via ethernet cable (and pretty stable and fast)-  Speakman shower heads-  My room had a tall showerCon's-  My room felt a bit small - almost Manhattan small-  Water pressure not greatDidn't eat the breakfast - had other commitments.Nice new hotel, pretty speedy internet.  Good breakfast, bit far from downtown or it would be 5 starts.Great place to stay with great rates. Free hot breakfast every morning is something you should take advantage of. The hotel decor looks modern and is clean. There's an indoor pool and inviting lobby. Couldn't give it all five stars because of our experience with the staff. They were not hospitable. I would still return.Woohoo is right! When Frontier Air lost my family's luggage (ugh, all the baby gear was stuck in Milwaukee), Rachel from the front desk stepped in to help! She went above and beyond, providing my hubby and me with toiletries, setting up the hotel's portable crib in the dark, and offering to go home and get me diapers and baby clothes!!!Besides the fabulous customer service (seriously, that girl better be running this place next time), the hotel is modern, newly upgraded, clean, and comfortable. The color scheme is super cute (blue, orange, and green--sounds 80s, but it's really spa-ish and organic) and the staff is phenomenal.The Executive King Suite has a sitting room and a sleeping space--it's semi-private and airy. The bathroom is roomy enough for our family of three to scrub up together! This great value coupled with superior amenities will have me as a life-long customer when I'm in town on business.Clean, close to everything.  Great value.Wonderful, clean, friendly!  Nothing more to ask for in a hotel.  Plus free breakfast!

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Louisville Airport & Expo
review_content: Overall a good stay for the price. This was our 6th place to stay over a period of 10 days while traveling cross-country. It was second best to another La Quinta, followed by a close third at Falls Motel in MN.We stayed on a Monday night, easy check in process. We received military pricing at $87+tax.All was clean except hairs (the coarse/curly kind) found on bathroom floor. After letting the staff know, Amanda was apologetic and noted it for cleaning staff to take care of.Our 2-queen beds had 6 pillows each, super clean, comfy and fresh. Fridge, microwave, mini-bar area and huge tv. In-room coffee maker too.Bath/shower closed off by a door, separate from the sink and vanity (and hair dryer). This is handy!Free breaky included coffee/tea/juice, egg and sausage patties, a variety of baked goods, toast, waffles, cereal (hot grits), fruit salad, bananas and yogurt.No extra charge for our small dog.Overall, we recommend this hotel for sure.Overview: This La Quinta Inn & Suites in Louisville is a "okay" 2-star class hotel located next to the I-264 freeway (literally next to the freeway) off the Preston Highway. There is no pet fee, and parking is free. The rooms become oddly humid, some rooms have significant freeway noise, the pool/hot-tub is outdoors, and the nearby restaurants are not the best. See photo below for the view across the street. Pricing is about $100/nightThe Room: With poor sound isolation, a strangely high humidity despite leaving the large-window-A/C on, and a slight odor of old air freshener, the room was nice but not ideal. The king sized bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was well laid out, but the view left a lot to be desired.Conclusions: This La Quinta is an average 2-star hotel located in an area without too many attractions. Though it is positioned near a convenient Aldi supermarket that I liked, and didn't have any glaring problems besides the humidity of the room, I would have chosen a different hotel had I not been traveling with my pet.Overall I'd say a good deal for the price. I liked this one slightly over the one in east Louisville I've stayed at but I'd say the area is better at the east Louisville La Quinta but the breakfast is better here so pick your poison. I will say my room layout was nice, with a wet bar and cabinet space, so this room would have been awesome for the three night stay we just had in Knoxville but the LaQuinta in Knoxville was cleaner and had a better breakfast spread compared to this one. I've never been given goody bags for my pups before so kudos to this hotel for the extra bonus!! It made me and my pups both smile!Front desk clerk was very friendly when we checked in and gave me two treat bags for my two pups when I checked in which included pickup bags for them and two bones which was a nice guest ute I thought. She was friendly to them too and they are German Shepherds which most people are terrified of.My room was clean and I had plenty of hot water (scalding hot water from my shower). I had one of the pet rooms on the first floor since I was traveling with my pups. No problems with smells or stains, my room smelled clean and fresh and I had plenty of towels. Wifi is free but unsecured (no password required).Louiville had just had a foot of snow dumped on it and the parking lot had been plowed and was easy to navigate so the hotel clearly maintains the paking lot. Overall: Better than most La Quintas I've stayed in but not the best. My final impression: a good choice for a stay if you are traveling with your pups.I stayed here one night on May 24th visiting Kentucky Kingdom and Holiday World.   The hotel is clean, everything is great.    However, my price was $94 a night, with taxes that came out to about $120.    At all the other hotels I visited on my trip, the price was about $75 plus taxes.       The other thing, was the shuttle doesn't run until 05:30am.   My flight out was at 6am, so I couldn't return the rental car the previous day and use the shuttle.     Since my flight was so early and I wasn't going to be staying in the room that long, I car camped the night before my flight out, returning the rental car at 4am.    If the shuttle ran at 4am, I would have stayed the night.Whether it's worth it for the hotel to run the shuttle at 4am, I don't know.   But there are flights that leave at 6am.    And please do something about the dogs in the back of the hotel that bark until midnight.    If you stay here, ask for a room on the West side of the building to the far North side on the ground floor.   Then you might not hear the dogs that bark until midnight.This place sucks. My room smelled like dirty old feet. My shower only put out cold water. The bed was rock hard.  I usually have better luck with la Quinta. If I return I sure will not stay again.An okay La Quinta but not as nice as some I have stayed at.  Clerk at desk when I checked in, didn't make me feel welcome.  The room was so-so.  The bed had to be one of the hardest I have ever slept on.  Needs a bit of help on a number of fronts to move higher on the rating.Great hotel especially for the price. Our king room was huge with a mini-kitchen that had a large fridge and microwave. The was plenty of counter space and cupboards. I only wish that the bathroom sink area was larger. Maybe when they remodel they can open the bath sink area by taking up some of the counter space of the kitchen.We were very impressed by the breakfast room and the offerings for food which included waffles and biscuits and gravy. The staff was very helpful and friendly.If we are ever in Louisville again, we will stay here.I drove from Chicago down South with my dog and was looking for a pet friendly hotel to stay at midway through our trip.  After searching online and reading other good reviews, I chose this hotel.  The other positive reviews I've read at various web sites are spot on. The common areas and room was immaculate.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating, and the room rate was very reasonable.  The fact that this hotel does not charge an extra pet deposit fee is a nice bonus.  They have free wi-fi, coffee maker, microwave, and a refrigerator in the room.  The only thing that didn't really impress me was the free breakfast.  However it was free so one can't really complain.  I liked this hotel so much that I re-booked it on my way back to Chicago. If you are looking for a very clean, comfortable and reasonable pet friendly hotel in Louisville KY, this is your place!We stayed here in June 2013. We called the hotel around 10 pm and told them we needed a room when we got into town at midnight.  The staff (Erin) was incredibly nice and helpful. They were very accommodating both over the phone and when we arrived. The staff the following day were very friendly. The room was immaculate, and well kept.The breakfast was well stocked. And most importantly, this is the first hotel I have been to in a long time that had awesome water pressure in the shower. The hotel is just outside the airport, but not as noisy as you would think. I highly recommend this hotel!I chose this hotel because we had our Shih Tzu with us. I LOVE that they accept pets and don't charge extra for them! The breakfast has a very good selection of hot and cold choices. The area was very clean and well organized.I misunderstood when I spoke with the reservations (via 800 number) that our double queen room would have a pull out sofa couch as well. We needed the room but had the little kids sleep on the floor. They offer a roll-away, but there isn't room, in my opinion. ALL off the staff were EXCEPTIONALLY friendly to EVERYONE that I saw, EXCEPT for the guy who works the 2nd shift at the front desk. Very indifferent and acted like I was taking up his time.Overall, a nice hotel, especially for the price.This was a nice place.  We requested a suite but, they were booked and could only get 2 beds.  The location was convenient to airport, right off the expressway and several restaurants.  The room and hotel was clean.  Staff was very friendly.  We had been staying at Drury Inn's on our trip and this I would say was a step under as far as decor but, still a very nice place.  They had a very nice area in the back to walk your dog and lots of  garbage cans which made clean up a breeze.  The breakfast was very good.  The only cons I would say is that at breakfast the garbage was not changed out and food and plates got stacked up on top and it was gross and difficult to dispose of your food.  Also, when I called to make a reservation we specifically mentioned we were bringing a dog and they put us in and adjoining room with a family who also had a dog so the dogs could smell one another from the adjoining door and whined all night.

Stayed here overnight before an early flight at the airport. Excellent hotel! My room was clean and well kept. There were even towel animals in the bathroom!! My only complaint is the walls are thin, so could hear my neighbor. Otherwise, great place to stay and less than 5 minutes from the airport.Have always come to expect a certain level of quality at a Hampton Inn. They are known to be excellent travel hotels with just the right about of amenities. The Hampton inn Louisville airport does not live up to expectations. In the simplest of concerns, it is just dirty. The elevators floors and walls look as if they have not been cleaned in quite some time. There was a trail of drippings leading from the back door to the front door of the elevator and out into the lobby.  This observations occurred at 7am. One would assume that nighttime staff would have some time to clean.  After this trip will be changing locations.This hotel was average quality. Nothing 'horribly gross', but nothing 'omg the best'. The bed and the room were clean and everything but nothing in my room drained. I took a shower, and the next morning the tub was still full of water. I washed my hands and brushed my teeth and the sink held the water. I was only staying one night, so not that big of a deal, but if I was staying several nights this would have been a big problem.Clean we'll run . Most expensive hotel I've ever stayed in for work over 200 a night crazy.  There is really no where to eat dinner. Fast food . Stayed  here for a week for a trade show it was awful had to drive 20 minutes to eat dinner every night.  Next time I will stay 20 minutes away in a suburb with some sports bars and variety of restaurants and nightlife. What's the point of staying next to a trade show if there is no coffee and no restaurants.The jet noise sucks. Very noisey at all hours of the night.They don't have washing machines to do laundry.I'm updating my review. As of three days ago I've received the compensation that I was promised by the front desk staff. Now this is the level of customer service that I had grown accustomed to. I look forward to seeing those smiles the next time that I'm in the Louisville area. Thank you all for making it right.One of our favorite hotels in the area! We visit Louisville once every February/March for a trade show inside the Expo Center, so we're very familiar with the airport area.This location is newly remodeled (within the last year or two) and features a friendly & helpful staff. One of the shuttle drivers even drove us over to Kroger at 10:30p one night for medication. It was late and I know he was tired, but there were no complaints, only a sweet smile.The breakfast selection is always wonderful and a great thing when you're running late to the show!Right by the airport! With that said, you don't notice the jet noise. Nice hotel with clean rooms. Typical Hampton quality and great staff. Not a ton within walking distance to eat but a short drive in any direction gives you lots of choices.Miserable. The jet noise rattles the windows. It is not continuous so that you get used to it, it starts every morning at 3:30 am then every 30 secs. The hotel is nice enough but I wanted to sleep. I now remember why we moved downtown when manning the trade shows at the expo center.If you are sensitive to cigarette smoke smell,  be sure that you ask for a room that was NEVER a smoking room.  All the rooms are now non-smoking, but were not always that way.  I asked for a room on any floor other than the 1st and the room I was assigned was the only one they had.  There were events at the nearby KY Expo Center, so the hotel was completely booked.  Becuase I didn't want to be on the first floor, I had to settle for a room that had the linger of cigarette smoke.  YUCK!The location is great if you have an early flight or get in late from a flight as it nearly abutts the airport.  You do, then, get the sounds of an airport.  The location is also great if you are attending events at the Expo Center, as it is within walking distance.  I saw many walking into the Expo Center the next morning.  The breakfast was varied, including a hot breakfast item.  This was nice -- it was not fancy, but definitely gave me what I needed to get the day started.The most accommodating hotel i've stayed at in a really long time.+1 friendly and helpful staff. From the awesome front desk, the breakfast staff and the maids. Everyone was on point. +1 clean rooms - spacious rooms with comfy bedding and a good shower. Only downside was the lighting as we felt like the bathroom lighting made us look extremely dead pale =P+1 continental breakfast -- not the greatest, but they changed up the hot dishes everyday which was good.+1 for free shuttle service to airport and expo center. They also offered my co-worker a free shuttle ride to the convenience store since it was raining-1 my only complaint was the fact that there was not much stuff to do in the area. A bowling alley across the street and other hotels lined the street. This required us to have to cab it downtown to grab lunch/dinner which got pricey after a while. Next time, we'll consider renting a car.Pretty decent for a Hampton Inn. Very close to the airport and the highway if that's a requirement for you. The downside is it's not all that close to downtown, but if you knew Louisville, I suppose you'd know that. (I didn't) Friendly staff and lots of parking. No complaints.Once again, another Hampton that seems no different from any others.  Clean and friendly staffAnother great Hampton Inn experience. This is an older hotel that has been brought up to the current Hampton Inn standard including their very comfortable beds. Conveniently located between the airport and the Kentucky Expo grounds.

Stayed here one night for business.Exterior:  the grounds appeared to be clean and presentable.  Attempting to get into the parking lot was a bit of a hassle as I came from the freeway and the turn lane was backed up.  Once the turn lane started moving, traffic came from the opposite direction.  It appears there is only one entrance/exit as the other one was blocked off from a side street.  Parking is plentiful, so that's not an issue.Interior:  this building has definitely seen better days.  Paint was peeling or missing from some doors, especially at the front entrance.  The breakfast/dining area is to the left of the main doors and had a fair number of tables and booths.  Large groups are at a disadvantage as there are several columns around which make it difficult to sit comfortably if/when tables are moved around.  Once the elevator door opened, I expected to see a sign directing me towards my room, but I didn't see it.  Once I took the other elevator up, I spotted it.  Room numbers are not placed where you can see them easily when just walking down the hallway.  Some face the opposite direction, some face the hallway, just bad placing throughout.Room:  the room was spacious and clean.  There is a serious lack of plugs for multiple electronic devices, so I had them all over just to get them charged.Staff:  I didn't deal with many of the staff.  From what I noticed, there aren't enough staff for peak periods.  The main desk had 5 people standing at it with one associate, who was trying his best to help them.  There was an individual come out of the back office and then disappeared right back in, though there were now 7 people in the lobby waiting to check in.  The associate was able to disengage himself from the 5 people in front of me and had me checked in within 3 minutes.  I ate at the restaurant, which was filled with people (mostly having drinks) and he was the only staff member I noticed in the area.  Kudos to him for keeping track of it all and staying polite, professional, and courteous.Wi-fi:  absolutely no problems with the wireless!Overall, for a single night, this is not a bad hotel.  It's just not the best either.  The room was comfortable and clean and the food (dinner) was good.  The building needs some care and updating to match some of the other HI properties I've visited.Not Holiday Inn anymore. It's a Cottonwood suites. Dump dump dump. Do everything in your power to not even look at this place when you drive-by. Elevators been down for two days. Fire alarm was going off for three hours when I checked in. Hotel staff might as well not exist. You would be better off sleeping at the Circle K next-door.Hotel room:  Met our needs; clean, modern enough, and I like that they have shampoo and a hair dryer that I've come to take for granted in my selection of hotels.  Bed was king-sized and the bed and pillows were comfortable.  TV sound wouldn't go very loud (don't know if that's on purpose or not).  Curtains aren't full width of window leaving just the sheers in place when the sun comes up.  I'd rather have all my curtain in place, thank you very much.Staff:  pleasant and courteous.  Management may want desk staff to be just a "little" bit more cautious; however.  We locked ourselves out of our room and all we had to do was say for what room we wanted a new key... hmmm.    The restaurant server was very gracious.  We had neglected to pay -- meaning someone in my party signed the check but neither gave a credit card nor put the room number on it.  When we came downstairs to check-out, she kindly pointed out that maybe we forgot to put the room number on the check.  She was so sweet about our mistake.Restaurant:  Meh.... Pancakes weren't that great (but, to be honest, I've become extremely picky now that we make our own from scratch).  But, I do have a bone to pick about advertising on the menu that they serve maple syrup with the pancakes.  Those little self-encased containers say "Mrs. Butterworth's original syrup".  Nowhere does it claim itself to be maple syrup.  Sorry; it's the snob in me since I lived in New England and they would advertise "real" maple syrup when it was available.Price:  We bid on our hotel via Priceline so it was a good deal and, yes, the location was where I wanted/needed it to be for this trip.Location:  If your goal is to be in the southend of Louisville, then the location is fine.  It is close to the Watterson Expressway (I-264) and all kinds of amenities are on Dixie Highway near the hotel from gas stations to pharmacies to fast food and sit down restaurants.Nice clean room. Friendly staff. Easy to get to, close to the freeway. Close to Iroqouis Amphitheater which was good for us in town for a concert.Clean bed. Clean hotel in general. Professional, courteous, and efficient staff. Super convenient to 265 and airport. Not a super nice area but a decent value if you aren't using any of the amenities. 15 minutes or so from U of L campus.A CVS and Walgreens close by but don't expect a lot of food choices in the area if you are used to big-city dining. Food at the hotel and in the surrounding area is strictly middle-America and should come with a side of Lipator and insulin. Not saying that the cheese grits and biscuits at the hotel were bad, far from it, they were SUPER awesome, but I should only eat them every other year.Nice clean place to stay!This hotel has been around for a while but has been maintained very well. Spacious rooms, flat screen, and comfortable beds. This is a nice place to stay.UPDATE: After my complaint to the corporate website, my fellow traveler and I had a conversation with the manager of this hotel (pursuant to our call for fresh towels). He was very, very apologetic and wanted to make sure that the rest of our stay was very much improved. He identified with us on a personal level and went out of his way to make up for the tragedy that was our first three days. I've added a star for his personal attention and I'll update again after our stay._____________________________OK...This is a very pricey hotel for a "motel" experience. Not to be picky, but our room smells like beachhouse, the decor is very early '90s, there's no microwave or fridge, the one-cup coffeemaker leaks everywhere, maid service is sporadic, continental breakfast was not included, wifi is only in the lobby (though they're working on expanding the wifi to all floors), and the neighborhood isn't the best. When we got in, none of the lamps worked. Apparently the hotel has a problem with vandals. Visitors routinely steal lightbulbs and pull other pranks. What I discovered is that all of the plug outlets are so old that the plugs just fall out of them. I'm glad I brought a car charger.The wired connection wasn't working when I got in and it took two maintenance calls and a phone call to tech support before they would listen to me. Convo: Me: "I think there's something wrong with the router." Maintenance Man #1: "What's a router?" Me: "The box. I think there's something wrong with the box." Maintenance Man #1: "No there's not. The lights are all on." Me: I travel a lot and use wired internet frequently. My computer is working fine. I think there is something wrong with the box. Look at the diagnostics printout I did." Maintenance Man #1: You're going to have to call the number. Where's your information card? Oh you don't have one. I'll get it..." The tech support spent an hour getting me to reset the router, which I'd kind of done already because the power cord kept falling out of the wall. Then, when that miraculously didn't fix the problem, they promised to send an "engineer." Maintenance Man #2 was kind enough to admit he didn't know anything about computers and brought me a new "box." PROBLEM SOLVED. I guess the worst part was how rude the front desk was when I called about it. The lady thought I was calling about the wifi and got into a nasty argument with me about the whole thing. I guess that's what happens when you don't actually listen to what the customer is asking about. And at that point, my frustration level was actually fairly low so I don't think I was the rude one!Not to knock all the staff. The young woman that checked us in on Saturday was very efficient and sweet, and I greatly appreciate Frank for getting me the new box. And our room was very clean.So, yeah, $1,300 for 7 days? I don't think so!! Worst Holiday Inn experience so far.Gentlemen at front desk was very friendly when I checked in and rest of staff very pleasant when passed by in hallway.  This is a very old holiday inn that has some renovations, but definitely could use more!  Also, not best part of town to be staying, but was never bothered!  HUGE complaint though about dry cleaning.  Left my dry cleaning night before to make sure it was there in enough time.  Came back to pick it up next day and was told contract wasn't renewed with dry cleaner so did not get done and would have to wait until tomorrow!  Only thing offered as "customer service" was free breakfast!  If you are looking for place to lay your head, this is the place.  Want above and beyond customer service...go somewhere else!It did its job. The staff was overwhelmingly friendly, the room was clean, pool maintained and though it seemed to be on the edge of a seedy neighborhood, the parking lot was secure. My family enjoyed the experience and I would stay there again if it worked into my travel schedule. Once again, the thing that makes it most memorable was the friendly, helpful attitude of the staff.Not the best hotel I've ever stayed at, but I didn't have any problems. Staff was nice and brought us extra towels within a couple minutes of asking. If you have business around Shivley area, airport, fair grounds, Churchill downs, or Expo5 it is perfect! Several restaurants, and other stores in the area, for conscience factor! Rooms were clean and well maintained!

Let's be honest. I picked this hotel because it was relatively close to (20 minutes) the Kentucky Derby Marathon and was priced right. Easy to find and a breeze to check into. My only complaint was the ever-so-tempting list of happy hour drink specials taunting me from the check-in desk. Any other night, I would have been in the very welcoming-looking bar with a cocktail (or three) in hand.The front desk attendant was efficient and, when she noticed a man walk up, made a point of telling me where I could find my room number written, rather than speaking it aloud. Nice touch I hadn't thought of. Housekeeping missed the pile of used towels from the previous guests, but the front desk handled it like a dream when I called to request a fresh set of towels. I said "no rush", but a well dressed and very polite gal showed up almost instantly. Moments later, another brought vouchers for complementary cocktails and apps. When everything else is the same (beds, running water...), it comes down to the people.Our overall experience was positive and for the price of $89+tax it was a decent value for a HGI.  The lobby was spotless and we were warmly greeted by the front desk staff.  Pros: The room was clean and free Wi-Fi included. A small bar is in the hotel lobby, which is a nice convenience to the guests who wish to have a drink. Of course the prices are higher, but it is a nice amenity. Location, Location, Location. The hotel is in the middle of a fabulous shopping complex.  Cons: The hot tub was closed by order of the health department (hmm?). A buffet breakfast was available for purchase for $9.99 each.  No options were available for the traveler who would like a quick bite/to-go.  The bed was ok.  Since HGI and Hampton Inns are owned by the same umbrella corporation, HGI should look at incorporating the bedding from HI.Friendly staff. Clean rooms.  The location isn't as close to downtown as one might hope. But...the location is close to shopping,  food,  grocery and freeway.I chose this hotel based on the proximity to the Norton Brownsboro Hospital, literally a 3 minute drive. It is also located behind a large shopping center which features many restaurants and the much needed Starbucks.PROS: Clean, great location, free wi-fiCONS: Pricey...$189 a night  and no complimentary breakfastI've heard there is a big convention in town, perhaps that's why the price is so high. In a nutshell I think this place is A-OK, no complaints. I would stay here again if I need to come back to see the great doctors at Norton's.Not the best Hilton I've ever stayed at but the location is great. My husband stays here often for business and when we (myself and two small kids) travel with him this offers a great location and a nice pool.  Great new shopping center and restaurants (including Starbucks!) is within walking distance, there is a grocery across the street (great perk when traveling with small kids), and downtown Louisville is only about 25 minutes away.Next time I am in Louisville, I will most likely stay here. I would give the hotel a 5 star rating, but would like to have received more assistance with recommendations of things to do while in town from the staff. Absolutely no complaints about the property at all. Friendly staff, nice spacious rooms, clean pool, hot tub, bathrooms, great lobby and dining areas, and very modern decor throughout! I was also very impressed that my sister and her small group were allowed to come over from across town, as we booked separate hotels for a convention, and staff allowed them to hang out at the pool for a while with us. They also allowed us to use the pool a little longer than the noted close time. Very appreciative, since we are not from the Louisville area, and didn't realize the distance between our two hotels!  Would love to see them on Twitter so I can share the love! p.s. HGI staff, if you are reading, feel free to ask for my assistance! @nickilaycoaxOh Conrad how you woo me. Oh Conrad, yes I'll stay the night, but you're sleeping on the pull out. Your hospitality competition in The Holiday Inn (on Hurstbourne) was blocked off for a wedding I was coming to town for. Then, while stuck in traffic I thought: "hmmm, Mr. Holiday, could you really be better than ole man Conrad?" And lo! the Holiday Inn that we planned for is getting 2 stars on Yelp and there were the immortal words: "bed bugs," and "blood." And when those two phrases used together or separately have me running back into the terry-clothed arms of Conrad. We found this HGI on Yelp, we called, answer immediately, with open arms, they have a King room available and for early check in. This HGI is either really new or has undergone all the modern updates. Squeaky clean with plush pillows high thread count sheets. A new iron in the room. If we were staying any longer I would have found myself in the fireside front waiting area with the leather empire chairs and Hi Def TV. This place is located behind the monstrosity that is a mall, "The Summit," so enter through the parking lot and weave all the way to the back. Needless to say I was driving into Louisville fearing "blood on the comforter," and "case of the bed bugs," at Holiday Inn, and then Conrad with his Garden Inn swoops in and saves the day with a slick, simple, comfortable, same price ($99) stay instead.This is a good HGI - pretty much the standard, good service and facility.I guess the one thing to mention is that the hotel is not the easiest to get to - it's off the highway (which gets very congested in the morning/evening rush hour, just FYI), and then you have to go through or around a little shopping mall area.  It was dark(ish) and I was tired, and so actually getting to the hotel took a few twists and turns.But then, I got there.  And oh, the beds.  Nice. :)I live here in Louisville so I do not stay here but sometimes use the business services and wifi (with permission of course). The staff couldn't be nicer, very clean public areas. Would certainly stay at this chain anywhere based on this location.This is a very nice hotel and offers both free wired and wireless access to the Internet that connects very well at decent speeds.But when I tried to hook up my laptop to the wide-screen TV it refused to let me change the source input.  The system would always change itself back to the pay-per-view preview channel.  Screw that! I want to watch my on content rather than pay Hilton more money for the few choices they offer.  I would recommend this hotel to business or geek travelers but I CAN'T!  Locking down the TV's input options is a deal breaker for me.  I know from experience that there are plenty of other hotels that don't do this that I can go to for less money per night.Well, after 50 years of being comfortably ensconced at "home" whenever I came to visit my parents-my Mom moved into a condo, necessiating "relocating" my family on visits to this hotel. First, if you are from/connected to the east end of Louisville, you will not believe the development out KY 22 past Ballard High School. The hotel itself was fine. The room had the heaviest door known to man-and I travel a lot professionally. Hotel was clean. Pool was nice albeit small- though they were slow to clean it up in the mornings from the prior evening on a weekend. My biggest gripe is they ran my folio through in the middle of the afternoon prior to our departure leading me to have a conniption and overdrawn on an account as I was planning on paying from a differnet bank account. The staff handled the problem but be forwarned "that is their policy" and make sure you give them the credit card you want to charged from.Other than that, it would be nice if they offered free breakfast for the rate they charge which was just $10 less than I paid in Chicago on this trip at a hotel right off Michigan Avenue.very nice , very well kept, in a very nice area, lots of shopping and restaraunts, pool was great, not crowded at all, warm cookies at the front desk , the only 2 issues are the bar closed at like 10 pm on a saturday nite !!!! during march madness? and the other issue was the girls softball team who were in town thought that everyone in the hotel wants to be woken up by loud mouthed teenage girls , and that the parents who were watching these girls would have had the courtesy to tell them to keep the noise down at 5 am , but hey todays generation are full of rude teenagers who think the world owes them everything

I'm a basic person and its your average hotel - clean with a super comfy bed and pillows plus your average tv, desk, fridge, and coffee. I'm super down with the continental hot breakfast and there are several coffee varieties prepared and ready all throughout the day in the lobby. We stayed in the conference room as well, and it was pretty good. No complaints. And very nice for a price that is quite cheaper than other places.Just okay for a Fairfield property, likely would not stay again.First, this is an older property and is split with Springhill Suites - the same building with interconnecting floors, but separate entrances and check ins. The floor layouts are quite wonky - the wayfinding isn't great so its very easy to cross over to the other hotel and end up in the wrong lobby by mistake. The only real clue is the color change in the carpet - Springhill is green and Fairfield is orange.Second, as a few others have noted the A/C does not work well. I had it turned down to 65 yet it never got any colder than 74 in my room. Mind you, it was not a hot day so imagine what things would be like in high summer! I didn't check in until after 9pm and frankly, I was exhausted or I would have asked to be moved or for someone to fix it. On the plus side, I really did not hear any traffic noise despite the hotel being near the expressway.Third, the shower stall in my bathroom was gross! There was definite mold in the corners and part of the floor looked just plain dirty. I was tempted to wear my sandals, so it wasn't good.On the positive side, the staff I interacted with was very pleasant and the free breakfast was about what I'd expect from Fairfield (decent). Wifi is free and wasn't the fastest but I was able to connect. Again, had I arrived earlier I definitely would have asked for a room change but ultimately my first impression was "definitely staying somewhere else next time, especially for $189/night!!"My usual hotel was sold out due to a convention, so I ended up staying at the Fairfield Inn. I had a very pleasant stay. My room was not spacious, but that's not something I care a whole lot about. The bed and pillows, which I do care about, were very comfortable. The room was clean and tidy, and the housekeepers did a great job of keeping it that way throughout my visit. My first night was a little loud because the hotel was filled with a teenage baseball team. It was a lot quieter after they left. I always appreciate the little things, like having plenty of outlets. The hotel provided a small hub with two A/C outlets and two USB ports. My geeky husband and I really appreciated that, with our two cell phones, a Kindle, and laptop between us.A strong hotel for the price but about two blocks in the wrong direction of downtown. Not having a restaurant here makes you have to go out for dinner but please do not walk around too late. Complimentary breakfast in the morning for everyone.Good indoor pool for children with full windows outside. Parking is split between outside and inside and though they have spots "reserved" for Marriott Elite members; the front desk noted they do not check if Elite members are parked there or not.The staff are very kind and attentive and since I'm working late hours, I appreciate delivery can come right to my hotel door instead of me having to go down to the lobby.My only issue with this hotel is the knat problem in their dining room. I was having a glass of wine and working and had to leave after 3 minutes because of the bugs. The moment I left my wine glass out of my hands, 6 nats where on the glass having their party.Nice, clean hotel. I stayed there for a conference at the Louisville Convention center, which is a short two block walk. Staff was helpful and room was quiet, which isn't always the case in many hotels.We had a great experience. We were traveling with my parents. My Dad accidentally dropped the keys in the vehicle. They wound up so far underneath the console we could not reach them. Mark at the Fairfield got a socket set out of his vehicle and assisted me with removing the colsole to get the keys. It was at night, and nearing zero outside. Mark could have just said "sorry about your luck" but went above and beyond in helping. Hotel smelled clean. Rooms were very nice, very clean. Quiet. All of the Staff were very nice. Breakfast not that great, but it's not a restaurant. Parking was convenient.Everything. Everything was great. Especially for the price. Hotel staff was very kind, room was very cleaned. Cleaned it while we were out and about and I can back to my clothes neatly folded and my things organized nicely. The woman who cleaned the rooms left us some towel art that looked like a dog, which I thought was super cool. If I'm ever in Louisville again I will stay there. The breakfast was great, with a waffle maker to make your own waffles! The coffee was always hot and pretty good, especially compared to what I have gotten from other hotels. I'm very pleased with everything and will stay again if I need to!Stayed here for Thunder weekend. Staff was friendly but our AC was broke all weekend. 80+ degrees  in Louisville and no AC, yea.When I brought it to their attention that it hadn't been fixed, I was told I was the person who was wrong. I can't sleep because it's too hot in my room and I'm apparently the one who is wrong.Despite some friendly greetings, staff is horrendous at addressing guest issues. I strongly suggest staying elsewhere. My father is a loyal Marriott member and I couldn't disagree with him more on the level of service and satisfaction for the price point.Excellent hotel for the price - great location and clean, very spacious rooms.Decent breakfast - the breakfast lady was REALLY friendly :)For the price it's pretty nice. Staff were extremely friendly, every single one of them. Room was large and clean. Breakfast food was ok, I'm sure it's due to there limited cooking options, but for free it is a deal. Breakfast staff was so pleasant though it totally made up for the heat and serve food.I stayed at this Fairfield Inn on a recent trip to Louisville.  Marriott is one of the brands I prefer to stay at when I'm on the road.  This one certainly didn't let me down.  The hotel is located right downtown and is co-located with another Marriott property, SpingHill Suites.I was afraid that parking would be a problem (as it often is with downtown locations), but they have a guest registration parking right out front.  The hotel also has a parking deck and private lot.  The lobby is the standard Fairfield inn package.  It's clean and inviting.  The guy behind the desk was friendly and welcoming.  He checked me in quickly and was able to help me with some local information.  This is a great location, as it's only three blocks from Fourth Street Live, which is Louisville's restaurant and entertainment district.  It's a short walk, and I never felt unsafe walking between the hotel and Fourth Street Live.  The rooms, while not that spacious and very clean and serviceable.  Housekeeping does a great job with keeping the rooms neat and tidy.  I was pleasantly surprised to come back to my room one night and found that my housekeeper had made some "towel art" and left it on my bed.  The bed was very comfortable and the room comes with a flat screen TV, and a desk to work at.  There are plenty of electrical outlets around the desk for all my devices that need charging at night.  All of the furniture was in good condition too.  The air conditioning worked very well.All of the employees were very friendly and accommodating.  The breakfast host was very friendly and always smiling, the front desk staff were all very nice too.  This was a great place to stay during my trip to Louisville.   This was a great hotel.  I will certainly stay here again the next time I visit Louisville.Large Clean Room, a short walking distance to YUM Center, Love the convieance for concert however no bar for a late night snack or drink! They have a cooler you can purchase from but totally lacking a full service bar!Booked a room for Valentine's Weekend. Room was quite overpriced and very small. The connecting room was very noisy. Luckily this was a pleasure trip and I wasn't in town for work. Very small TV, maybe 19". Bed felt quite lumpy and there was no internet. I'm no decorator; but the colors made my eyes hurt. The rooms you view online must be at a different property. Also, is an additional fee that wasn't mentioned until check in. This hotel is in the same building as another hotel. You must walk through one to get to the other. All in all, the room was clean, the bed sucked, the linen was rough and temperature couldn't be controlled.I probable should have known this based on the price but these guys left out a few things that we have all come to expect in a hotel...a frig and internet. I was surprised that there is no frig and that internet is at additional costs. I did expect parking to be at an additional costs though. Having said that, there is a free internet option that I am currently using to post this. Hopefully its good enough for light duty  (or I'm out of here). I'll update this post tomorrow after I've been here and had a chance to look over the place. First impression is good though.Stayed at Fairfield for the 2013 Ironman and they were fantastic.Upon arrival, they informed me that they'd have water and Gatorade available at the front desk for the duration of my stay. Other thoughtful gestures: they offered grease rags for if I needed to clean my bike; they had me park in the lower level so as to ensure that the parking garage gate didn't close on my bike rack; they had bag breakfasts available beginning Saturday evening all the way into the early Sunday morning hours so that we could have something on race day; they kept breakfast open late on Monday, the day after the race, because they knew people would be slow getting up; they had race maps and materials at the front desk; they served complimentary beer, water and Gatorade to finishers as they returned to the hotel Sunday afternoon/evening. The staff was very responsive and the rooms were typical of a Fairfield. I highly recommend that Ironman athletes consider staying here as it's only a few blocks from transition, the finish, and the swim start.We stayed here for one night in July in a king room using points.Pros: good water pressure, clean, big room, surprisingly quiet overall in the room (lots of children in the building)! Staff was friendlyCons:While I normally ignore the hotel decor in the lobby and halls as I don't generally agree with Marriott's combinations, this seemed particularly awful. Too many colors and patterns like they put together what was on sale. The rooms aren't much better.The shower only had one small place for your soaps. Definitely tight for even the travel size shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. I had to put mine on the floor No refrigeratorThe sockets in the lamp were really lose making it impossible to keep a connection and charge devices.Towels are roughOdd: Its great that they have parking on the premises but it's odd: because of the various entry points you could end up going through three checkpoints where you have to swipe your room key to get to the next part of the lotI remain a loyal Marriott fan, and a fan of most Fairfield Inn Properties. This facility was nice and very well located in downtown Louisville. My only gripe is that I originally was going to say only one night. When I used my Marriott app to cancel and book the room for two nights, my nightly rate went up $10 per night. So I went with two reservations figuring I could get it straightened out when I checked in. Unfortunately, one reservation was for 2 queens and the other for 1 king with a cot. I asked if I could keep either room for two nights and they said no, they'd have to move me after the first night. So, we left after the first night.The hotel itself was very nice. The hotel is in good shape and had a modern design. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. When we got there, they had sold-out of the other rooms and we were placed in a handicap room. We didn't mind except for a few minor changes in the bathroom. The hotel is one of the cheaper non-motel kind of places in louisville, but is still not cheap. The location is good enough. In walking distance to 4th st live and a few other places downtown. We were told by various people when we got there though that the better place to go for night life was bards town st which we were quite some ways away from (probably need to take a cab to get there). The only downside for us was that Louisville was a complete ghost town on a Monday night! It seems like the whole city closes and there is no one walking around or even bars open past midnight. We had never seen anything like it in such a large city. The hotel staff was super great though! We checked in with them the next morning to see if we could cancel our reservation for that night and check out without any penalties. We thought they probably wouldn't do it, but they were sold-out that evening, so they were very flexible and accommodating and let us cancel our reservation for no penalty so that we could move on to a different city and enjoy our vacation. We would definitely stay here again!

This is a fine hotel located in a nice garden setting within quick driving distance of many major attractions, malls, and restaurants in Louisville.  Our lodging here during a two-night stay was in a very fine one-bedroom king suite, which boasted a contemporary flat-screen TV, comfortable sofa, writing desk, and wet bar.  On the ground floor was a fairly large indoor swimming pool and separate hot whirlpool spa with vigorous back-soothing jets.  A daily hot breakfast was also included in the reasonable room price.    Hotel staff were helpful and accommodating.
