The printer in the community lounge area was broken and a new one still on order, so an attendant at the front desk graciously printed our boarding passes for us without charge.  I will readily stay here again when next traveling to Louisville, which I found to be a city imbued with a thoroughbred's high level of breeding, and remarkable dining that embraces both fine and humble fare.I admit, I booked this hotel for two reasons. Its location immediately next to my office and it's a Marriott property. Luckily the hotel didn't disappoint, however that's not to say that the hotel wasn't without a few minor issues. SpringHill Suites, is a moderate- tier hotel compared to other Marriott properties, however its only lacking when compared to other brands under the Marriott name. The room itself was spacious, with a large seating area with a comfortable sofa with a wet bar complete with a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. Located immediately behind the wet bar is a large desk which has plenty of workspace to catch up on some work or just browse the web. Wi-Fi is free and available, however I didn't see any wired connections. The TV is actually located in the middle of the living area and the bedroom, which makes it a little awkward. The bed itself was large and comfortable however the pillows were just not right. Another problem is that the AC unit is located directly next to the bed, which makes you want to just pull up all the covers on you just to stay comfortable. The bathroom itself was large, with the sink separate from the rest of the shower and toilet, which was a nice touch. Breakfast is also available however it is limited to eggs, sausage, and oatmeal as your only hot items. There is a toaster available, if you want toast however unlike other properties you will not find a waffle maker here. Fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt, and mini muffins are also available so you can still grab a quick meal on your way out the door. SpringHill Suites does offer a decent value, however I feel that they are geared more towards a short stay. I still prefer Residence Inn as they tend to offer the most value to me on extended business trips.Wtf Springhill?! Your pull out beds are useless because when unfolded it creates a complete barrier for the other half of the room. It's an obvious violation to the fire code.I am currently staying at this hotel and, unfortunately, I must give it a bad review.  The primary reason for this is that this is another one of those hotels that gives you nice-looking big lumpy pillows that are practically impossible to sleep on because they keep you neck & head at a minimum 45 deg. angle.When I entered the room, the light did not work so I had to fumble around in the dark to find a light.  The air conditioner was on cool (and the room really cold) even though it is below freezing outside.  The shower was good at least and all the plumbing functioned well.  The shower head plumbing was not well fixed to the wall studs so it moved around way too much (maintenance issue).Lastly, the breakfast was not brought out on time.  It was 5 minutes late, but that should not happen.I was disappointed.  The hotel is nice enough, but it falls short in a few key areas.The hotel looks very nice.  It seems the hotel was renovated to modernize the look and feel.  The problem is the modern looks are fighting the function of a hotel room.  My wife and I were baffled by a few key points:1. There is no dresser.  You have no place to unpack clothes to.2. There is nowhere to set anything - no counter in the bathroom, no dresser, no coffee table, etc.  3. The TV was positioned such that it could not be comfortably viewed from the couch or the bed.  In fact, we moved the entire TV stand as far the cable would allow (maybe 4 or 5 feet) and it still wasn't enjoyable.  4. The breakfast area was far too small and didn't have enough space for more than a small handful of people to eat.  The breakfast was mediocre at bestThe hotel simply didn't feel comfortable.  We had no desire to stay and checked out early to go check into another hotel the next night.This is particularly disappointing as a Marriott Rewards member considering the hotel was just bumped up to Category 5 when it should probably rate at Category 3.Such a cute hotel!! Staff was incredibly friendly! My stay here was very comfortable. The rooms are a decent size and it was very very clean. Will definitely stay here again when I visit Louisvile next year!I reserved the room through Frontier airlines (so it was already paid for) for a one night stay. The room was nice and the staff was friendly. BUT a few days later I noticed that they charged me for the room not realizing that I had already paid through Frontier. I understand mistakes happen so I called and the lady I spoke with said she will have to get a manager to refund the charge and will call me back the following day. Three days and no call so I call them back and they get my card information to refund the charge and assured me that the refund will be reflected on my account in 1-2 days. More days pass and still nothing. Called them back again today and it looks like they never even attempted the refund but promised to try again and will call me in a few days... this is very unprofessional and negligent. I shouldn't have to call several times a week and continuously remind them that they need to refund a charge made in error. Terrible customer service.Very clean and friendly staff at this hotel. Stayed here during the KY derby. It was about 12 miles away. I would stay here again if needed. Love Marriott.Couldn't have been a better spot for a family with two twins under two. We arrived late on Thanksgiving and were warmly greeted and as we entered our room to our surprise they had already set up two high quality pack n plays for our girls to slumber in.  As we awake in the morning we went downstairs for the complimenatry breakfast which was actually pretty darned good and made our life much easier as there were great options for our girls including oatmeal, fresh fruit and yogurt. The only downside was that we didn't like the pillows on the bed but because the overall experience was so good we'll just bring out own next time as well as our bathing suits. Well done SpringHill! We'll be back!Clean and nice updated Springhill - seemed to be in better shape then the other couple of Marriott chains in the area, so I am glad we landed here. Friendly staff, nice hot tub, small pool though. Easy access on and off the highway to get to downtown Louisville quickly without paying to stay downtown.As a side note - you should be warned. The toilet has the handle on the LEFT SIDE!!! It doesn't seem bad now... but spend four nights there and you will understand my suffering. Its just weird!New, very clean.  Great staff.  Love the bedroom with the little kitchen.  Free breakfast and internet too.Wonderful place to stay. Neat and bug free. Amazing breakfast and treatment. such a nice place for very reasonable pricing. Book in advance for better deals. Very close to lot of places. PF changs, starbucks, indian restaurants n other restaurants are very close. Very good location and quiet place to stay. Most facilities are available including free breakfast and internet. There is a pool and work out area. I would stay again.

hotel_name: 1888 Historic Rocking Horse Manor B & B
review_content: This is without a doubt the BEST bed and breakfast EVER!When we arrived, Ricardo, one of the owners, gave us the amazing grand tour of this beautiful house.  He was extremely helpful and assisted us in how to begin our Louisville journey.  The historic background and the restoration of this home will definitely pique your interest.  The common area on the third floor has a refrigerator for guests to use.  There are also complementary drinks in it for your enjoyment.  The first floor had complementary chips, cookies, and fruit if you need a snack while you are here.We stayed in Chelsea's Garden room and it was clean and comfortable.  The claw foot tub was very cool and the shower pressure was great.  The thing I loved the most about this place is the courtyard.  There is so much to see in Louisville but you have to have some relaxation time.  There is nothing better than this courtyard for relaxing with a glass of wine.  John, the other owner, has worked very hard on creating this "garden of eden" so the guests can enjoy their visit.  I brought plastic cups for my wine and he insisted on bringing me a wine glass.  Everyone knows wine tastes better in glass, but some people frown upon glass as it breaks occasionally and causes a mess.Breakfast choices were between egg dishes or pancakes.  The first morning we chose souffle.  It was a two course breakfast.  There was yogurt with fruit and granola and a banana muffin for the first course.  The second course was an egg and cheese souffle with ham and hash browns.  The food was fantastic.  Not only are they amazing host but they can cook.Ricardo and John are incredible and will do everything to make sure your stay is incredible.Stayed here with a guy I was seeing, for my Birthday.Wonderful bed and breakfast.. Very friendly informative staff, beautiful architecture, restored Victorian mansion, lovely romantic suite, pink hottub!!, beautiful city.... A bit pricey -more than a hotel, but definitely worth it. Highly recommend if you're staying in Louisville for a night.I wish I could have stayed here all week. My husband and I arrived exhausted, coming from Pittsburgh. The owners made us feel at home immediately and gave us a tour of the house, pointing out historical facts, and the location of complimentary cookies. The house is full of interesting decorations and beautiful stained glass, with little touches like a bottle of port and dozens of rocking horses. There is a lovely library that was once a gentlemen's smoking room, and a charming formal dining room. There is a courtyard in the back with a porch and plenty of greenery where I could have imagined sitting with a typewriter all afternoon a hundred years ago. On the top floor, there is a more informal, laid back sitting room with free waters and soda, as well as board games and movies. I spent about a half hour wandering around with my camera with plenty of interesting things to shoot.We stayed in the Irish Rose room, a small but comfortable room with a full-size bed. It had stained glass and a private balcony over the front of the house. The shower was high pressure, and everything was very clean. Where the Rocking Horse most excelled was in the details. Good-quality liquid soap in the shower, a corkscrew on the chest of drawers, a scale in the wardrobe. All the little things that you have at home but not on the road that, when present while traveling, make life a lot easier. We had breakfast in the morning in the dining room, and it was to-die-for. There was a choice of quiche or french toast, and we both ordered the quiche. The first course was yogurt with granola and what I believe was a sweet cheese strudel type bread. The second course was the quiche, which was crispy on the outside and fluffy inside. It was served with sauteed potatoes, finely diced, which were equally flavorful. The owners went out of their way to make sure I had decaf coffee, and everything was served with coffee and/or tea, orange juice and water.Owners Jon and Ricardo gave us advice on where to eat and what to do and see. Jon recommended Shakespeare in the Park and a visit to St. James Square to see the gas lamps and fountain among dozens of beautiful Victorian houses--just a 10-15 minute walk from the Rocking Horse.Definitely one of the most luxurious places I have stayed, and for a wonderful price.If you have tried B&B's after having practically lived on road and staying in a multitude of hotels you probably understand the allure of a good B&B. Rocking Horse Manor is a great one. A comfortable, conveniently located oasis in Louisville. John and Ricardo are gracious hosts and provide nice touches for an enjoyable stay. Historical elegance with a nod to modern conveniences, i.e., glass enclosed walk-in shower with two shower heads, dual sink vanity, jacuzzi-style tub, and even a bidet in Grand Victorian Suite bathroom! Stay here and you'll want to come back when staying in Louisville.We love this place and we're locals! Spent Valentines, New Years Eve and other occasions when we don't feel like traveling far. They make the best breakfast, and we have been able to try different rooms.We also like the upstairs reading room. Last time we were there I realized the next day that I left my cell phone charger. And sure enough they found it, and I didn't have to wait at all when I went to retrieve it. They are gracious hosts who truly understand hospitality.  It is a beautiful, memorable place in a charming part of Louisville. Look no further -- this is where you want to be!What a wonderful place to stay.  Beautiful, comfortable accommodations with a breakfast to die for.  The hosts are friendly and very knowledgeable tour guides; of their own property and Old Louisville.  This is a must-stay place.My girlfriend made me research B&B reviews and prices for 2 hours.  Just save yourself the time and pick this one.  It is the best B&B we have ever seen.  The mansion is amazingly restored and decorated with attention to details.  Our room was clean, quiet, and cozy.  The breakfast was delicious and we are both people that enjoy fine foods.  Their website needs work, but then again you're not staying at a website.  The location is close to down town Louisville. We walked the area and saw some great homes and architecture.  Again... just save yourself the time and go with the Rocking Horse Manor.  It's the best.We have been to a LOT of B&B's but NONE compare...We first stayed here 7 years ago and fell in love with Old Towne Louisville and the Rocking Horse Manor.  John & Ricardo actually allowed us to get married in their parlor!  We have returned every year since.  The accommodations are beautiful, the hospitality incomparable.  John and Ricardo treats their guest just like family!LOVED staying here!!! Came in to town not knowing too much about Louisville, other than the fact it's the derby capital of the world. Jon and Ricardo gave us a gorgeous room to stay in. Very private. We pretty much had the place to ourselves while vacationing there, and the owners were always around to help us out if need be. Except once, but they warned us they were going away for a few hours...A very scary tornado came through Louisville during our stay at the Rocking Horse, and Jon and Ricardo happened to be out then. Being dumb Californians (inexperienced in tornado happenings), we battered down in fear and excitement (with bed comforters and wine) under the centuries old staircase in the "lobby".  Those sirens outside were terrifying! The electricity went out. Guests were saying it was passing right through us. Ahhhhhh!!! Well, the storm passed, without any harm. We felt like idiots, making a reeeeeeally big deal of the situation, but Jon and Ricardo made us feel ok about it.Fantastic breakfasts, comfy night's rest, and in a great location to see all the fun Louisville sights!The owners Jon and Ricardo could not have made the stay any better. They gave us a free room upgrade, breakfast was delicious. When we asked for a dinner recommendation, they sent us to a neighborhood in louisville that was exactly what we were looking for. To top it off, the actual house is a wonder by itself. Next time I find myself in Louisville, I know where I will be staying. The service, atmosphere, and price beat out all the hotels we looked into.I had a wonderful weekend stay here over Valentine's Day.  The owners Jon and Ricardo were extremely friendly and offered lots of suggestions for things to see in the area, as well as map and directions.  We had two choices for breakfast each morning: one sweet (pancakes or waffles) and one savory (quiche).  All the choices were delicious.  They served breakfast in an adorable dining room with formal china and glasses.  The rooms were really cute and extremely spacious.  They were also very well-priced.  Because of its name, the inn is decorated with rocking horses scattered around (I counted at least 9 in the public rooms).  For some reason, they also decorated with old-fashioned shoes, which was pretty funny.  If I were ever in Louisville again, I would definitely stay here.

So impressed with this hotel! From the friendly employees at the check in desk to the spacious suite with great kitchenette, we very much enjoyed our stay! We will be recommending this hotel to our friends and family!We were in town for a wedding and stayed here this past weekend. We were impressed with the room. We were in a suite on the 4th floor and it was very nice. The bed was comfy, the breakfast each morning was great, and it was very clean. The surrounding area was nice, as well. The only thing that was a bit of a drag was the lady at the desk on Saturday afternoon and Sunday. She was not very friendly. My husband is a Diamond member and when we were walking out the door on Saturday to go to another hotel to hang out w/ family at the pool, my husband asked if he was supposed to get any water bottles as usually Hilton hotels give that and cookies to their Diamond members. She continued to ask him a few questions, even after he said there were not any in the room. She was a bit short about it. She should have happily gave him water bottles when he started asking about them, being a Diamond member. Then on Sun, when he was checking us out, he asked about the $100 pending charge (we used points for our stay) and she asked him if he trashed the room. No? Well, then you'll get your fee back. Obviously she was joking, but she had a funny way about it. Just not a very friendly employee.Very disappointed in the customer service. I called to book a room and the gentleman that answered the phone was very rude. A little kindness and humility go a long way. I will take my business elsewhere.We stayed here July m2015 and had a two bedroom suite. Except for some crumbs in the kitchen area and a little dirt/hair in the bathroom this would have been five starts. Five more minutes of cleaning a its five stars.I am so impressed with this Homewood Suites so far. All of the staff has been so friendly and willing to help, it is perfectly clean, there is a more than adequate breakfast buffet, and they even have complimentary dinner Monday thru Thursday. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially for anyone traveling on business.Our room was perfect for our needs. We had four individuals and the suite we stayed in had a bedroom with two beds, a bedroom with one bed and a sleeper sofa. It also had a kitchen, full fridge, two full bathrooms and 3 televisions. Hot breakfast in the morning. Wi-fi. Essentially it had every thing we wanted and felt very clean. Seemed like a good location as well. It wasn't a far drive to downtown and other eateries weren't far. The only minor complaint was the elevator seemed like a hike to our room.Loved the beds. Great shower. Skipped breakfast. Fitness center still need some dumbells to be functional at all. Enjoyable common area downstairs in lobby with fireplace.Another superb experience at Homewood Suites. They would have gotten five stars except for the fact that the dinner bar always seems to be empty? I guess I need to show up right when it opens in order to eat there.EDIT: Going on week 6 here and ever since I wrote my review the dinner bar hasn't been empty. Since this was the only thing preventing five stars, I'm changing my review.A typical Homewood Suites. Situated in the north east suburbs of in the great city of Louisville. This Homewood has bigger suites than most. Breakfast bar wasn't exactly great. Nice outdoor pool, basketball court. Free Wi-Fi was excellent. A couple of grills for long term stayers. Located near a few restaurants and a couple of shopping malls. Lots of parking on site. Friendly desk service. Long, long hallways......I am a youth pastor and stayed here recently with 4 teenagers, myself, and my wife. It was perfect. We stayed in the two bedroom suite. The bedrooms were huge, and the bathrooms were very roomy. I loved having a little living area and kitchen, it definitly helped having for our week long stay. The front desk was always amazingly pleasant and just what you look for when staying at a hotel. The breakfast was awesome and they even offer a limited dinner Mon-Fri which we took advantage of a couple of times. The kids loved the pool and the basketball court. This hotel is top quality and I highly reccomend anyone stay here!Wonderful customer service at this hotel.  Everyone at the front desk greets us warmly each time we arrive, which is quite often. Many restaurants a very short drive away. Avoid the Bristol bar and grill next door.This suite was perfect for my work getaway.  Comfy and quiet!  Avoid Bristol Grill.. try Bombay Grill! yummy indian food walk away..Stayed here a dozen times already.  Always super clean and friendly.

hotel_name: Microtel Inn by Wyndham Louisville East
review_content: December 23, 2015. Clean, cheap and the beds were great. The rooms are small..."micro" tel, get it? There is no ironing board or iron, no microwave, no fridge, no coffee pot, but it comes with the basics like soap, towels, phone, a flat screen tv and a nice window ledge lounge area in which to relax. You also get a chair and a desk. Free WI-FI. Spartan. Basic. Clean. Right off the freeway. Attractive room. A free continental breakfast. Cheap. If you are spoiled or you like "things in your room," this not the place for you. But if you don't mind about "things" and you want a good night sleep, you might want to give this place a try. We slept the four of us here for $63.00. That's "micro" money, and macro savings that stayed in our pocket.We stayed here for 3 nights--it was a last minute thing. For the price it's not only cheap but good. I wouldn't stay more than 3 nights but the front desk were super nice and friendly! The room was clean and we had no issue. It is about a 20 min drive to downtown area of Louisville. The front desk actually called as we checked in and went to our room to make sure everything was ok and then to find out if we needed room service later in the day (since we declined in the morning as we occupied the room). good customer service.I would stay if i was in that area again but next time i would want to be close to the main city.Before we moved to Louisville we looked for the cheapest room we could find...This one surprised us with it's succinct comfort. It was very clean, the room was tiny but the bad was SO comfortable!  If you're claustrophobic you will probably hate it because the walls are very close to the bed and there is very little wiggle room. If space is not the issue though then Microtel is definitely at the top of our list when it comes to price + cleanliness + comfort.Most importantly, Dont Stay Here!Room stinky from moldy smell, maybe bad room freshenerNo fridge, no microwave, no chair except hard desk chair.Small room, noisy front desk area, broken ice machine.Would never stay here again regardless of the cost of other hotels.Front desk lady was a charm with places to eat and visit info.  This was the only redeeming point.Go elsewhere!Since clearly I didn't plan my KY Derby trip well in advance, all downtown Louisville hotels were booked by the time we got our act together. All good. Microtel Inn was a solid option. The staff is so friendly, nice and accommodating; they even had Derby coasters for us as a little take away present. Awww. The place is budget, kind of smells of smoke but, the bed was comfy, it was clean and there was roof over our head. We didn't spend much time in the room so, all good. This little motel is located about 20 minutes to downtown Louisville, so by no means is it convenient.Overall, a solid spot to stay if you're looking to not spend a lot of money.*** For Derby goers - this place had a private shuttle number and for $10 pp per ride they were pretty much on call and drove you where ever you needed to go. It was perfect. We used the guys all weekend and had the best time ever.*** a 5 minute walk to a 24 hour not so delicious Waffle House.Everything I needed on a road trip. Woman at the front desk was a sweetheart. Room was clean. It had the essentials and nothing more. Breakfast was a nice start to the day. Close to downtown. Would stay again if traveling to the area.Simple rooms that are clean. Not a bad location. Pet friendly and quiet. Only complaint is my room had a bit of a musty smell (I think it was the air conditioner) but otherwise I have no complaints. For the price, it is worthwhile.Funky little rooms (remodeled but 80's style?  in a good way) that were very clean.  Breakfast was decent (bananas, juice and oatmeal - nice to have healthy options) and front clerk was as sweet and helpful as a favorite Great Aunt.  I would stay here again when passing through.I road trip, a lot. From the West coast to the East... bring it on. Spending so much time on the road, means I prefer a more basic (cheaper) hotel unless I'm wanting to pamper myself and relax.This hotel was great. The room was small, but as I was only one person, it was fine. Easy location as far as distance to the freeway, though my GPS was a little confused in finding it - luckily I saw the sign.Front desk lady was fantastic - warm, friendly and very helpful when I had questions about the area and how to find a specific place. Room was clean, bed was alright. The carpets had just been cleaned and the room had been aired out.I would certainly stay here again if I find myself in the Louisville area.Reading other comments on this hotel, I had my doubts and pretty low expectations towards this place; however, I have to give credit where credit is due. From a microtel stand point, I would imagine from the word itself, a place that was slightly more upscale than a super 8 and less than a Holiday Inn. From what I had seen, I have to say that it totally surpassed my expectations as you will see below. When entering the hotel for my stay yesterday, I have to say that it smelled like a dentist's office (formaldehyde??? idk); but it was not really a problem. The hotel staff was definitely friendly and upon first impression, I have to give it a super on this til the end with around three staff individuals taking shifts until the day I left (today). The myth that some comments have on here is that the pillows were horrible; however, I did not find them to be that bad. Very soft and comparable to what I sleep on (cotton pillow). If there were problems with them being thin, there were three of them on a queen sized bed, so just stack them. Not a problem. The blankets were awesome (layered with three like any other hotel). I think the only real problem with the hotel was having a smoking hall on one side and a non-smoking on the other. Time and time again, I had to get luggage out of my car that was parked in a lot by the smoking side. Each time, I had to go through that hallway (really..I had the choice to go through the lobby) and this is why I would not mark it down for that. If people mark it down for this, just remember that you had other means of getting to your room and having smoking sections, they are just catering to the general public. From check-in to check-out, it was a pretty hassle free experience and one of the staff asked if everything in my room was fine. If one would ask me again, I can gladly say "No problems here, I would love to stay here again", for the price that I got on it ($57.25).for the price, this place is great!  it was very clean which is always my main concern.  The rooms are a bit small and outdated, but still have everything you need.  Continental breakfast is nothing special, but good enough to grab a snack in the morning.  Plus a great location really close to the expressway and about 10-15 minutes to drive into town!I will be back when i am in Louisville next.Staying at this particular location was perhaps one of the best overall national hotel/motel chain experience I've ever had, and there's a very cogent reason why this chain consistently has consistently won JD Power and Associates' "Highest in Guest Satisfaction among Economy/Budget Hotel Chains,Ten Years in a Row."  It's actually quite amazing that this location isn't on their Top 20 list, but hey - it only gives me hope that if this location with its relative anonymity can do so many things so well, the top 20 list must be absolutely phenomenal.  Onwards.Location: 5 out of 5Convenient to the Louisville area, particularly if you are headed eastbound on I-64.  The only thing I would mention is that if you're not familiar with the construction that's going on right now, bear in mind that the I-65 bridge between IN and KY is shut down for repairs.   So...if you are coming down I-65 S and want to hop on over to I-64 E to the property, it shouldn't be a problem.  Similarly, if you are going from the east and are already on I-64, the only thing you have to keep in mind is that you can't cross the I-64 bridge, and that if you want to get on I-65 N, you have to take the 264 bypass first.  My particular experience was going through Louisville to the east TN area, originating in Chicago.  The motel is located in a group of 3 - 4 other properties, and in walking distance to several restaurants.  Cleanliness of Room: 5 out of 5I've traveled enough to know what most motels are capable of on a regular basis, and I know what most motels will tend to overlook if they don't have a staff that's absolutely "spotless", pun intended.  I was on the second floor in a queen bed room.  My particular room was not only spotless from an aesthetic standpoint, but there were aspects of the amenities I noticed where other properties would just sort of say, "eh....whatever."  Specifically, the liner of the shower didn't have the mold and mildew marks at the bottom.  Yes, I realize that they'll still be there even if you put them through the wash.  However, the liner in the shower didn't have one spot, ring, or line of mold on it.  Furthermore, the drain for the shower flowed absolutely freely without any resistance.  At home, I'm fairly meticulous about cleaning the tub drain out with a turbo snake and/or gel/foam cleaner, and I'm telling you - the tub drain in my room was almost as free-flowing as the one I have at home.  Amenities: 3 out of 5It's not the 4 seasons, though you can see them from your awesome built in day bed above the heating/AC unit.  Yes, this location has built in day beds.  They are neat to sit in for about 5 minutes.  Then, if you are traveling alone, you say to yourself, "Why am I doing this again?"  Toiletries are commensurate with what you'd find at most of the other non-boutique chains (think Super 8, Econo, Quality, Rodeway, etc.)  The shampoo and soap do the job, the towels are generously sized (if a bit rough and scratchy...you know the sensation).   The TV is above the closet, and if you're lying in bed, it's actually in a convenient location.  The free breakfast is more than adequate for the average traveler; there are no hot or made-to-order items, but the individually wrapped muffins, fruit, cereal, and bakery items are fine.   Remember that the rooms are "micro" - so you may not have as much space to store your items if you are traveling with a family of 4.  For a single traveler on a motorcycle, I had plenty of space for my stuff.  The WiFi isn't blazingly fast, but is probably a little faster than 3G.  It was fine for just casual surfing on my phone's browser, and it was able to support Adobe Connect Pro without glitching out.  Decor is pastel'ish, and they have mirrors in the room to make it look bigger.  Cleanliness of Public Areas: 4 out of 5The lobby was very well-maintained, and the corridors and dining areas were kept clean as well.  The only minor complaint I would have is that because there are smoking guests who occupy the property, some of the odors associated with tobacco use could permeate through the main corridors.  Be mindful if you have sensitive parties you are traveling with.  Customer Service: 5 out of 5Very nice staff that works at the front desk.  Everyone I met was the right mix of friendly and efficient.  They were also knowledgeable the general area, and provided good advice on different tiers of local restaurants.  I don't have one negative thing to say about the staff I encountered.  Price: 5 out of 5I think I paid 57 including all taxes and fees.  Like I said in the preface, this was perhaps one of the best bangs for the buck I've encountered in terms of lodging.  Overall: 4 out of 5Highly recommended.  I would definitely stay again if I were passing through Louisville.Cute, clean, cheap, friendly, continental breakfast, and free wifi. The receptionist called to make sure our room was ok. Ten-fifteen minutes from downtown Lousiville. Can't ask for more. Would definitely stay again.This is a great place to stay for the cost. The staff was very nice and everything was clean. I only stayed one night on my way across the country. If you're looking for a clean place to sleep for not very much money, this is for you.The only thing that was disappointing was the free breakfast. There were slightly less options than what's offered at Super 8 in my experience. We opted for the McD's around the corner.Simple but clean rooms, low rates, friendly staff and free breakfast. Would happily return.It is honestly hard to find a low budget motel/hotel that is comfortable and bedbug free. I give Microtel Inn a FIVE STAR review for being a top notch home away from home. The rooms do not go out of their way to be much, however they are clean and budget friendly. All the staff that I encountered seemed to be very nice and personable. I felt safe in my room as well as in the general location. Microtel Inn is also a pet-friendly place... so this is a score for those who can't travel without little friends!There are many walkable food locations around the area and if you feel like adventuring downtown it is only a 10-15 minute drive!I liked the hotel, staff and cleanliness enough BUT bring your own pillow because all of the pillows in this hotel are terrible; they feel like foam rubber, and you'll have to ask for a blanket.Other than the ultra thin blanket (if you can call it that), there was no warm/soft blanket in any of the rooms (i talked to other guests who confirmed) so you have to ask for one which they'll oblige and give you a soft fleece blanket. The TVs are old standard def CRTs but I expected as much.All in all it was fair for the price.Fine hotel for what it is.  Like "Andy C." says, below, it is clean, comfortable, and inexpensive.  We felt safe and comfortable there, but were taken somewhat aback by the smell of smoke throughout the common areas.  Coming from Illinois, where smoking is off limits just about everywhere, it struck us probably more than most would notice.  Note that our room did not smell of smoke, only the common areas did, so it wasn't so bad.

We have stayed at this hotel for two years in a row while exhibiting at the KY Expo Center.  A less than 5 minute drive to the fairgrounds, which is nice.  Each room has a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker.  All musts if you're in town for a few days.  The check in was completed in 3 minutes, which was nice when the rest of my family was ready to unload.The breakfast varies each day, and they have a great selection of eggs, sausage, and baked goods, as well as cereal and other items.  Nice to fuel up for the day before heading out.We have come with quite a large group of families, and have been able to use the lobby area (used for breakfast) to watch a college football game and have our food that we made set out on the breakfast area.  Works out great for us.We were staying in Louisville for a wedding, and I was very impressed with this hotel. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly and attentive. They were able to accommodate some last min true changes to our itinerary, which we really appreciated. The only thing I wish they had available were some movies to rent or a wider variety if cable to chose from, but overall very nice place.Only a short drive from the heart of Louisville and Whiskey Row!Not a bad hotel to stay in when you need to be close to the airport. A typical marriot property, clean , friendly staff. Our room was nice and bed was comfortable. Yes it's noisy due to the location, but it shouldn't be a big surprise to any one staying there. We stayed the night before an early am flight and left our car in their parking lot. That alone was worth staying there. It's a quick shuttle ride to the airport and the driver is awesome! Nice guy and very helpful. I would have given them five stars if their computers-printer had been working so we could print our boarding passes.Spotless and clean room, great breakfast including hot eggs, sausage etc.  Excellent staff with fast response.  The cleanest room I've had in a hotel in 20 years!  Easy stay close to airport.  The only problem I experienced is it was 20 degrees outside and the indoor pool was not heated.  Not sure I it was supposed to be.  Had a great  safe stay and pleasant experience.  CLEAN!Decent hotel, by the airport which does make for planes flying overhead...didn't keep me up but I guess it depends on your tolerance.  What does always wake me is the squeaky doors and slamming doors in hotels.  Can someone please invent a quiet closing hotel door?!  The continental breakfast is really nice.  You have eggs, sausage, waffle maker, oatmeal bar fully equipt with higher end items like agave nectar, walnuts, almond slivers and craisins. There is also cereal, croissant, bagel, muffins, lemon poppyseed bread.... individual nutella and philly cream cheese, peanut butter and maple syrup packets too.  Really nice touch!  Indoor pool is fine, max of 5 people is posted so if its ever crowded forget it.  No hot tub.Workout room has 2 treadmills and 1 elliptical, 1 weight set.A hotel is only as good as the GM. This GM is GREAT!!My wife and I had the good fortune of staying at this wonderful property the weekend of the Kentucky Derby. Hotel was filled to the gills, like Christmas in NYC. The staff was one of the best of ANY hotel we have ever stayed at. James the GM and his staff understand what the real meaning of Customer Service with a smile. Not request was too great and even though they were sold out and needless to say crazy, they handled every guest with care and understanding during the busiest weekend of the year. Only 1.5 miles from Churchill Downs and a 10 minute car ride into downtown Louisville. We highly recommend to everyone that you not brush off staying here just because they are out by the airport. A 10 from us. Keep up the good work. We'll be coming back to stay again for Kentucky Derby 142 in 2016.Pros -Hotel is nice from the outside.The rooms are large and spacious.Cons -The elevators and the lobby had some weird smell. Not very pleasant.The bed was very uncomfortable. Sleeping was very hard on them.The toiletries were not the best in the world. I am sure there is room for improvement there.Hmmmm... Pool, check. Hot tub, check. Fitness room, check. Breakfast, check. Awesome staff, check. Great room for about $100, check!What else is there to say really? This is an excellent little hotel, we really enjoyed our stay.We were driving by on our way to New Orleans and this was a perfect place to stop!Stayed January 2012, traveled with friendsClean, good breakfast. Rooms had not been cleaned behind the beds or night stands. Overall, not terrible. A little pricey.Stayed here several times. The shuttle to the airport runs efficiently. Some noise from airport noted. Rooms clean. Out of Chardonnay the past 3 times we have stayed here. Overall, goodThis hotel is ultra-modern. Very European in design throughout. This place blows away any Radisson, Holiday Inn, La Quinta, or every other let's-look-like-all-the-others hotel. I can't believe I'm the first Yelper to review this hotel.Pro's:-Super clean-Contemporary everything: furniture, plasma TV, fixtures, etc-The ultimate anti-Holiday Inn -The carpeting-- yes, the carpeting-- is freakin' beautiful-Less than a year old-Free breakfast (including warm food like egg, sausage, etc)-Free Wall Street Journal and USA Today-Free apples in lobby-3 minute drive to SDF airport-Great customer service-15 min from downtownCon's:-No restaurants or bars within close walking distance-If you're a light sleeper, you'll hear the departing or arriving jetsBest Airport hotel I've ever stayed at.  Staff was friendly and informative, breakfast was great each morning, and the decor was surprisingly chic.  The pool was a bit industrial, and the absence of a hot tub was disappointing, but all around a great stay.The hotel is phenomenal. The airport shuttle came within ten minutes and the front desk staff was more than helpful. The shuttle can also take you to the nearby attractions (Kentucky State Fair Grounds, etc) if you request; it's better than having to get a taxi. The room was simply immaculate. The only negative would be the breakfast.  They have "make your own" waffles, but the iron wasn't greased, so there was already a waffle attached to it by the time I got to it. The rest of the food was pre-prepared (fresh out of a box) and unimpressive. But, then again, what do you really expect for a free breakfast? The friendless of the staff and cleanliness of the rooms more than made up for it. The pool looked clean. Like another Yelper said, there isn't a hot tub. However, the exercise room was impressive. I'd certainly recommend this hotel and will stay here again in the future.Stayed here one night. Payed in advance, asked for a quiet room high floor. Received ground floor adjacent to freeway, sandwiched between the laundry and the outside door. Repeated request for a quiet room and was told that is a quiet room. Bad night- freeway noise, laundry, people coming in the door- besides the expected noise of the aircraft.. Bedside lamp didn't work as the cord was too short to reach a plug. Basic stuff. Don't stay here without ear  plugs and eye shades - the smoke alarm blinks all night. They could have situated that in the kitchen area. Other Springhill Suites have been much better. Wouldn't hurt the staff to smile either!

hotel_name: Clarion Hotel Conference Center Louisville North
review_content: After reading the other reviews, I'm very confused to what they're all complaining about.I've stayed here for the last four nights because I'm in town for work and haven't had. A single complaint or problem. I haven't smelled any mildew, saw any dirt covering anything, or head any complaints about the neighborhood that the hotel is in.The beds are comfortable and the water pressure in the shower is good. They also have a bar and a buffet (not free but worth it).This hotel is on the older side however, but they do a lot of upkeep to make it say updated. The only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars was the staff I interacted with while checking in. There were three girls all working the front desk and I stood there for about 5 minutes before any of them decided that they should help me. I would stay here again because for the price and the quality for what you get it, I think you come out ahead!The good: lobby is pretty and hallways clearly have berm updated. The indoor pool is nice and clean. The desk staff were nice upon check in and another gal at front desk was helpful in getting a beverage since the soda machine is broken.  The bad: clearly this hotel has seen better days. Linens are new but beds sure aren't see photos! The restaurant staff was rude, acting annoyed that we even ate there. The food was not very good especially trying to determine which was which between pork and chicken. The buffet table gets too hot and some of the food was dried out. The coffee maker in room filthy. The black out curtain is gross see photo. The room smells horrible which is making me sneeze a lot. I think the one bed in my room is broken as it has a bar ha going from underneath. They're in a remodel but have been told my room is compete. The elevators are scary like they don't start stop and open right and they drop in an odd fashion. And who puts s helicopter landing pad in the middle of the front parking lot? We were told its for the hospital but for the love of God who does that? The K building is NOT handicap accessible from the parking lot and the bathrooms are too narrow. Oh and forgot the dresser in my room is broken too. Lots of things that add up to a never again will I stay here.Ok. Probably more of a 3.5 than a 4, but I'm rounding up.  I think a lot has been done since some of the other reviews.  The lobby looks and smells wonderful.  It was like litely peach scented. Very modern and warm interior.The pool area was one of the nicest indoor pool areas I've walked through.  My room in K wing was renovated.   Nicely sized and clean and modern.  It had a lite green apple scent.  The hallway, which looked like it had new carpet and paint needed air conditioning and/or ventilation.   It was stuffy and had an odd smell. The elevator was hot and smelled like dirty mechanical grease with a hint of BO.  Desk staff very friendly and professional. Check in was quick effecient and friendly. 91312514I'd definitely stay here again.   Hopefully the hallways and stairwells and elevators get proper ventilation soon.Other big draw back, hotel restaurant closes early and there's nothing in walking distance.  Everything is a 10 minute drive or so.  Limits my ability to have a few with dinner...  that said, seems like everything around here closes pretty early except for some of the trendier places downtown in Louisville. .but for the price, the room and hotel is winner.  Lots and lots of parking.The place is more if a complex, with several buildings and wings.The environment is scary, the neibough hood is scary, no restaurant closeby, the food sucks in the onsite restaurant. The room is dirty, the coffee machine is dirty, the toilet is dirty. The hallway is smelly. I would like to change a room but I was too tired to do so. My room in on key wing, I had to drive around the building with bunch of luggages to carry, no wheelchair access from parking lot to the building. Never again. I pray tomorrow comes faster so that I can check out.Okaaayyy... So I went to a family reunion this weekend.  The location of the Center was convenient bcz our cookout was at the Aquatic Family Center which earned them one star. Secondly, the staff at the check in was friendly and fast which earned half a star. Our beds were comfortable and I slept well after a long fun-filled day so that's the other half a star equalling 2 stars. Otherwise I wasn't happy with my stay. As soon as we opened the door to our room there was an awful smell!!!  It smelled like mildew but someone tried to cover the smell with baby powder spray. The swimming pool area and bar were nice. Not sure if we'd come back though.Looks are very nice, loads of parking spaces, and nice pool are nice view. However, it's not sanitary at all, it smells weird, lots of prostitutes, either snot or male stuff on the bed, wifi isn't horrible but it's not good either, it's okay, fo far my experience is a three star but I will add on later tonight... Only two elevators for all 9 floors. The sign that says renovations are under way needs renovation it looks 10 years old... Now 2 star review...Wow... I came out to the lobby because it's only place you can get wifi, and the 4 workers left when their shift ended and no one is at the front desk yet... It's been 15 of no one at the front desk two groups of people have come in looking for a room to stay and no one was there to help them...One star. I left a lot, some thing I found in my bed would be inappropriate to mention. Breakfast cost extra, I guess we will leave and eat something else tomorrow lolxAlso they have hazardous substances in a container kids can easily get to, acids, chlorine and chloride. Also a room (right by other hotel rooms) that said to stay away from it, because of radio active stuff...I'm sitting out in the lobby again to get wifi, and it's hilarious seeing so many people ask for the hotel to hold something for them, the hotel keeps losing stuff of other people's...OH AND someone said in another review that the ac is broken. It's not BROKEN, they just have ONE window unit per floor, aside from the broken one in the room. And last night I forgot to tell you about my experience getting ice. I called the desk to find out where the ice was and they said it was n the front on lobby. Sadly it took forever finding it, and getting stuck on an elevator, I also came across an elevator which didn't say out of order, but it had no buttons.Old and smells terrible like moth balls. Air conditioner broken, drain in shower broken. No one inspects the room after it has been cleaned. It is old an run down. In 1975 it was probably state of the art.  The customer service is OK. The restaurant has portable air conditioners all over the place because the permanent ones are broken. The free wifi is slower than dial up Internet. I will stay downtown Louisville next time .I have stayed in a lot of places, the ones that were bad you knew going in. This Clarion is AWEFUL, the lobby and pool are beautiful, the rooms, food and most of the wait staff....S U C K. If I could afford to move my family out for the next two nights, I would.Yes the hotel is being renovated, but the problems here are mainly staff side.I've stayed here before and enjoyed it. I'm sorry I returned. There is no remodeling going on but there needs to be. I was horrified at how badly everything looks, with the exception of the lobby. The elevator had a horrible substance on all the buttons my entire stay and the hallway to my room looked like it was done in late 70's. My bed was on a fiberboard "foundation and the mattress slid if I moved. The room had a horribly spray scent that was being used to cover something else up. The staff seemed unhappy during my stay---complaining about one another in the restaurant and the lobby. The restaurant was a horrible dark grimy area and I refused to return. I have called several times since leaving to find out if I left a toiletry bag behind. The desk personnel have been grumpy and unwilling to help.I urge you to find another place. I know I will.Nice hotel. They are remodeling a little still. Nice rooms. They do not have a free breakfast but a restaurant that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner at a price. It is a conference center so that explains the no free breakfast. Nice pool too.This place stinks. Quite literally . Our room was in the k wing which hasn't been renovated yet but quite honestly I didn't think the lobby smelled much better. It was a stench of burnt tires and chemicals. The elevators were probably the worse! The personnel was nice and courteous and the smell was more subdued in the room . We had dinner and breakfast at the restaurant because we did not want to drive after two long days on the road but would NOT recommend the food, it was at most bland. I would say the service was the only redeeming factor of this place but I would definitely not come back.I can only assume the person who gave this place 5 stars reviewed the wrong hotel. I've been here for 45 minutes and am on my third room. The first room was a king bed only... no hide-a-bed. The second one the door didn't unlock. When I went to the desk to tell them, the nice lady told me my cell phone probably wiped out the cards.Mind you they don't have luggage carts so we had to schlep our luggage all over creation.It smells weird in here.The air conditioning hasn't been on in what feels like weeks.The furniture is chipped and nasty. The bathroom is tiny. I'm not sure what interior designer decided this border matches these curtains.The pool doesn't open til 9 am and it's no where near roms.The curtains are plaid. I like plaidFor the curtains they get one star.  But everything else is a nightmare.We picked this Hotel for our New Years Eve celebration. We were a bit hesitant do to some of the bad reviews but decided to take a chance, we ARE glad we did. The renovations have GREATLY improved the property.  The NYE package was also a great value. The food, party, music, room and breakfast were ALL very well done. We plan on a repeat stay next year.This place is a dump! Reeks of old smoke and deodorizer spray. The advertise free wifi and HBO; neither of which are actually available. Had to go in search of an outlet to plug my phone in, which I wish I hadn't because before finding the outlet I found piles and piles of crap in the corners. The staff at the desk were very friendly, however, I still wish I had brought my own sheets from  home.In spite of all the construction going on in the area and getting lost a couple times in the dark on our way to check in (at 2:00 AM) we found ourselves a very good room.  We stayed 5 nights and the room was clean and the beds were comfortable.  We were on the 3rd floor in a non-smoking (and you didn't smell any scent of old smoke) room with a king size bed.  The hotel is pet friendly, the staff was very nice from the check - in to the maid service.  We never ate at the hotel so I'm can't say how their restaurant was.  I do have to say that the decor is quite dated and the tv didn't always come in clear but we were there mostly to sleep anyway.  I would definitely stay again if I have to bring my dog (again).Place was awful.  Cigarette butts everywhere, pretty sure we saw a hooker meet up with someone and go into the room.  Could hardly sleep.  Not worth what little we paid for the room.Great price. Great room. Clean. Smoke free. It had signs up that they were remodeling, but I saw no evidence of a mess. The lobby was super nice, and it looked like the pool was nice. We arrived late (due to the worst traffics I've ever seen) and found it quiet and restful. I will definitely stay here again.Rude staff!!! I got here from the airport.  Dump on outside.  Inside decor outdated.Tried to check in and told that checkin was at 5pm, 7 hours later.  Staff complained about other staff loudly as well as cursed.  Maybe it's par for the area. Very unprofessional!  They asked me if I wanted to leave my bags and my response was where was I going. I arrived by taxi for a meeting.  Her response was a shrug. This is the second online complaint I have ever posted but I want future guests to keep going on to another hotel.

In town for business, at the convention center, and the Courtyard by Marriott is in a perfect location.  Right downtown, only a block away.  Will be staying here the entire week, and update after my trip is done.Thus far, I am not disappointed, at all.  The staff have been very friendly and helpful.  Offering great suggestions for dinner locations and things to do.The room is very nice, well kept, and service has been good, thus far.  Amenities are pretty typical for the Courtyard brand...nice room, fresh decor, really suited for the business traveler.  Coffee and free wi-fi but, no fridge or microwave.  The bed is VERY comfortable and that more than makes up for lack of a mini fridge...IMHO.Only complaint so far is noise.  But, that is not the hotels fault.  There is road construction outside and it is really noisy, can hear it in the room, woke me up at 4 a.m. this morning.  I do hear other noise, large trucks but, it is pretty quiet and muffled, not enough to keep me from sleeping.They have a sort of strange little morning breakfast bistro stand adjacent to the lobby...serving "starbucks" but, it's fake....as in, real coffee but, auto machine espresso...it'll do in a pinch but, for true espresso fans....meh....I spent 30 nights at this hotel on business in 2015.  I also spend several nights at other local downtown hotels (the Residence Inn, the Marriott, and Springhill Suites), but I chose to stay here the most due to the good corporate rate, the breakfast and the proximity to my office.My favorite parts of this hotel experience is the breakfast. The staff is friendly, there are a number of choices that range from quick fruit and muffins to sit down hot selections, and they serve Starbucks via a great professional coffee machine. This seemed a big step up from most Courtyards.The hotel has a shuttle that took me TO the airport, which was very convenient and also a perk. Although they wouldn't pick-up from the airport, I understand because it's not an airport hotel. The shuttle will take you anywhere within a very short radius. 30 nights there meant that I eventually wanted to go a little more than a mile away for dinner, and I was surprised that the hotel wouldn't take me further. The staff was friendly, but not as accommodating as I've experienced at other hotels, particularly for a very frequent customer.Otherwise, this hotel was ok, but not much more. The rooms were clean but not special.  This hotel was quiet at night, which I appreciated. Out of 30 nights, I only had one group of partying neighbors and the hotel handled that expertly.The rooms were clean, on occasion the cleaning chemicals smelled too strongly. This is a good pick if you need to be in downtown Louisville.I had to cancel my reservation and leave this hotel early because of the overpowering chemical cleaner smell in the hallways and rooms.Aside from that, the hotel would have been fine. If you don't mind being surrounded by the smell of menthol, the rates are good and the location is great.Went here while I was walking downtown aimlessly looking for my car that I had no idea what parking garage I had parked in. It had to be mid 40s. Was trying to find a hotel to where I could find a business center to find the PARC number. The staff of this hotel kept me waiting in the cold and kept asking repeatedly if I was a guest. I told them "NO I AM NOT A GUEST, I JUST NEED TO USE YOUR BUSINESS CENTER". They sent me away. Not sure if they thought I was a robber or something. After doing my brand ambassador event, I was dressed with a black jacket and grey pants. Still, when there is a guy on the street, looking to use your business center, have the courtesy to let him in and find out options. It was like 2 a.m. in the morning!The hotel is just average at best.  The lobby is pretty nice but the rooms are dated a bit.I got upgraded to a Junior Suite and it was bigger but still not super nice.I had a traincation (convention) at the Convention center and I would much rather have stayed at the Hyatt or Marriott looking back because they are connected by sky bridges and it was 28 degrees.  Lesson learned.Lastly, I must say the staff was phenomenal.  Not enough to give it a 4-star rating but they were extremely friendly the entire time.This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel.  It's been a year since I stayed here last and I had forgotten about the one problem I had with the rooms.  Others have mentioned this issue too.  They use excessive chemicals in the rooms.  The first time I stayed I had them switch my room but had the same, strong chemical odor.  I dealt with it because other things in the hotel made up for it which I'll mention in a bit.  This trip, same issue.  I called from the first room I was given and requested another room.  They turned up with a key and a bottle of air freshener.  I told them to step away from the bottle.  The second room had the same odor.  I don't think it's the room cleaner chemicals, I think that there is another odor that they are covering up with excessive air fresher.  There's a moldy, musty smell underneath the chemical smell.  My guess is that they have "sick building syndrome" since the windows are sealed.  Now for the good points.  Excellent staff.  Easy parking with a room key swipe.  Great location across from the YUM Center.  Nice Bistro for a quick breakfast, the service there was great as well.  They have a little General Store type closet next to the front desk which is open 24 hours and is great for me since I get back at crazy times and sometimes would like a little something.  Beds are comfortable but the pillows need work, hard as rocks.Overall I think that this will be the last time I stay here.  It's a shame about the smell because otherwise I'd be giving it 4-5 stars because of the staff.When I booked, this hotel and the full-service Marriott a block and a half away were exactly the same price, but I chose the Courtyard due to its slightly superior reviews and its location, which was a tad closer to where I needed to be during the day. I wouldn't do it again. I had the occasion to visit the full-service hotel, and the difference is far greater than you might glean from reviews. And as a Marriott Gold member, you get free breakfast and easy late checkout at the full-service hotel but no breakfast and a bit of a hassle for a late checkout at the Courtyard. But the Courtyard does have a great location, a free airport shuttle, and an especially strong staff. They're all-purpose players who are enthusiastic, knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful. They'd make this hotel worthy of a solid rating, except that... The housekeeping staff needs to turn down the amount or strength of the cleaning chemicals. The hallways, at least on the fifth floor, just reek of the stuff. Unpleasant, and it makes you wonder what it so awful that it takes industrial strength solvents to cover up. Not the best sleep due to walls that don't insulate from either loud conversations in other rooms or traffic and other assorted noise from the street. Because downtown isn't terribly busy after midnight, the street noise is too intermittent for your auditory system to adapt to. So the fifth floor, at least, isn't a great choice for a light sleeper.Pretty nice hotel in a great location, near lots of restaurants, bars and attractions and right across from the basketball stadium / Yum events center..  breakfast area is  order at the counter with starbucks coffee and opens at 6:30.. free coffee in your room but not in the lobby or at breakfast.. friendly staff at both reception and the breakfast area..Exactly what I expect from a Courtyard. I appreciate the consistent service no matter where business takes me.Great place and clean. The staff was very friendly.Good staff and great location. Mediocre rooms - but most of the TV stations didn't work, instead saying  "no signal"."I stayed here weekly for business over a nine month period. The staff is absolutely phenomenal, always helpful and knew our names after just two stays. The rooms are clean and a comfortable size. I see a lot of people saying that the rooms are just "ok". If you want superb spend the $300+/night and stay at the Marriott down the street, but don't knock the mid tier hotels down a size for being exactly what they are.... Mid tier. You get a good clean room with friendly staff in a great location for a fantastic price here :)This Courtyard by Marriott is in a great location in DT Louisville. It is very easy to park in their garage and just walk to restaurants. There are many great dining establishments within a 8 block radius. Several are only one block away from the hotel.The staff is friendly and the place is very clean. I have also found some reasonable rates around $120.The hotel is across the street from the new "YUM" Center, home of the Louisville Cardinals. There is a lot of activity in the area before and after games.Updated Courtyard in the heart of downtown L'ville!  Easy walk to restaurants, bars, 4th Street Live.  Rooms are updated to the newer Courtyard standards.  There is a parking garage here.  Caddy corner form the hotel are a few bars that are excellent, away from the touristy 4th Street Live.  Good spot to stay in L'ville if on a budget.I hate to give a review to an established chain, but I just have to. The staff at the Courtyard Louisville Downtown were so filled with hospitality, I couldn't resist. The Courtyard brand generally offers comfy, clean, spacious rooms and good shampoo and fresh bedding, free internet, pool, gym, and decent cable channels most of the time. If you get a renovated one, you are in luck.But what made this trip special was the attention and patience given to our huge party (our very large family gathered for a wedding). The staff was so attentive, genuinely warm, joyful, accommodating, and made us feel like we were at home. Maybe it's just Southern hospitality, but I think it's those great personalities that took this experience over the top. Thank you Ladies!Nicely done, Courtyard. Can't say you're my favorite of the hotel chains, but you've never done my family wrong.Concierge was polite, but not terribly helpful. I had asked about smoking laws and the gentleman looked at me and said, "This is Kentucky." Why, yes it is! I'm thrilled you know what state I'm in. But I'm obviously NOT from Kentucky if I ask you what the smoking laws are here. Last *I* checked, Kentucky was bourbon and tobacco country. Does this mean I can smoke in a bar? Does this mean I have to be 20-50ft from the door? What does that mean beyond the fact that I'm stuck in this g-d-forsaken state for 72 hours for my grandfather's funeral?!Anyways. The rooms were very clean, extra towels/pillows came promptly. The hair dryer was questionable, but I should have known to bring my own. Not really sure what the breakfast situation was like as I was there for only a night (lack of proper sleep, proper meals, and a new environment makes for a very sick Jennifer), but there was espresso when I needed it and the staff was incredibly polite in the bar/breakfast area.Oh. And free wi-fi. Thank you, Courtyard. Seriously. Thank you.This was our second stay at this hotel.  The first time was good so we decided to stay again and we're really glad we did.  It's a clean hotel and a good location. The only downside is that the bed was uncomfortable but everything else was really good, especially the service from the staff.  Carol at the front desk was friendly, efficient and helpful.  The hotel shuttle drove us to and from our event downtown and on the way back Tyra was our driver.  It was brutally hot that evening and she had the A/C cranked up in the van.  She was also really friendly and we enjoyed the short ride back to the hotel.  We would stay here again.Have stayed here twice for business.  Clean rooms in downtown Louisville.  Parking garage connected to the hotel.  Friendly staff.  Breakfast daily.  Bar inside hotel.  Lots of great restaurants close by.  Especially check out Patrick O'Shea's, Bistro 301 or Vincenzo's

Our mission in this stay was to find a well appointed hotel for 2 nights in Louisville without breaking the bank... and I can happily report: Mission Accomplished.This hotel features:-- Free hot/cold breakfast featuring donuts, eggs, biscuits/gravy, waffles, cereal, hard boiled eggs, and more-- Free Kickback... aka free dinner starting at 530pm featuring chili, salads, pasta, baked potato and more-- Cheap alcohol during the Kickback (53 cents each to cover Kentucky tax)-- Free soda, coffee and popcorn all day-- Indoor/outdoor pool and whirlpool-- Basic shop to get your snacks and pantry item needs met-- Nice sized LG TV -- Plenty of FREE parking-- FREE wifi, no password required-- Comfortable bedsIt sounds so silly but I love that the shampoo/conditioner/body wash in the shower are not in travel sized bottles, but rather, in a dispenser on the shower wall. I can use as much as I need and it is more environmentally friendly.The staff was very pleasant, the check in process was quick, and the decor was beautiful and basic. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely be staying at Drury again in the future over other better known chains.We love staying at Drury Inns. Free breakfast, free dinner, free snacks and soft drinks. Great! Especially if you have a family. The only downfall I would say about this one, is, some of the room aren't in a "hallway" like setting. Some, like the one we bad, are on a balcony, over looking the lobby, which has a really pretty chandelier going all the way down to the floor. BUT you could hear every one down in the lobby. We were even on the 4th floor. Other than that, it was a great hotel, and would stay here again.While replacing a windshield wiper in a Walmart parking lot that flew off during our drive from Chicago to Nashville, my boo-thang made a game time decision to rest in Louisville. She searched on Yelp for a highly-rated and dog-friendly hotel, booked through the listing, and off to the hotel we went.***This Drury Inn & Suites location really impressed me, despite being a mid-tier hotel. For the price ($150+), customers receive incredible value and outstanding service that I think would appeal to everyone from the traditional businessman to a small family. They do so many things right, and I think a lot of other hotel chains should take note:I. ROOMVery plane, but incredibly functional and spacious (maybe 400-500 square feet). The living area and bed each had their own rooms. The carpet felt fine, TV worked well, and the comfy couch felt nice to sit on after eight plus hours of driving. All the dust had been wiped. II. BEDOutstanding firm mattress! I slept like a baby and drooled all-over my pillow. III. BATHROOMMarble floors, shampoo and soap dispensers, sparkling clean -- what's not to like? IV. SERVICESuper friendly, professional, and very accommodating. No problems here.V. OTHER TIDBITS-Their continental breakfast is actually pretty good! I really liked their biscuits and gravy as well as sausages.-It's dog friendly, and there was no extra charge. -Their workout area comprises of three treadmills and some small dumbbells. Nothing too great. The room is also very small.VI. OVERALLI would absolutely return to this Drury Inn, if I ever were in this part of Louisville again!Pooping at the Drury Inn would get a solid 9 out of 10 if the tp was Charmin. One slow elevator. Room was clean.I loved staying here. The front desk staff, especially the black gentleman who was working was extremely friendly and talkative. Granted, I stayed here the second week of may in 2014, but the service was so great that it was memorable that I had to make an account to brag on it. The only complaint that I really had was that I couldn't easily move the dresser to plug my PS4 in behind the said dresser, but other than that, it was a great stay.I was impressed. This was my first time staying at a Drury Inn so I didn't know what to expect. The check in was very easy, rooms nice, clean and comfortable, they are pet friendly and have hot breakfast. I also saw a sign that they have free snacks and alcohol beverages! (Well there was a slight fee for the alcohol due to Kentucky law, I think you just pay tax). Anyway great deal! All the staff was friendly as well. I would definitely stay at this Drury Inn or another elsewhere again.Very nice, clean hotel.  Had an issue with the air conditioning in my room and even though it was 10pm by the time i noticed, the front desk immediately came to check it out and moved me when they couldn't fix it.  Comped the room for my inconvenience, which is nice.  I don't recommend staying in one of the atrium rooms though because the common area gets pretty noisy at night and during breakfast.The staff was super friendly, even lending me an umbrella so I could walk my dog in the downpour.  I wasn't offered the chance to get a drink coupon when I checked in, so I missed out on my chance for cheap booze.  I was too tired and cranky after a long day to bother trying to figure out how to get one at night.Five stars for service 4 for decor (a little outdated). The entire staff from the Assistant General Manager to the breakfast host and the pool attendant were welcoming, friendly, and went above and beyond for service! We got a better rate than across the street at the Marriott where we had original reservations. We cancelled at the Marriott because we had requested a hotel with a pool and a restaurant and the pool ended up being outdoor and the "restaurant" was closed. It was really just a cafe counter in the lobby. Back to the Drury... Elated with the free breakfast and the wide selection. Also the pool was indoor outdoor with a divider above. Very cool feature. A small exercise room with treadmills and free weights. Very happy! Will be back!Great hotel all around!  It was a great stay, the staff was friendly, the room was clean, and the continental breakfast was really good (with hot food).  Will definitely stay here again.  The pool and hot tub they have is a big plus.  The only complaint was that the hot tub jets were not working during our stay, but still a great stay all around!The staff here is by far the nicest, friendliest and most helpful you will find at any hotel. They will go out of their way to help you and accommodate your every need. Super crew! The rooms are very clean and comfy. If you forget something, they've got it covered. Comfy bed and pillows too. The free breakfast, free dinner, free snacks, free soft drinks are all excellent and so convenient. Ive stayed here several times for work and Ive never had a complaint one.I had the pleasure of staying at the Drury Inn located in Cincinnati once. I made the mistake of thinking that they were all going to be high class. That is not the case for their Louisville location. When I first arrived in my room, my shoes stuck to the tile as I walked in and I found a hair on 2 of the 4 towels in the bathroom. I decided I could live with it until the morning, but the morning couldn't come soon enough! The place is old and the walls are so thin that I could make out every word of the conversation going on next door. I know they can't do anything about that, but c'mon!Saving grace was the service! They were very polite at the front desk when I asked them to mop the floor and bring fresh towels. If ti wasn't for them, I was going to find a different hotel for the 2nd night. So the front desk staff was excellent! Thank you, but I will probably stay somewhere else next time I am in Louisville.We LOVE Drury Hotels.  I first stayed at one in Atlanta but it was when my brother got married in New Orleans that I discovered how much I would need them in my life.  They are pet friendly!  We travel everywhere with our 7lb furry child and we were getting a little sick of the Motel 6/Super 8 obligation.  They are so clean and nice and our little girl is welcome!  The walls are also a lot thicker and the doors a lot heavier than the cheaper places so outside sound is way more muffled and that keeps the canine quiet too because she's not reacting to outside noise.  We stay at the one in Louisville when we travel to see my parents in Virginia as Louisville is almost the halfway point.  It's such a convenient location for us.  We're staying there in a week and a half, in fact!I've stayed in just about every hotel in Louisville at some point and time, and Drury Inn is hands down the best!  Their level of service to their guests is one that's hard to find these days. Kudos to the management staff for training their team on how to go above and beyond for guests needs! Very clean & comfortable. Offers every amenity one could ask for: indoor/outdoor pool, hot tub, free breakfast/dinner, free wifi. Plus their rates are cheaper than other comparable hotels. I highly recommend staying here.Stand outs:         Clean          Pet and People Friendly      The manager was very accomadating when I asked for a first floor room near an exit with a king bed.  There are no king beds on the first floor except for a suite.  She then said if it was available she would upgrade us to that room at no extra charge.  SHE DID!  My dog Zorro was invited to join us in the lobby which was near the Kickback    snack lounge. We enjoyed our snacks and drinks while watching TV sitting in leather wingbacks. Zorro was well recieved by the guests and quickly became friends with all.The pool was unique in the fact it was half indoors and half outdoors. You could swim under the glass partition.  It was snowing out and was neat to see the kids swimming in a heated pool with steam rising while catching snow flakes in their mouths.My only negative was the bed.  It was like sleeping on a huge sponge.  All things considered, this was a great value.  I am a convert to Drury Inns!Our first time at a Drury Inn property was in St Louis, it was clean, comfortable and affordable, so we decided to try Louisville. I found the same level of service at both properties. In fact, we made a reservation for Louisville on the Internet, decided to confirm it on our way there in the car. The hole did not find it in the system and transferred us to the nationwide reservation center. They didn't see anything either, but booked us into a suite because they said the hotel was full and it was the only room left. When we arrived, the front desk must have had a note on our reservation because they apologized for not having the original reservation and gave us the suite for the same price as the single room. The suite was very comfortable for a family of four. I recommend it, especially with two teenagers. My only downside is the food. I know beggars can't be choosers, but they quality of the breakfast is low. Theres no taste to the eggs or French toast. You need to hit the buffet immediately after the replenish the food, otherwise it gets cold quickly.This location has free breakfast and free dinner, with alcohol drinks for $0.58 (it's free but KY law requires them to charge so they charge the minimal). Also have popcorn machine, soda machine, and coffee available throughout the day.  Room was clean, and the bathrooms look new ( probably recently renovated). The have an indoor pool which also leads to an outdoor pool. Hot tube was well heated. Most of all, the staff is super nice. Always greeting you and seeing how you are doing. During meals, they go to each table to see if you need anything and help you clean up.  For dinner (it's technically appetizer time but they offer enough selection to make it dinner), they don't typically have milk but my kids were looking for it so they unlocked the milk machine and got some for them.  Overall, I would recommend staying here.This is the first time I've stayed in a Drury Hotel but it certainly won't be my last! Comfortable,clean, quiet, tastefully decorated rooms--the king bed was very comfortable and had 5 pillows!When we checked in we were given the otion of having 6 drink coupons, free except in Kentucky they have to charge tax so each drink cost a whopping 53 cents. From 5:30 to 7:00pm they have "kickback"--free fod which included nachos, chicken tenders, baked potatoes, macaroni and cheese, salad and brocolli cheese soup. We had planned on going out for dinner but decided the kickback was all we needed. Breakfast this morning, also free, featured scrambled eggs, sausage, french toast, waffles, cereal, donuts, bagels, juice, and coffee. Oh, and there was also bicuits and gravy, too.I highly recommend this hotel.This is a very nice hotel for the price.  Drury Inns accept all size dogs at no charge as long as they are well behaved.  I could not be happier.  I called and asked if we could get a 1st floor room by the exit since we have a 105 pound dog and while he is very well behaved, not everyone likes dogs and he takes up a lot of space.
