They were able to do this and we stayed in a suite.  It was lovely and clean.  We especially liked the 3 very comfortable pillows on each bed.  We all commented that they were the most comfortable pillows of any hotel we have ever stayed (including expensive hotels).  I had the best hotel sleep of my life.  Usually I do not sleep well at hotels.  We did not take advantage of the drinks and food in the evening but, did enjoy breakfast.  It offered a lot for breakfast compared to most hotels in that price range.  This was our first of 3 Drury Inn stays on our vacation and we found them each one better than the next.  I think this is our new "go to" hotel on the road!We were very happy with our 2 room suite. A little dated but the very friendly staff, free popcorn, and free pop, meant we'd come back without a thought. The indoor outdoor pool was fun too. The staff are very very friendly. The breakfasts were so good, we ended up just needing a light lunches for the duration of our stay.Nice two room suite for a great price. Furnishing are good and not worn, but a little dated. Would be nicer if they have bigger windows in the room. Good wireless service.

I stayed here for nearly 3 weeks due to a business trip.  The staff was helpful and worked with me when my plans changed.Everything was kept clean and neat.They also have a nice restaurant/bar.  Two beers on tap (one local) and a pretty good menu for a hotel.  The food was good and the staff was friendly.It is within walking distance of the U of Louisville football stadium and Churchill Downs.I would definitely stay here again.Not the best place pave I have stayed.  Not the worst.TV in the room is horrible. customer service not great.Gym equpiment worn out.Location good.Bed comfortable.Shower head good.A few things made my experience kind of bad. Thick ass crusty mold in the corners of the bath tub, a torn curtain, and a shitty little TV with only lame ass SD channels. There were no ports anywhere to charge my phone, so i had to disconnect the night stand lamp...WTF...its 2015...even I have a smart phone.The place has clearly been around for a while, and remodeled...overall it is a convincing remodel. but with a tiny little bit of extra effort, it could be a contender.Thank you for the easy stay. I was visiting for a work conference and couldn't be happier with the service. The room looked great the AC was up super cold just how I liked it. Can't wait til the next year when I'm visiting again.Impressive hotel to stay in louisville KY for a decent rate! 1. Very clean2. Decent room colors3. Modern style furnishing4. Very close to highway5. Noise free even being next to the airport, university of louisville and highway6. Best part, smoke free :)7. There is a restaurant where you can have breakfast lunch and dinner! In case, you work for government, you will get free passes for breakfast!! :) 8. Only thing I didn't like is the entrance from road, it's kinda hidden. I had almost missed it couple times.Convenient,  clean and. good service. Heat/air pretty loud not sure why. Only a problem if on the phone or watching TV.Will stay here again.Decent price and close to downtown but the customer service was awful. I had reserved two rooms and asked for them to be next to or close to each other when I made the reservation.  It took over 25 min to check in! We arrived shortly after 3pm so they should have been ready. Initially they gave us 2 rooms 3 floors apart. When I asked that they be next to or at least close to each other it took the desk staff over 15 min to figure out how to do that. They finally give us rooms on the same floor and we go up-only to find that one of them hasn't been cleaned yet. After another 10 min of waiting the maid finally called the desk and asked them to move us so that we didn't have to wait for her. Ultimately we were placed in rooms across from each other. The rooms were clean and tasteful but as another reviewer mentioned you can hear the planes fairly often. No free continental breakfast though. My son was staying in this hotel the night before he shipped off to basic training and we wanted to be with him. And I usually am pleased with Holiday Inns. Not sure I'd choose this one again though.Wayne's World, party time, excellent!!!Not really, but that's all I can think of at 1am on a Thursday morning, listening to planes drop their landing gear. Not only is this loud, but a few of the planes actually shook the hotel! I am on the fifth floor, so perhaps the noise is not so bad for the other floors? Oh well... party on, dudes!Other than that, the hotel is modern and clean, room is very spacious and well-laid-out and has a refrigerator and microwave, which I always appreciate when traveling for business. The king size bed is large... not really comfortable, but expansive. Holiday Inn needs to get it together and provide king size pillows for king size beds, though... I walked in to find 4 tiny, lumpy white pillows centered on the headboard like the poly-fil fairy came and took a fluffy little dump on the bed. Maybe it's too much to ask for a standard size down-alternative pillow?A few weeks ago, we went to Louisville.  I really like the 4th street Live area.  It's in their downtown.  It's basically a strip of restaurants and bars. While there, we stayed at the Holiday Inn.  The hotel was average quality. However, what made this experience fun was the bar. It's hard to beat $2.  The mint julep in reality wasn't very good.  It was premixed. I had a few.  Garrett couldn't even drink the one.  I'm sure they would be better if they weren't premixed.  I guess a mint julep is the official drink of the Kentucky Derby or something.  It's basically bourbon and mint liquor.  Eventually, we swapped to Maker's Mark.  We had Kentucky bourbon in Kentucky.  The bartender was actually really good.  He gave us a sample of some high end bourbon.  He was really chatty and friendly. So... if you are in Louisville, this hotel is good.  The drinks are cheap (if you get the special).I don't think I'll stay here again.  The AC units are noisy, internet incredibly unreliable, and the place isn't kept up very well.  The elevators don't always work, entry doors get jammed, and things in the room aren't always right.  I still give it two stars for being clean and decent, but it's way too expensive for what you get.In a sharp contrast to hotels that look like the 80's threw up all over the room, this hotel is new, modern, and comfortable. The rooms look pretty sharp. There's a restaurant and bar off the lobby that serves passable food and good drinks. The room has a LCD TV, microwave and fridge. Beds are comfortable with a variety of pillows and it's fairly quiet. Outlets are well positioned in the room so you can plug in your electronics; you can plug in at the desk without crawling on the floor, and there's outlets next to the recliner that also is close enough to the nightstand to plug in your phone. They thought out the room well.It's a mile and a half straight shot to the airport terminal, so you will get plane noise during the night, but when you have an early flight it's nice to be able to roll out of bed, drop off the car, and get the heck out of there.I stayed here for my radiology board exams.  It was about $50 to $80 cheaper than the other hotels, but the rooms and the hotel was just as good as theirs.  But I must say, the service was great.  Everybody was really friendly.  One thing was amazing though.  When I was leaving for the airport, it turned out that their shuttle was gone.  The manager of the hotel (I don't know his name, but a bald younger white guy) actually got in his car and drove me to the airport.  Amazing.There is not much to do around the hotel, but if you need to stay next to the airport, this is by far your best bet.Oh yeah, and most important, free wi-fi.Being sent to Louisville for business for 3 straight weeks doesn't garner much excitement out of many however upon landing and getting my rental car which was a pimped out Chevrolet HHR that smelled like fish, I headed towards the hotel.  During my drive I had a very interesting scenic route.  This hotel is close to the college Football Stadium and is in a not so nice part of town.  I was a bit concerned as I'm not interested in homeless, crackheads, hookers nor toothless wonders.  However upon reaching my destination I was compleely surprised.I went to check into the hotel and I will say that the hotel lobby is very nice looking.  Dark wood, polished  white tile floors, very nice for this neighborhood.  They have a nice bar and resturant and the staff were very nice.  Got my card and headed up to my room.  Nice door key system as it goes into the solid wood door horizontaly which means the door is pretty thick.  I opened the door and saw a very nice dark wood furnished room.  Two queens with headboards and a LG flatscreen TV.  Too bad it's not HDTV but still it's nicer than the crappy tube TV's is most hotels.  My room had a nice desk, microwave and fridge.  With all of this the only thing I don't care for is the thermostat and heatpump.  The thermostat is an automatic one which in theory is nice however one minute it's blasting heat and the next it's blowing A/C.  I finally got it comfortable in the room by playing around with the temperature.  The only other issue with this hotel is there isn't a lot of resturants around however I did find a close Starbucks.  All in all, whereas I was going to have my admin change hotels before I got here, upon seeing the hotel I am going to have her book this for the next three weeks.Had a little glitch checking in (only one person working front desk and she had 5 things going on and she was a bit flustered). Once we got checked in the room was nice. I think the place was remodeled recently and the lobby and rooms showed it. We weren't on the property much, but it was a solid night's stay (no free breakfast, however). I'm still a loyal Marriott fan, but if you want a hotel within walking distance of Churchill Downs, this property is A-OK.Clean, good service, bar if you are interested. The breakfast is not impressive , although they do offer fresh fruit- a small bonus. Rooms are modern, clean and comfy. I've stayed here twice with no complaints.This hotel was very clean and quiet. My room was spotless and had a nice flatscreen tv. The dining area and bar is very nice and the food I had was good with quick service. My only real complaint is the location. Not much around to eat / shop, but a great place to sleep if you need to be close to the airport.Good price, excellent service.  Counter staff was especially helpful and gracious.  Will definitely stay here again.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. My suite was comfortable and spacious and modern. The continental breakfast was above average. Housekeeping replaced my towels every day, even though I wouldn't have minded keeping the used ones. Delicious water with fruit in it was available every day near the front desk. They even had complimentary dog biscuits. It would have been better if they provided complimentary cookies for people, but dog biscuits is still a nice gesture. They had the usual fare (make-your-own waffles, pastries, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, cereal, hot bar with different items every day, usually scrambled eggs, toast and burritos), but I was sold with the hot oatmeal they served. I like it better than just dry packets that many hotels have for breakfast. The biggest downsides about this hotel are 1) the location seemed to be slightly unsavory; 2) there is no shuttle service. If you have your own transportation or don't mind cabs, you'll be fine. Note, there is a nightly parking fee. If you want to walk around downtown, you may want to pick another hotel. There were a few bars nearby and a McDonald's across the street, as well as a strip club I think. If those things don't bother you, then I definitely recommend this hotel.Residence Inn has all the comforts of home and more at a fair and reasonable price. I booked this hotel for a recent weekend trip to Louisville due to its location, price, and amenities and overall I was pleased with my decision. I arrived at the hotel about just before check-in and was welcomed by a friendly front desk agent. The room itself was large, with a mini kitchen area and a living room which was separate from the bedroom. The kitchen was nice and had plenty of storage in the fridge and freezer. The living room area was nice, however during this trip it was only used as a place to store my suitcase. The bed itself wasn't the most comfortable however it did provide a quality night's sleep, my only complaint was the pillows which were far too soft and failed to provide any real support. The room itself was spacious, and very welcoming. My only complaint was the free internet itself was rather slow at times, however there was the ability to upgrade to a faster tier for a slight upcharge. Just like every other Residence Inn this location also provides evening socials Monday-Wednesday and a free hot breakfast, complete with bacon, eggs, waffle maker, and everything else you would expect. While not always as good as other local options it's a huge time saver and makes it super convenient to be able to grab a quick bite before hitting the road. I didn't have a chance to scope out the pool or business center, however both were located on the main floor. Parking here is $16/day, and can be accessed from on East Market just past the reserved check-in lane. The hotel is a short walk to Louisville Slugger Field and several restaurants and bars. Overall the stay here was good and the value was even better.Nice, but leaves a lot to be asked for.Rooms are huge, great amenities and service at the front desk.Shower head was dirty, doors bang loudly and are very thin. Breakfast buffet is decent.Parking is great though, connected and very easy to park and get to your room.Management just needs to work on the little things. Location is very good as well.The wife and I stayed at the Residence Inn Louisville Downtown for a four-night (Wed-Sun) stay for our Bourbon Trail visit.  Check-in was a snap as we used the Marriott app to check-in while on the road.  We arrived around 9PM, so our room was ready and waiting for us.  Parking was plentiful for hotel guests and easy to access from E. Market and Preston St.  With minor variations, pretty much every Residence Inn throughout the country looks and feels about the same.  Our room was clean and comfortable with a firm bed and decent pillows.  Plus, it had free wifi.  Housekeeping was unseen since we were out of room practically the entire time but for sleeping, but our room was obviously cleaned and straightened up.  Convenient location was what set this Residence Inn apart.  Located downtown, it was very convenient to the areas of the city we wanted to go.  It was practically across the street from Louisville Slugger Field and the new home to Angel's Envy Distillery currently under construction, and a very walkable distance to Butchertown and the restaurants, bars, and shops in NuLu.  Going in the opposite direction, it was an equally walkable distance to Whiskey Row, the Yum Center, the Evan Williams Bourbon Experience, the Louisville Slugger Museum, and plenty of restaurants and bars.  Its location was so convenient; we only needed an Uber once to make our dinner reservations at 610 Magnolia in Old Louisville and a cab once when we were caught in torrential summer downpour and needed to get back to the hotel.  Location may not be everything, but the Residence Inn Louisville Downtown had it and much more!  It will be our home base the next time we're in town.I stayed here for the weekend with my daughter for the Forecastle Festival at Waterfront Park. Everything was excellent and the staff was very friendly!It is also within 2 blocks walking distance to the park with indoor parking at $16.00 a night. If I go back, I'll stay here again. The convenience of having a kitchenette, and the distance to the park were good selling points.Clean rooms as well made for a comfortable stay. The only thing I didn't like was the fact that they didn't have any drink machines. If you want a soda, bring it with you because it's $2.00 at the "Market" by the front desk.Very nice hotel! I visited the area for business and everything went well- no problems or complaints from me! It was clean!!! I didn't feel like I needed to wipe everything down or wear slippers throughout the room! The bed was soooo comfy, pillows comfy, nice kitchen-just overall GREAT stay!!! I felt safe and at home!This is the spot during convention time in Louisville. Why?* Far enough from 4th Street yet close enough to everything.* NuLu being a block away with new restaurants such as Deka and Toast.* It's the Residence Inn, you have your suite with a bedroom, living room, and kitchen.* Don' t feel like going out after a long day just eat at your temporary home.* Garage is large and two levels with doors to the hotel* Staff is very nice and professional* Hotel is secureOverall, a nice location if you know where to go in the area.This is our fIrst time here. Hotel is very nice great location in downtown Louisville.  Parking was easy in small garage next to hotel.   Rooms are nice we stayed in suite with kitchen. If you need a place to stay downtown and close to Louisville slugger baseball field I would recommend it's within walking distance. . Many small art galleries are just within blocks as well. This was easy to find right at the highway.I stayed here for the week for corporate training and the staff could not have been better! They were friendly and helpful which made being away from home so much easier!!!Had to find a place with no notice because I was having a medical procedure done in town. Every other place was either booked and wanted $250+ or was just crappy. Not only was the rate reasonable, the front desk was super friendly. I explained to them that my husband had worked all night and then driven me to town that morning, they let him check in at 11am and sleep while I was in the medical center and then we stayed overnight. The room was perfect! The bed was so comfy, the couch was extra large and there was a full kitchen. Super large bathroom. Couldn't have asked for a better stay.Listed as a 7 star hotel? Why? It's an average Marriott Residence Inn with paper thin walls and windows, a very loud bar next door, and lots of obnoxious drunk people out in front and in the parking garage all night long. Staff is super nice but very under impressed overall. Location is average. $16 per night for parking in the parking garage. Very minimal breakfast choices. We are regular Marriott members and have stayed in a huge variety of places. The Courtyard is in a much more convenient area for walking to restaurants, etc. Will definitely stay there instead next time.WOW! Ready for a long review? Let's do this: I haven't had a hotel stay that was this pleasant in a long time. Thank you so much, Residence Inn! Your hotel was clean, well-staffed, convenient, and offered a 5-star experience. This hotel has it right. First, the location was awesome. It was easy to get to from the highway (I came from the east), there is a spot right outside the front door for you to park and check-in, and the parking garage is attached to the building and has easy in/out access. Also, the parking lot is attached to the building on both levels and I felt extremely safe. The lot is permit only, so it's monitored ($10/night to park--not bad!). The hotel isn't right in the "heart of downtown" (think museum row, 4th street live, etc.), but having stayed at the Galt House, Seelbach, Brown Hotel, and Hyatt Regency, I'm going to have to say the Residence Inn takes it on ease of parking and convenience. I could walk from my car and get to my room in under 2 minutes.Next, the staff is amazing. Every staffer I met was kind, knowledgeable, and smiling. Even the housekeeping crew said hi and smiled! The man that checked me in last Friday night was incredible and so hospitable. When my ice maker wasn't working, he kindly got me a bag of ice from the kitchen downstairs and apologized for the inconvenience. He was great at directing me where to park, how to get to my room, and answering any question I had. On Saturday morning, the front desk attendant was able to give me directions to where I was heading. On to the room: Super clean and well stocked! There wasn't an iPod docking station which was the one and ONLY downer as I'm addicted to listening to music on my iPod, but I survived! The kitchenette was great. All the dishes, utensils, and appliances were extremely clean and I definitely appreciated having this luxury in my room. I stayed in the one bed/studio style room. There was a small table for dining, a desk, a couch, a TV that swiveled between the bed and couch for viewing, and a very comfortable bed. The linens were nice too. My skin is sensitive to harsh chemicals and I had no problems with the Residence Inn bedding (thank you SO much for this, Residence Inn!). I loved the spacious bathroom with excessive mirrors, because a girl can never have too many mirrors. Did I mention they supply Paul Mitchell shampoo/conditioner? SCORE.Other things I loved about this hotel: - I didn't hear anyone above/below/beside/across from us all weekend. This building was obviously well-insulated.- Do not be hesitant about using the pop-out bed from the couch because it's darn comfy! They supply extra bedding for it, so no worries there. - The breakfast was tasty and the coffee was good! I hate cheap hotel coffee, but I didn't feel the need to jet off to Starbucks after enjoying a cup of their brew.- There are several restaurants that you can get to easily from the hotel, but if you're in dire need for a quick bite to eat, hello McDonalds one block away. Or, if you need to unwind after a stressful meeting/week/etc., hello Haymarket Whiskey Bar one block away. Don't wanna leave your room? The Residence Inn provides with you a huge list of delivery options and a grocery service!- Free wifi!- Gym and pool and whirlpool! Sadly, I didn't get to use them (weekend got too busy).Confession time: I was a Hyatt/Hilton girl before this. I think I'm a convert to the Marriott ways now. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and will recommend it to anyone I know traveling to L-Ville.Lately when I am in Louisville and staying with my family, this is where we decide to stay.  It has a nice location to everything (and RIGHT across the stret from Slugger Field!).The place is clean, the staff is friendly, and even has breakfast included.  They have a cool pool as well.  We ended up getting 2 2BR units and a baby playpen as well.  It is also nice they have full kitchens as well.If you need a big place to stay in Louisville for a decent price- this is the place to come- or else you will need to look for presidential suites or what not in the nicer hotels which are way more costly.We stayed here for 2 nights. The employees were helpful and courteous. There's a small little store in the hotel lobby that sells snacks, toiletries, pain meds etc. It was handy. We booked 2 rooms, both were 2 bedroom suites. Beds are comfortable. Rooms were clean. The rooms were bigger than I thought they'd be and the kitchen was well stocked. This place was great, I'd definitely stay here again. Also, there's a reasonably priced shuttle service at the hotel. It accommodated our group of 10. You can walk to some great restaurants from here. The breakfast (included in the stay) was ok, definitely not gluten free friendly. Even the hash browns seemed lightly breaded. Parking is $10 per car per day. You can hear hotel doors closing at night time, it never woke me up though.I'm torn about this hotel. It's a really nice hotel. The parking was very cheap as downtown hotels go $10 a night. The staff was really helpful and sweet. They have a nice, free breakfast. So all of that stuff was great. We were in room 202. So, if we weren't so close to the street and next to a bar, I might have been much happier. They didn't have a room to move us to for our stay. We were there for four nights, over a weekend and each night there were undesirables drinking, smoking, cussing and revving motorcycles just beneath my bedroom window. I actually went out and bought the loudest fan I could find. So a tip....ask for a high floor away from Market street. Another tip...there is a free trolley that makes a loop on Market and then down Main so you can take it through NULU and all the way down to the Louisville Slugger Museum. The front desk also has a nice map of downtown that was very helpful. Between the walking and the trolley, we barely took the car out.This place deserves a good review, I would stay here again.  The rooms are great, very clean, modern and nicely decorated.  It feels like a studio apt. with a kitchenette, desk area with couch, chair, etc.  Comfortable beds and overall just a nice feel to it.  It makes business travel a bit less horrible.  Staff is very friendly as well.  Free wireless in the rooms which is always a bonus, cable only has the basics, maybe 25 channels or so.The only negative for me is the shortcuts on the bathroom towels which are a bit rough, and the shampoos, etc. should be upgraded....not even a body lotion?  We all know that traveling on planes and staying in hotels completely dries you out!  For all the details they have paid attention to here...how can you cheap out on bathroom stuff!Great service. They go extra mile - even during the Derby!Not a 4-star hotel, but clean, nicely decorated, very helpful and polite staff. Good spread for breakfast, of course. Building is pretty much brand new, as far as I could tell.The best part is the location - a block (or less) from Louisville Slugger field, one more block to Riverfront Park. A really great urban hotel, on the cheap(ish).Not as nice as some Residence Inns.  Bed was squeaky and room was very small.  Room had a view of a parking lot.  At night, saw some shady looking people in the parking garage...  Didn't feel safe.  Next time I will stay back at the 21c.Great new place, descent design. Try to get Hampton Inn(2 blocks away), if not, this will work.

After a long, 9 hour drive from Rochester, NY today, we arrived at this hotel tired, and ready to be out of the car. Alex greeted us with a smile and asked us how we were, where we were heading, and how our trip had been. She was courteous, helpful, and a wonderful help when it came to getting us checked in quickly and efficiently.Our room was nice and updated. The bed was very comfortable and different varieties of pillows. The only downfall is the bathroom. The decor has been updated, but that's it. The tub had some mold on the grout and the fixtures are old and outdated.We will definitely return on our next trip through.Front desk staff (a young guy and young woman) were mostly interested in speaking to each other.Very cold night and i had an early flight out so i wanted to return my rental car and use the shuttle.  The hotel was not busy at all and per instructions of woman at the desk i returned my car and phoned for a pick up. (hey both had told me '2 minutes' which is truly about the time to the airport).  after 15 min in 20 deg cold, i phoned again and the guy told me he was in transit.  another 10 min in the cold.i had dinner at their Bistro-i hate eating at hotels as i travel all the time and they usually are crap. 15 min in line to order, 25 min wait for a burger and 15 more to pay.  all while Jack and Jill were chatting 30 feet away. to be fair to the one guy in the Bistro he had no held and those two were not about to lift a finger.  I stay at Marriott a lot and have seen front desk help out at the Bistro often-not that night.  This is about people who dont give a s... about service-its just a jobIt's a courtyard if I wanted better I should have stayed at the Ritz really what do you want?Did not have a good experience as the fire alarm went off about 5 times between 2:30-4:30am during my one night stay. There was no fire but instead an issue with the system. "Maintenance was attempting to fix the problem" each time I called front desk.I stay at Courtyard's a lot. This is probably the lowest quality one I've stayed at, but that sounds harsh. It really wasn't bad. I would stay here again. That said, this was my experience on my overnight on 9/23/13.This place is so close to the airport you could almost walk there. They were able to check me in early. Yay! The carpet in the elevators was really, really dirty. My room was clean, but had outdated wallpaper and shower curtain. The complimentary coffee was totally cold and the creamer curdled when I poured it in. I visited the bistro and the lady at the register was too busy playing with her phone to notice me. I got a glass of wine though and a snack from the market. The bed was comfy. The room was quiet. I slept well. The shower was hot, but I was annoyed by the closet. It had some wired metal rack instead of a clothes bar, and was awkward. I returned to the bistro in the morning. Service was friendly and prompt even though there was a crowd. My receipt was wrong. They said they fixed it, but they couldn't print off proof.Update 10-6 - I checked my bank statements. They didn't fix my receipt.Enjoyed my stay. Comfy beds, nice amenities, clean rooms, and friendly staff. It always bugs me that they don't have a free continental breakfast but what can you do.Really this is a pretty nice hotel for the price when you compare it to it's competitors. My room was very clean and  the hotel even gave us 4 free cans of coke for the baseball tournament that was going on in town this weekend. I didn't get a chance to use the pool or the spa as they were filled with kids, but they both looked very nice. The staff wasn't particularly warm or hospitable, but I cut them plenty of slack as there were tons of kids running everywhere for the tournament.Overall it was a pleasant experience and I wouldn't mind at all returning here for another nice stay.Perfectly nice property, but customer service is severely lacking.  Trash can in room had a rotten banana in it when we checked in. Coffee splatter on the wall by the coffee maker. Stayed one night with the family for a volleyball tournament.  Four of us in a one bedroom suite.  I had requested extra towels and blankets when I made the reservations online - but there were not provided.  Not a big deal, called down to request that some be sent up and I was rudely told that they were too busy...they can give me some later if I come down to the desk.  Lady was rude when I went down, it was a bother to her.  Next day I requested late check out (gold status guarantees late check out).  Was told no even after I pointed out the membership rules...had to argue to get late checkout.  For $370 for one night, I expect at least courteous service.Amazing five star service! I'm in the middle of my stay here and couldn't be happier. First, we received an email reminding about our stay. Next, we got a personal email from Michael Scott, the manager asking if we needed anything. We emailed back about extra pillows and connecting rooms. To our delight, he emailed back right away and took care of our requests!  We've stayed in many hotels and never had that happen. We've called before our stay and they usually say they can't guarantee anything. What a relief it was to check late and not worry that our kids would be far away from our room. That is five star service. But, it doesn't end there. Beverly checked us in and could not have been friendlier or more helpful. She was joking around with our son, getting us checked in and to our rooms. We did have an issue with our toilet running and Michael has been up to fix it himself.It was a wonderful stay with attentive service and would stay there again in a heartbeat!Great staff. Front desk is awesome,Shuttle drivers to and from airport are so courteous!  Rooms ok.Too bad they don't offer a free breakfast! And although they do have Starbucks in the lobby and do have a menu I'm the morning and evening- a glass of wine is $12.95 a glass... Ouch.. Go to the grocery store and save your pennies.I have stayed here twice, both times while attending Lebowski Fest held at the bowling alley right next door.  So for that convenience alone, it cannot be beat!  The rates are incredibly reasonable and the hotel is spotlessly clean.  The lobby has recently been remodeled and is very nice.  They have a little section with computers to use (though I had my laptop both times and could take advantage of the free wifi) and books to read.  The rooms are large and nicely decorated.  The pool is very small but nice and clean.  Check in/out was very easy.  I don't know if we're going to be able to stay here again because they are not pet friendly and we no longer have our one trusted dog sitter so we will more than likely have to find a pet friendly hotel and bring her with next time.Newly renovated rooms, they did a nice job, staff is very friendly.It is your regular Courtyard by Marriott. It is fairly easy to know what to expect.The staff is very friendly and helpful and the hotel is very clean. The room we had has a HDTV and the channels are actually in HD. The lobby, pool and all other amenities on the first floor are in great shape.The one surprise is the free wireless Internet in the room. This is the first Marriott property that I have been to that has free wireless internet in the rooms. I suspect this may be due to a neighboring hotel and their open network likely covers a good portion of this hotel. As a result, they have no choice to offer free wi-fi because nobody would pay for it here and just leach off of a neighboring network.But overall, it is a nice hotel and you should have no worries should you stay here.Friendly staff, clean rooms, nicely appointed. However, the reservation process stated that we received free breakfast with the reservations (2 rooms, 5 nights). But at present, breakfast is $10 per person ($12 Friday-Sunday). Because of this, we had to allow extra time in the morning to drive several blocks to pick up coffee & oatmeal at Starbucks before we were scheduled to be at the Kentucky Fair & Expo Center. The free Wi-Fi in the rooms is decent - sometimes spotty, but otherwise fast. There were no refrigerators or microwaves in the rooms, which is standard where we normally stay. Would book here again if other hotels in the area have no vacancy.While nicely updated, I'm afraid this is the least well-run Courtyard I've stayed in.  As a gold member, I'm actually quite a fan of the Marriott chain, but I've had two poor experiences at the front desk.  The restaurant service was slow and pitiful.  And tonight, I just tried to turn on my TV, and it won't even work.  When I called downstairs, two reps answered the phone and kept talking over one another.  Did they not hear each other?  Honestly, the staff training here needs an update like the lobby's had.Very friendly and helpful staff. The newly remodeled lobby is very attractive and comfortable. Gym is small but in good working order.Our room was very attractive. The only problems were: 1) apparently you have to ask for a fridge (we did not), and 2) we were put in a handicapped room (that we did not request) and there was no bathtub.We will definitely stay here again but will ask for a fridge and non-handicapped room.It's an old style Courtyard. They are starting to remodel the lobby, and I'm sure it will be sometime before they start to work on the rooms. Small exercise room, a exercise bike, a eliptical, and a treadmill. Nothing close by to eat. A mile from the airport, and really thought the service at the front desk was very good.Standard chain hotel with a comfy lounge and lobby downstairs. Free WiFi, which is a plus and allows me to write this review while sitting in the lobby. No real food to speak off, small coffee shop. Rooms are spacious and clean. Nothing glamorous here but functional. The staff are friendly. It's a bit spendy for what you get, but maybe that's just the day I'm here and they are quite full.I'm instantly annoyed at a hotel that doesn't have wireless.  The beds are hard and thin foam and the rooms are not that clean.

Location was in the middle of where we wanted to go for the weekend.  It's near enough to malls on Shelbyville Road, near enough to restaurants, near enough to I-264 and I-64 and I-65.  It had amenities I wanted -- continental breakfast, complimentary shampoo, hairdryer, coffee in the room, and free Wi-Fi.Beds were comfortable, noise was nill, rooms were clean, and the price per night was below 70.00.  That was super.The only glaring flaw was the tip jar in the dining area for the continental breakfast.  Never seen that before at any other hotel.Sigh.... I didn't have many expectations. I just wanted a room at a decent price since I was on a budget because my company is cheap. During the week night I got a king bed room for 70 bucks, for the location I think it's a good deal.The hotel boost a lot of amenities there's a dance room/lounge, in indoor pool, outdoor pool, a workout room with 1950s equipment but I like it, it has the bare minimum and you can actually get a good workout.The room itself is large but the walls are very thin. There was a baby crying next door and I could hear it very easily. The bed was clean and comfortable. I would have preferred something a little bit quieter but beggars can't be choosers in this situation. Still better than a Super 8 or Motel 6!Easy to get to right off of the expressway and within 10 mins of good food/drink (I suggest the Silver Dollar). Hotel is super basic and not very updated. Bed was ok, bathroom was clean. We stayed here because it is pet friendly and our dog is with us. They failed to mention the additional $25 pet fee, so be aware of that. If I was going to end up paying $100 for a room that is pet friendly I plan to look elsewhere next time. There are better options.Friendly staff, clean accommodations, close to my favorite bbq. We didn't bring kids, or use the pool, but this is a great hideaway. Will be back.Didn't stay so can't give a fair review of room. However, arrive at 10 PM on a Saturday night to music blasting form the basement night club up in the lobby and down the room hallway. I had a reservation at this location as I was catching a flight at the airport in the morning. They advertised an airport shuttle on their site. It does not run until 7 AM so if you have an early flight before 8:30 AM they will not accommodate you. Also, when I told the desk clerk the issue and asked if there was anything I could do he kind of scoffed at me then laughed. His name was "Bill" I believe from what another employee called him. Well, Bill's bad attitude and foggy glasses as well as the Breckenridge Inn can count myself out. I found a Courtyard Marriott in the vicinity of the airport with an accommodating shuttle, better customer service, and way better reviews on cleanliness and experience than the Breckenridge for $20 more. Proceed with caution as these other reviews aren't flattering, either.One word:  ghetto. Room and hallways smelled like fried chicken grease. We moved hotels for our second night.  It does have an old, outdoor tennis court, which might be the best amenity. Breakfast was a mediocre cattle carb feed, but better than nothing.  I recommend sticking to the Raisin Bran, OJ, & coffee. Service quality low at front desk for Friday night check in.  Required guest to walk back through dark parking lot to get new key cards when we couldn't get into the building after check in, leaving one person waiting outside with bags, rather than immediately deliver working keys to us. Experienced a low sense of security, even inside building.Horrible. Stayed two nights. No housekeeping service. Signs outside say  doors locked after 9pm. They're not. Sheets on my bed were on inside out. Pillows are miserable. "Breakfast" over at 10 am. I missed it and asked for a yogurt. "We have no yogurt" was all I got   So all in all a hotel piece of crap.The Breckinridge Inn in Louisville has many problems.  The air conditioner in our room was broken and squealing so bad that you couldn't even stay in the room.  Called maintenance and they took out the filters, said they were the wrong filters and then cleaned them and put them back in.  Of course this didn't fix the problem.  We couldn't change rooms because the hotel was full.  The hotel didn't do anything to accommodate us.Next was the pool, there are so many members of the Health Club that you can't even find a chair to lay out and enjoy the sun.  The members are drinking alcohol, smoking and eating on the pool deck.Then, we tried to get in the hot tub and a member was rude to us because we wouldn't turn on the jets (we didn't want the jets on).Also, we set our towels out on the second day so we could have a chair to sit in and enjoy the sunshine.  The pool manager took our towels off our chairs and let a member have our chairs.  If the hotel guests aren't going to get respect, perhaps the pool should only be open to members.  Besides, if several chairs weren't broken then maybe this wouldn't have been a problem.This used to be a decent hotel for the money but now things are much worse and they charge you almost twice as much.The hotel is a little outdated but otherwise fine. The rooms are extremely well kept and the hallways are very quite in the morning and at night. I would recommend this place for people with 1 or 2 pets.When we first checked in the man at the front desk was nice. We got our room without any remarks about our two dogs. The room itself was of a reasonable size with two full beds, a desk, nightstand and a T.V. stand. The beds were very clean and the floor didn't have a trace of dirt.The hotel has an indoor, heated pool with a hot tub and an outdoor, non-heated pool. There are life guards at each pool and you are required to sign in before you can get in. Also the indoor pool has two lap lanes.If you are expecting a modern hotel you will be disappointed, but if you don't mind a dated hotel for cheap, this place is perfect. It was clean and the staff was friendly. The free wifi wasn't slow either. It's in good shape for its obvious age, but there are signs here and there of needed maintenance....Very basic level cheap hotel. Clean. Easy to get lost in the long, winding hallways. At check-in, they didn't mention the continental breakfast (we just happened to see the sign) or wifi (and there was no info in the room about either. The clerk also gave us bad directions on parking area near our room. I had to call downstairs to ask for wifi password. Fewer washcloths (2) in the room than guests (3).I've eaten at plenty of cheap hotel continental breakfasts before, but never seen one that had no fruit, no yogurt, no waffle maker. Except for hard-boiled eggs and oatmeal packets, it was pretty much all bread. Good plentiful hot coffee, though. I just wouldn't do it more than one day, most likely. We're going to the indoor pool tonight, which looks nice and has lanes for lap swimming, which is great. But we largely picked the hotel for the pool and at check-in learned that my daughter wouldn't be allowed to use the hot tub (12 and older) - guess that could be a selling point for some, but it was a big disappointment for her.So nothing awful about the place or anything, but nothing great either.Stayed here overnight and was very disappointed. Pool was very big and nice but exercise room was below average and treadmills would not go past 3 mph. I did not expect something modern and luxurious but they seem to be trying to get away with the absolute least. I understand running a hotel but I also understand the need to create a nice place for your guests to stay. We went down for breakfast in the morning and it was awful, you could tell that all of the food came out of packages and I know this is the case with many continental breakfasts but at least they make it seem as if it is not. No freshly made food and extreme limited quantity and a very small variety of anything. Walls are very thin and could hear children all night. Over all, I was disappointed. My family and I used to be members of their pool and loved it but I can't say the same about the hotel.One of the worst hotel experiences I've had in a while. I requested a downstairs room so it'd be easier to carry in our luggage and big rolling cooler. I did not get one, which usually I can live with, but this hotel has only one elevator and at the lobby which was far from our room. Ok, I'm fine, BUT once we wheeled and carried everything on we had a rough time because the hallways have steps all throughout the hotel. We had to keep stopping and my daughter and I would have to lift heavy items together each set of stairs. It was also very hot in the halls which didn't help our situation. So, on the day of checkout, I parked at the lobby entrance and we lugged our heavy items back up & down all the steps, down the halls, to the elevator and out to the car in two trips.  Then, I drove our car around to the entrance close to our room to pack up the rest of our lighter weight stuff.  Well, even though I had our key card, the doors wouldn't open! So, back in the car and drive back to the lobby! Understand too that during all this there was never anyone at the front desk! So, since we were in town for a swim meet that we had to be at each day at 6:45, this was starting to get irritating to say the least. It was 6:30 and I needed to check out. Also, the last 2 nights we were there, I was woke up at 3:40 am until after 4 am and then 12:30 am the next night because of people being loud and rambunctious in the hallway and rooms next to us. Finally, someone was at the desk just in time for us to make it to our meet and I approach out of breath, sweating, and tired. I complain and he says "you should have let me know and I would have got the door for you."  I respond, "no one was here!"  Well, he didn't say much to that. No offer to discount or anything. I won't stay again. Too bad. The pool is actually nice, but that's all I enjoyed. Everything else was a pain.I gave This business a second chance.  It's a convenient place to stay.  This time I was given a room in a different part of the building and it was a quiet spot.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The counter person was friendly.  The price was reasonable for a week day rate.I have stayed here twice in the last 4 weeks visiting friends. I am from the Detroit area. The first time I was alone and because of a room mix up I was upgraded to a mini suite for my next visit with my husband. I had great experiences both times. The rooms were clean and affordably priced. The staff was super friendly and helpful. On my last visit, the gentleman at the front desk was nice enough to accommodate my friends and I in one of their party/conference room for pizza when we were rained out at the pool. The pools are awesome! You can take coolers and food. They are very well kept and looked after. The guests are like one big family and everyone was always so friendly. This is my go to place whenever we are in town now. Downfall was the beds could be a little more comfy but we slept well enough.I don't know if I stayed at a different hotel than all these five star ratings or if they are fake reviews. We had a connecting room with the rest of our party and their room was 'fine' except for a dirty vent in the shower (that I was made aware of). We went in February so no pools were open. Our room, on the other hand, was pitiful. Walking in the room we were immediately smothered by an overpowering smoke smell in the 'non smoking' room. It was in the central system, sheets, towels. Everywhere. I can handle smoke somewhat but this was awful. There isn't much more to say other than I spent over $30 on air fresheners trying to mask the smoke. Our ice bucket had mold in it. Thank goodness we didn't plan on using it. The sheets on one bed and some towels were dirty. Hopefully just stained...I hope. And the mattresses in both rooms were like sleeping on cardboard. Very thin and old. I don't mind sleeping on uncomfortable beds but not when the rooms were on the more expensive side. The walls were super thin! Both mornings we awoke to retching. Not ours. Somebody must have had a stomach bug or something. If my rooms had been more updated it would have been a cute hotel. The wifi was very fast. The breakfast was good. Normal hotel breakfast. Unless under dire circumstances, I will not be staying here again.Omg! Scary hotel! Run down, elevators not maintained, dirty and run down rooms. No Managers on Duty. Loser punk runs the pool sits there and texts all day. Never saw housekeeping the 2 nights we were there...Breakfast lady was nice thoThis is definitely a two star hotel - despite the favorable reviews. Their website has the touched up photos that makes the whites a little brighter and everything much more flattering.  I mean why not ... it's not like most of you will post ugly pictures of yourself.Some convention was going on in Louisville so I didn't have a whole lot of choices in where I could stay.  It was cheap and since I once had a room that had blood on the sheets, I can pretty much tolerate anything.  It was clean ... but dingy.  Walls are thin - so I could hear a lot of the noise outside - outside my door and outside the window.  Free wifi, but connection was slow as molasses.  I tried all 3-4 wifi connections and could barely surf the web, much less watch Netflix or something.  Also - the TV remote didn't have a sleep option so I couldn't drown out some of the noise outside with the TV either.  It was fine though.  Sheets were white and the towels were clean.  Dominos delivers (instead of room service).  It's right off the freeway so decent location.  I stayed in the city last time I was in town - and getting to / from my rental car and in / out of the city was a challenge ... but I might prefer to do that than stay here again.  I worked most of the time and needed a bit more quiet and a more dependable internet. But for the price ... and on vacation, this would have been fine.  Oh .. .and maybe if I brought my dog ... b/c I heard a dog barking down the hall.Breckinridge Inn Hotel was such an upgrade from the Econo Lodge I first stayed at in downtown Louisville.  I found the hotel for cheap on Priceline the day I had to check in.The bedroom was clean and the bed didn't have any crusty stains like a lot of hotels do.  The bed was comfortable and the TV was great.  The bathroom was nice and clean.They have two pools, inside and outside and an inside jacuzzi.  Both were nice and clean.  It was kind of weird to see a lifeguard on duty at a pool.Breakfast was great.  They served biscuits and sausage, cereal and toast.  I got to breakfast late because my hotel room alarm clock was 10 minutes slow.  The only down side was you could not take your breakfast back to the room with you.Will stay at the Breckenridge again if they have their rooms for under $60 again!Expected a three star hotel and really got a two star. Has many amenities but are very subpar. Wifi is slow and continually drops, fitness center is from 1984 and some of the equipment needs repair, tv in room was from 1999. The rooms however were clean and the staff was very friendly.
review_content_20: A pretty good hotel with very reasonable pricing. As far as hotels go, they offered everything we needed and did so without any issues. The hotel is older and that shows, but that would not deter us from staying there again. Our daughters really enjoyed the indoor pool which was also kept very clean. The breakfast was the only area lacking in my opinion, as there was not a great variety of foods offered.Nice enough place. Nice 'Health Club' with 2 pools and gym. Price was better on Travelocity.com than directly though their own website.Stayed for 4 nights.Fantastic place to stay and the price is perfect, first off the day front desk staff was super friendly and went above and beyond to make my stay enjoyable...large rooms, very tidy, sheets were white and the towels were clean. Friendly housekeeping and the shuttle driver from the airport was awesome. Very Impressed with the service and staff and overall appearance. Wifi was a bit slow but not a huge deal.The price is just right for what you get. The staff is consistently nice and the rooms are always very clean. We have stayed here many times in the past few years. Their workout area definitely could use updating but it is very functional for a good workout.Oh WOW! I have payed twice as much or more for a room and not been half as pleased as I was with this hotel. So charming and plush. The grounds, hallways, parking lot, pools, and most of all rooms were clena as can be, and I have high standards. The bed was huge and so comfortable. When we walked in the ac was already on and working great, the room was at a very comfortable temperature (most hotels leave the ac off when there are no guests in them, meaning when you first get in the room its uncomfortably hot) The wifi was plenty fasty enough, i noticed they had 3 seperate wifi signals of varying strenght, one for each wing I suppose. The shower was extremely comfy, the shower head had many speeds and good pressure and the heat lamp was a nice touch. Plenty of towels and pillows too! At around 50.00 a night this place is a steal!Not bad for the price we paid through expedia including car rental. The hotel was close enough to everything from restaurants, malls and airport. The only draw back was it smells musty inside the room and hallway. Also it would be great if there will be no smoking at least 100 ft away from the hotel entrance. But overall love the continental breakfast that's provided and for keeping the room tidy and ready in time.

review_content: Look, I don't look for anything fancy when I stay at hotels. I stay at hotels simply for somewhere to lay my head at the end of the day, because I like to explore wherever I'm at. In this particular instance, I was here to discover Bourbon Trail.The hotel is very easy to get to from the highway, and is attached to their sister Fairfield Inn & Suites. Parking was rather inexpensive for downtown (I think maybe $15!?) and right next to the hotel - so very convenient. The check in process was smooth and my group headed up to our rooms. We had three rooms, all with two double beds. The rooms were HUGE. They're clean and spacious (even including a half bath!?), which was a quite a deal given the price. The hotel's swimming pool and gym were well kept and the breakfast buffet was delicious. The hotel is only four blocks away from Bourbon Trail, and it was very safe.Overall, it was a wonderful stay and I highly recommend this Marriott property. Once again, Marriott delivers.Great hotel!!Staff 5/5 extremely professional. And I mean on point!! Treated me like I was in a $500/night hotel. Very personal and respectful.Area 5/5 your right off 65 in the heart of downtown Louisville, can't go wrong with that.Facility 5/5 great building with on site parking and special parking for Elite members.Rooms 5/5 these rooms are very nice and spacious!! Perfect in every way.Love this place, will definitely come back when in town.I guess if I could say anything bad it would be. 1) parking isn't free but what downtown parking in any large city is. 2) the rooms have 1.5 baths with is impressive but the .5 has a sink so small it's almost unusable.So that was searching for complaints but if you asked me overall I have none.I enjoyed the rooms in the hotel. They are newly updated, modern, simple, and having the commode in a separate from from the shower was a cool, Japanese-style touch. I stayed alone, but I could appreciate how that set-up would be nice for a couple or a family. My room had a small living-room area that was well designed. Of the 4 Marriott brand hotels where I've stayed downtown this year, this one had my favorite room.The shuttle was a nice perk. Try to make a reservation for it because it's popular.  The breakfast was just ok. The hotel is a short walk to several restaurants and I found the staff to be friendly.  The lollipops at the front desk were a pleasant surprise.Looking to stay in central location in Louisville? This is the hotel for you! Are you that person who wants to explore the city and doesn't REALLY care about what the room looks like as long as it's modern? This hotel is for you! SpringHill Suites is modern, clean, and exactly what you want when you pop into a city for the night. Is it swanky/modern no. Is it renovated? Yes. The bed was super cozy and for some reason we had two bathrooms in our room. I loved the cool calming color scheme, and the small couch and table were nice to eat a snack on after traveling. I'm the type of person that skips the character and goes for a modern hotel anytime - the clean lines are just more calming to me. But this hotel is all about the location and the price cannot be beat. Just a few blocks from anything downtown and a $3-$4 uber ride to NuLu. Would definitely be my choice hotel when staying in Louisville again - and don't forget your AAA discount!The rooms are nice. Spacious and clean. They respect my privacy that's always good. The chair, couch, and bed are all comfortable. The bathroom is clean and has what we need.The lobby leaves something to be desired but most people probably don't hang out there so it's okay I suppose. And the adjacent hotel that they are connected to has a more spacious lobby and sitting area.Free wifi is pretty standard for this type of hotel. So nothing special to report except that it didn't let me play by cellphone games. It connected the first day, I think, but the second and third days it didn't. Sad. Parking is easy but the entry into the hotel area is a little confusing from the street. Good location. Good food. Clean, fresh, and delicious breakfast.Recommend it whole heartedly.This place is not being rated on an absolute scale - so no comparison to the four seasons or a motel 6, I am rating it based on what it is, a centrally located no frills hotel. The room was clean and well maintained with no signs of wear or lack of care. The beds in our double queen room where well cared for. The pull out queen was great for three kids and we didn't feel crowded on our stay here while road tripping to the tail of the dragon. The hotel front desk woman was beyond welcoming!!  She checked me in within 5 minutes flat and did so while dealing with another guest. She then walks outside to meet me in their guest parking lot to direct me into a space since I was hauling my bike on a trailer and wanted two spots to park. She actually took a ten minute break to assist me into the space. After going to my room I came back down to get my luggage and the security man for the property surprised me and my son by the car -- probably doing his job --- but and here is the kicker -  he never confronted us in a unfriendly way instead he says can I help you with your luggage to your room which he does taking up half our luggage all by himself. Both the front desk woman on duty on the evening of August 15, 2015 and the security guard who helped with our luggage were outstanding examples of hospitality. The morning had us downstairs for a complimentary breakfast but frankly unless here on business I would try one of the nearby local joints I have reviewed as its a meh breakfast mostly prepared foods no real eggs or omelettes or strong coffee - but it's a nice touch for families who are busyFantastic free breakfast buffet, complete with an oatmeal bar. Our room was very clean and modern. Wifi works great. Convenient location close to bars and restaurants downtown.We stayed last week one night at the SpringHIll Suites for a Bachelorette Party.  The room was great and clean.  The beds are SUPER comfortable and plenty of space.  I loved that they seperated the shower/sink and another sink and toilet area.  It made it great for the amount of people who were staying the night.  Our suite had 2 queen beds and a pull out couch.  We comforatbly fit 5 people.  The only downfall of the room was that the alarm clock/iPod dock did not work for music and there wasn't a safe in the room (if you care about that kind of thing.  I personally dont have anything safe-worthy but noticed it and thought it was worth mentioning).  The continental breakfast was STELLAR (by continetal standards)  They offered oatmeal with plenty of toppings, cereal, eggs, sausage,  bacon and biscuits, along with pastries, toast,englush muffins, and bagels.  The fruti was fresh and the coffee was great.A few reason I didn't give them the 5th star:  the parking garage was a mess and the machine messed up BOTH times when I tried to enter and exit.  There was no clear help button so I had to set in my car, call the hotel, and wait as a line formed behind me.  The pool area was kind of grimy.  There were tons of noddles and used pool toys lying around and overall just didn't have a good feel to it.  As previousy stated the breakfast offerings were great but the seating in the room was limited and the space was underutliized making it hard to accomoadate the amoutn of people who were trying to eat breakfast.Overall I would definitly reccomend this hotel to friends and family (minus the pool experience).The room was clean, recently updated, and had a nice layout with a work and sitting area separated from the sleeping area by a substantial partition.  Not truly a suite, but it worked well for our family, allowing my wife and daughter to turn in early while I stayed up and read.  The room had a separate "WC" (water closet) with toilet and small sink, and bathroom with full sink and tub/shower.  This works well when you have a teenage daughter who takes an hour in bathroom, while you take your morning constitutional with the newspaper in the WC.  The free breakfast was better than most, and the staff very friendly and helpful.  Location was nice: close to downtown, and free shuttle to most locations.  Parking on site was a challenge, with a small parking structure overflowing with cars.  There are only ice machines on every other floor, and only the  one on 2 worked.  This hotel is directly connected to the Fairfield Inn and Suites, which is confusing and makes it easy to get lost if, like me, you lack any God-given sense of direction.  But overall, I liked this place, and would stay again.Checked in to an 8th floor room the hallway and room were very musty. We were moved to the 7th floor to a much better room, however the room was still in need of some updating. Most furniture was worn but the beds were very comfortable.Breakfast was just on the fair side. The second morning breakfast ended at 9 am instead of 10 am (like the morning before) and we missed it.The pool was small but nice and well maintained.  It did have a 5 person limit.The staff was extremely helpful and kind.GREAT SERVICE, ACCOMODATIONS & AMENITIES!Had to make a pit stop here on a road trip back to Chicago from Atlanta and boy my family and I were on cloud 9!There was 7 of us with age ranging from 60-something to 3 years old and this place met everyone's special needs from a fridge to store medication, a complimentary substantial hearty breakfast, comfy luxurious beds you name it!They also pre-warmed our rooms so that we wouldn't have to bear the winter chill waiting for the heater to kick in to make the room comfortable...this is what really made a 5-PLUS star experience!The great interior design and style was definitely a bonus.  We also appreciated the proximity of the Muhammad Ali Center and made a stop before getting back on the road.Would definitely make this a regular stop on our future Chicago-Atlanta road trips!Typical cookie-cutter suite type hotel. I thought the rooms were a little Spartan, but they were clean and comfortable. What made my stay great though, was the friendliness of the staff. The breakfast buffet was average, but the fitness room was excellent!Great location for this hotel. The room is huge and clean. I do like the separate toilet but the sink in that room is too small and almost unusable. Carpet is little dated especially in the hallways. I was expecting hot/warm cookies in the evening but didn't see any during the 2 nights stay. The breakfest was ok, typical. Scramble eggs was hot but little watery. Would be nice to have "make your own waffle". free WiFi was great but too slow. In summary, I would come back next time I visit.This was the perfect hotel for our needs.  My friends and I were down in Louisville to complete the Urban Bourbon Trail and just needed a place to sleep that night.  Nothing fancy, but clean.  The room was spacious and modern, with clean linens.  The best part of the room was that the toilet was separate from the shower.  Score!  This was great for 4 girls getting ready in the morning and I wish all hotels were this smart.  The room was also equipped with a microwave, mini fridge, television (with a clean remote, whatever that means), desk, and couch.  Parking was great at $10/day because they allow you to come and go as much as needed, with the use of key card.  They even allowed us to leave our car there for the day after we had checked out and wanted to explore the city more.  The staff was friendly and helpful, making the checking in/out process simple.  I cannot comment on the pool because we didn't go but I will be sure to check it out in the future.  You also get free breakfast with your stay, but we overslept...too much delicious bourbon!  This hotel was in a great location and we were able to walk literally everywhere we wanted to go.  There are obviously fancier, historic hotels in the area but this is perfect for someone who just wants a nice place to crash.  Highly recommend!Great location, positive, helpful staff, clean, comfortable rooms. Got it cheap on Priceline Express deals, so even better!Stayed one night and I wasn't overly impressed.  The best things were the friendly staff and the complimentary Continental Breakfast.The room was laid out really strange.  The bathroom and the shower were in separate spaces, and the doors to each had the frosted glass.  Because my wife and I shared the room with another couple (2 queen beds), the frosted windowed doors were not the most comfortable situation.  The beds were very spongy and uncomfortable.  None of us had a decent night's sleep.   There was a couch separated by a desk/glass sliding doors partition from the bed area, but there was no tv in the couch area, which I found to be a little strange.  The walls seem to be thinner than normal as well.  We could hear the people in the room next to ours talking and laughing late into the night.  One of them had BAD gas, if you know what I mean.  The walls were rattling on occasion, and the laughter ensued from both their room AND ours.Upon receiving the hotel bill, slipped under our door, I noticed a $45 "LD" charge, which I thought maybe was mistakenly our neighbor's "Loud Dump" for disturbing the peace.  After checking with the front desk, they said it was a long distance call we had made - of which we didn't.  They looked into it, and then revealed it was billed to us in error - it was supposed to have been billed to room 515 and NOT 415.  It sounded fishy and I was just happy they took it off my bill.If in the area overnight, I won't be staying here again.  Keep looking, folks.Free wifi, free breakfast, discounted parking, near everything I need, what's not to like.  I have been here 9 weeks, so far....and counting, and have had any issue resolved quickly by the staff.  Mostly minor items, something not working, dripping, etc.  One star removed for the POOR Bistro 301 that provides their room service, not worth the time or expense of ordering from there.wifi (or wired) is pretty speedy, even when I know the hotel is full.  You even can pay for faster access if you wish.I have stayed at this location a few times. It is fairly close to the Yum Center and Fourth Street...which was the reason that I booked it the first time. Very clean, spacious and a breakfast buffett is offered. My only quarrel is the pricing is never the same. The closer to the booking date, the more it usually is.Very comfortable stay!This hotel was great.  The staff were fun, friendly, and very helpful.  We were in town to celebrate my husband's birthday and we like to park and walk everywhere.  They made sure we had a map and pointed out several places of interest.  There is a parking garage for guests and parking was just $10 a day.  The services surpassed those of other hotels.  The wireless internet was free for 3 days and if it wasn't fast enough you could pay a small fee for faster internet.  There was also a wired connection in the room.  The workout room had 3 treadmills, weights, and other machines.  Free breakfast was on the second floor and there was a large variety.  There were strawberry, blueberry, regular, and cinnamon waffles.  They also had different hot options every morning.  These included sausage and egg one day, bacon and mini omelet another day, and biscuits with gravy on Sunday.Now the most important part . . . the room.  It was clean, spacious, and very comfortable.  The bed was so comfortable that I slept through the night and I don't usually sleep all night in a hotel.The location was also perfect because we explored downtown and went to a baseball game and it is between both.  Anytime we visit downtown Louisville this will be where we stay.Great hotel! Affordable, friendly and helpful staff, comfortable and spacious rooms, clean and close to everything! One of the sinks in our room (yes, there were 2!) stopped draining and maintenance fixed it while we were out. The front desk staff even wrote us a little note with bottled water and a snack to let us know the sink was fixed. I've never felt more welcome!
review_content_20: This Marriott cousin is a posh little number for an affordable price. The rooms boast modern IKEA-themed decor with cool stainless steel furnishings. As our room was filled with four ladies, we were thrilled to discover each suite had a separate toilet room and shower room. That's right, no more sharing facilities! The room also had a microwave and mini fridge, as well as a lounge sofa and a modern desk with built-in privacy wall. That means, if needed, four people can change clothes at one time: one in each bathroom, one in the bed area, and one behind the privacy wall. The bedding was white cotton, all washable, with no germy old comforter. There was also an iClock, where I could dock my iPhone overnight for charging. Our sleep was wonderful. It was pretty quiet, couldn't hear any of the other neighboring guests. Things did get a bit loud around 3:00AM from people leaving the bars at Fourth Street Live. Our room was on Floor 4, so if street noise is an issue, ask for a higher up room. (I think there are 7 or 9 floors.)Garage parking was pretty affordable at $10.00 per day. It's in a secure area and a guard is always on duty. You can go in an out as many times as you want. Located along the Urban Bourbon Trail and near many of Louisville's must-see attractions, SpringHill Suites is a great place to rest your head in Derby City.Price: $116.00 per roomParking: $10.00 per dayI stayed here for a convention in Oct 2014. The staff was very helpful and the room was quiet and comfortable. The staff was exceptionally helpful, suggesting restaurants based on our schedule needs with the conference, making sure we knew where we could go and how to get anywhere. Jaqueline, Autumn, and Austin were so extremely nice and helpful that nearly a month later I'm remembering to mention them in a review! Thank you! Bacon everyday would be great ;-)This is the only hotel to stay in when going to downtown Louisville. The rooms are bigger than any others in the area, have refrigerators, and the breakfast is amazing. It's only a 5 minute walk to the convention center. Stay here!My company put me up in this hotel during my time in Louisville. The hotel is nice. Parking is a bit tight. Your room key gets you to the upstairs parking. The staff was really nice. There is breakfast on the second floor. Location is great. Freeways are close by. You can even walk to downtown Louisville. The room I had was just right. Clean and quiet.GExtremely clean, entire 2nd floor is devoted to breakfast, free in/out privledges and cheap parking.Our room was very modern, with a comfy bed and L-shaped couch that had a fold out sleeper. Great location, about 5 blocks from Slugger Field.Free wifi and free breakfast. Pretty perfect.We arrived here late at night and left mid morning, so we weren't able to utilize all of the hotel's amenities. Nonetheless, I was still pretty satisfied with our stay.Things i enjoyed were the free Wi-Fi in our room for up to three days, free hot breakfast for all guests, and contemporary style of the place. The toilet room and shower room were separate. The sink in the toilet room was so small. It was hard to brush your teeth without spilling water all over the floor. There weren't many mirrors and the only two sinks were in either the toilet room or the shower room, so if people were in them, you couldn't wash your hands or look at yourself in the mirror.We called the front desk to ask for recommendations on places to eat with two young ones. The person wasn't much help, but did recommend walking to Main Street, which was two blocks away. We walked and realized at night, it wasn't the most appropriate place for two young ones. There were many pubs and bars.Located next to what appeared to be a major medical center.Once in the land of burnt necks and "y'alls", we made a b-line to our hotel. Lucky me got my own suite, sweet!For some reason the entire hotel was 70's themed. From the couch in my room with Ikea lamp, yelp.com/biz_photos/FZyw..., to the oddly decorated breakfast bar area. None the less, my stay here was awesome. The bed was adorned with half a dozen pillows of varying firmness and the desk with ample power strip and free internet was perfect for my business needs. yelp.com/biz_photos/FZyw...Full size ironing board and iron went unused thanks in part to my wonderful girl's ironing and folding skills and the fact that I turned the shower room into a steam room to let out a couple luggage born wrinkles. There was a nice alarm clock with built in Ipod dock so I could wake up to something other than country music on the radio. In the morning we hit up the well stocked hot breakfast bar. The decor was right out of the Brady Bunch. But the food was just right for a mid-range hotel. Nice hot mushy cereal, crisp cold dry cereal and a bevy of sausage patties and dried up eggs. If work demands I go to Kentucky again, I'll be sure to stay here!Couldn't have been a better spot for a family with two twins under two. We arrived late on Thanksgiving and were warmly greeted and as we entered our room to our surprise they had already set up two high quality pack n plays for our girls to slumber in. As we awake in the morning we went downstairs for the complimenatry breakfast which was actually pretty darned good and made our life much easier as there were great options for our girls including oatmeal, fresh fruit and yogurt. The only downside was that we didn't like the pillows on the bed but because the overall experience was so good we'll just bring out own next time as well as our bathing suits. Well done SpringHill! We'll be back!Great Hotel. $10 a day for parking (full in and out) , convenient location and a short walk to 4th street live and all of the other hotel bars (Galt, Browns, Steelbach etc). Staff was nice, wifi worked in rooms, Large breakfast selection with healthy choices. Extremely clean hotel, very spacious rooms, including a microwave and fridge which we put to good use. Stayed for 4 days in October, could not be more pleased.I've stayed here both times I've stayed the weekend in Louisville for drinking with friends. They are usually running some kind of special for $100 a night on the weekend. The staff here is really friendly, and the breakfast in the morning is great! The rooms sleep 6 (2 each on the bed, and then there's a sleeper sofa), so it's great for larger groups. These rooms are huge, with a separate shower and toilet room. Both Ethernet and Wifi were available here free of charge.My most recent stay this last weekend: We had booked 2 rooms, paid, and checked in. After finding we'd only need one room, since not as many people were staying the night as we'd thought, I was able to call down to the front desk, and after they sent someone up to make sure we hadn't done anything to the spare room (we'd only poked our heads in, and maybe turned on a light), they gladly refunded the cost of the second room. How cool is that?!?!I'll definitely be back to this place again; the rooms are nicely sized, affordable, and the staff here is top notch.One front desk attendant, friendly in the evening, but the morning girl-- did not greet us or say hello, just ignored us as we walked out. The carpet needs replacing. The hotel room was fine but the people a few doors down from us banged doors all night, from 3:30 am on.. (You know, where you put the metal thing out to keep the door from locking?) -Called and talked to front desk but they did nothing. The beds were comfy and clean linens but I hate dirty carpet and it was, ugh gross. At least on the 6th floor where we stayed. The pool and weight room, very nice and clean. There also were not enough towels in the room for our family of 5. Free breakfast was nice but we went to Lynn's Paradise to eat a big breakfast. Lots of ambulances at night but maybe because of hospitals nearby.

review_content: When looking for a top tier service hotel on Fourth Street, many automatically presume Seelbach or that other place, but the brand new and gorgeous Embassy Suites puts its snooty neighbors to shame! The building is modern and comfortable- I felt like I was on set for a glam photo shoot. Rooms are spacious, beautiful and incredibly comfortable. The property is superbly clean and very well maintained. All of the staff I've encountered during my three day stay have been exceptional. Valets, front desk, omelette station, even a minor maintenance emergency was always friendly, prompt and with a genuine smile. Joyce helped us find coffee and greeted us every morning with a "southern mamma's" attention. Daniel was a multitasking machine behind the bar at the managers evening reception and made sure everyone wasn't thirsty or hungry anymore. I was impressed watching the employees over a few days- they are THE example of a cooperative hospitality team. I won't stay anywhere else in Louisville.  No one else should either.We absolutely loved our stay at Embassy Suites. We were in Louisville for the Kentucky Bourbon Trail and wanted to stay downtown near 4th Street Live. Getting to the hotel was not difficult, but trying to figure out where to go for valet parking was a little bit of a challenge as we were coming in on the busy street in front of the hotel. I had to call the front desk to get a little guidance as we drove around the block. The staff was friendly and led us to where we needed to be. FYI you need to be traveling north on 4th street...valet will be on your right.
