They charge $27, which I thought to be a little steep, but was nice not having to worry about where to park.Checking in was simple, as I had already done so on the Hilton Honors app. We just had to stop at the front desk for our key cards. The moment we walked into the hotel we were in awe of how beautiful it was. The pictures don't even do it justice...you truly have to see it in person.We stayed on the 6th floor in beautiful, which was a corner suite. Exiting the elevator, the first thing you notice is not a boring hotel hallway, but rather a very upscale classy decor.The room itself was amazing...10-12 ft ceilings and windows, super comfortable large king-sized bed and large flat-screen tv in the bedroom, comfortable couch, lounge chair, flat screen tv and desk in the sitting area, as well as a little kitchen area and a beautiful bathroom with walk-in shower. If you're looking for amazing city views outside your windows, I would suggest staying on a higher floor...the only views we had were of the courtyard outside our room.Breakfast was very good - had a number of choices including hot items, oatmeal, made to order omelettes and french toast + other continental breakfast items. It was easy to get to, the space was very large, and the dining room had a good amount of room and was decorated very nicely. I don't want to be hassled in the morning while getting breakfast and this place was relaxing and easy to use.Checking out was simple...we just handed the keys in and they printed a receipt. The valet guys had our vehicle out front in less than 5 minutes.We absolutely loved our stay here and can't wait to return in the future!If there's one thing I truly love but don't treat myself to enough - it's staying in a nice hotel. I'm usually the one that says "Hey, let's save some money and spend it doing something meaningful/exciting." But in reality, sometimes the place you stay can really set the tone for the trip. And I say this as if you don't know it already - which I know you do. I don't know anyone who is disgusted at the idea of staying at a nice and clean hotel. This place was in PERFECT proximity to 4th Street. I couldn't have been more pleased with the fact that we didn't have to even worry about a cab/Uber for our NYE celebration. We could literally walk out of our hotel, walk about two minutes down the street and then were in the middle of the action. It was perfection. The hotel itself was stunning. I'm a sucker for Christmas, so of course I was ohhh-ing and ahhh-ing at all of the beautiful decorations. Specifically the tree. The rooms were clean and, in my opinion, fancy. Not too fancy, but fancy enough. If this gives you an indication of our take on the room - our entire group of girls actually squealed upon entry. That's how impressed we were with the room. haha Obviously we all needed the night out. And of course - the customer service. We were treated like princesses. I don't know if it was merely the fact that it was NYE and everyone seemed to be in high spirits, but nonetheless, we were treated very well. And I'll remember that on my next trip back to Louisville.Great hotel!! They have completed a renovation that has modern facilities, soothing blue and grey decor with pops of color. The lobby area is massive, valet and front lobby staff very friendly and accommodating. Nice bar in the lobby ran by the restaurant Brandon's 23 next door. But the real action is upstairs on the 3rd floor. Happy hour is free Every day 5:30 to 7:30 pm and it is worth it!!! I had a few of the bartender's specialty drinks including the sangria. The standout drink was the Bourbon Lemon Drop Martini.  I'm ashamed to say how many I drank so I'm not telling. Snacks were just regular snacks.. Nothing special but the ambience and music was wonderful.  We stayed in a 2 bed 2 room Pure suite. The beds, linen and pillows were heavenly. I slept like a baby with the air purifier and the room was comfortably cooled. Word of advice.. If you are a light sleeper ask for a room away from 4th street.  They have concerts nightly on the weekend and the noise doesn't die down until 2am.Great location, clean, spacious rooms.  Breakfast was wonderful - so many good things to choose - healthy options.  Pool was great and spacious.  And exercise room was very good- had a nice variety.  good location.  I would go back there to stay and recommend absolutely.Amazing hotel! Must stay here if you are in the area. I am a Hilton diamond member and have been to a million hotels around the country and this is definitely a favorite (if not the best!). The lobby and bar area is very classy, with new and elegant decore. The building itself is very new and rooms are completely newly remodeled. Location is ideal as it is next to Fourth Street live and a ton of great restaurants and bars. The parking is valet only (but so are all the other parking options in every hotel here). Rooms are spacious, beds are large and not too soft. Bathrooms are huge, new, and very clean. Breakfast is a normal embassy suites breakfast, nothing out of the ordinary... But who cares! It's a gorgeous property, not that expensive, with an extremely accommodating staff!I'm a huge sleep snob and very particular about my hotels and I LOVED this Embassy Suites! Brand new hotel and so very, very quiet.Also, big shout out to Gary at Catch 23 lobby bar. Good times, my friend, good times.This was a beautiful hotel.  The front desk was very helpful - we had thought we booked a one-bedroom suite, but it was just an open suite and they upgraded our reservation without a charge.  The room was gorgeous (especially the bathroom).  Breakfast was wonderful in the morning and everyone was friendly.  Our only regret was that we were only staying one night.  Will definitely return to this hotel again in the future.The other reviews really nailed it, place is very clean, modern right downtown off 4th st and within distance of the Brown and all kinds of other dining/drinking establishments. Valet is all that's offered, not exactly the quickest but they were slammed while we were there. A restaurant and CVS are attached to the lobby which makes any late night necessities not a nightmare.Rooms clean and big, nice layout, huge shower, killer bathroom, lighting was just right, fridge mini bar, two tvs one in the living room other in the bedroom. Free happy hour, snacks 4-6 I believe, bar in the lobby, 3rd floor was breakfast, optional omelette station for those who have to have it. I travel quite a bit still and this place was one of the better hotels I've hit in a while. Would stay here again, highly recommended.I was here for a party over the weekend. Nothing but nice things to say about the interior. however, anything positive ends there. being a birthday party and because I work in photography for a living, I brought my professional camera along with me assuming it would be safe inside the room. I admit that it was my mistake in leaving mycamera in the room when I checked out. however, if the rule of thumb is that anything left in a room is fair game to the people who clean it, housekeepers would be much richer than I am. I am not accusing the staff of stealing my camera. I am, however, frustrated that I was met with little more than a shrug when I told them the magnitude of the camera being stolen. yes, it was stolen because the only way it left the room was by someone taking it. it is true that there is a strong possibility that there will never be a resolution for this. I feel the loss would sting a little less if the people who worked there did a little beyond what their minimum wage requires of them. then again, if I were making peanuts, maybe I would have taken the 4K and run as well. my advice, don't take anything nice to this hotel. it is downtown and as much as I hate playing into stereotypes, this place feels as secure as I do walking around there at night. which isn't very much at all.It's 11:38 pm and I can't sleep because of the deafening noise resonating in my room from a live concert at the 4th street bar area. Get an interior room if you're here on the weekend. It's freaking miserable. I'm not happy.Every time we called to get our car out of valet it took them 20 or even 30 minutes to "find" my car.Superb hotel and staff. Everyone was delightful. Brand new renovation of a much older hotel.Industrial meets sheikh.  We enjoyed the happy hour free drinks and snacks as well as free breakfast including made to order omelets.The suite was perfect for a family stay and the kids loved the pool.A dinner in the restaurant was easy and yummy in a great environment.  Pan seared salmon and fresh green salad was my choice.Excellent choice on Solid Maple Slab tables, modern accoutrements, large columns, and the high ceilings.  Only negatives were a few finishing strips separating from the walls, lack of enough towel hangers and lack of hot water in the pool rinsing shower. Easy quick fixes all.This hotel should be 4 star.  We did not expect it to be that nice.This Embassy Suites is located in a heavily congested (traffic-wise) area of downtown Louisville. It's a really beautiful historic property that has been retrofitted with a nice, sleek, clean, modern interior. Arrived after a stressful drive in torrential rain to a valet area that held, maybe four vehicles. Still raining, the valets were rushing to get items out of the car, understandably, but the rushing was an unwelcome, welcome. The two bus people were actually really sweet and friendly while taking items to the room, so that made up for the earlier rushing.I'm Hilton Honors Silver, and, when checking in, reminded the desk lady of this. She said, "oh, well, you can get a drink from the cooler over there" - which was an orange juice. Hmmmm. I'm used to the two bottles of water in the room, or more benefits, not one small orange juice for a 3 day stay. Maybe I'm not well-versed in the Silver experience.So, on to the room. I preselected my room to have a nice view, room 601. It really did have a nice street view! Tall ceilings make these suites seem super-large. The bathroom was super-spacious and the majority of the flooring is granite (or granite-like), with carpet in the living area and the separate bedroom. The suite really has an elevated look and feel. It included the standard ES fare: nice sized refrigerator, wet bar sink, microwave and the one-pouch coffee makers that I despise. I was happy to have brought my own coffee maker.There is no bathtub, just one large walk-in shower, which leaked at the door opening. So, every post-shower experience ended in a sopping wet bath mat. The toilet "ran" constantly, meaning the tank never filled to the correct capacity to shut off. I reported this issue and it was promptly fixed, which was nice.Room service was interesting. The food was not especially good. When I realized a side was missing and the condiments were wrong/missing, I re-called room service and was told they would "fix it right away" and they never bothered sending anything up. Zilch. That was a little disappointing.Also disappointing was the attitude of the bartender working on Friday October 1. After coming in from checking out the area, I asked him for a "birthday cake" shot. He rather mocked me with an attitude of "drag yourself into the new millennium" and told me, "I can't make that, I don't have the ingredients" and then returned to visiting with the ~ 6 or 8 people seated at his bar. I said, "well is there another drink that you would recommend for someone?" and was told "no."  I googled the ingredients and saw Frangelico and vodka are the birthday cake shot ingredients, and both were behind the bar. Really? I've bartended and the keys include: a. a good attitude b. suggestive sales c. please the customer. He failed in all categories, and worked the entire weekend, which kept me OUT of the ES bar. It really was embarrassing and uncalled for. Oh well, other, friendlier area restaurants/bars got my business.Another notable thing, which is not ES's fault, is the amount of panhandling at the side door and front door area. Everything from, "can I have a buck or two for _____?" to "Got a cigarette it's been a heckuva day, and a lighter?" - Without cease. It is my fault for not calling in the leaking shower at the base of the door issue, and the room service issue and the bartender attitude issue, as these were distractions from what otherwise had the potential to be an epic Embassy Suites experience.Actually had reservations at the Galt House but chose to change them for a few reasons. Best decision ever! Pleasantly surprised on the quality of this hotel. We love to stay at Embassy Suites  on our travels due to the managers reception and omelet and buffet breakfast that is always included. This place is by far the nicest Embassy Suites we have stayed in to date. As I am a Hilton Honors member I love to use the app to check in. That works flawlessly! Just say hi and get the room cards. Checkout is just as quick with an email receipt. Do yourself a favor when visiting Louisville and stay here. There is also a CVS store connected to the lobby so you can get all your needs (including beer, wine, and liquor) at normal prices. The only drawback is no onsite parking. But I did not mind the walk around the block for six dollar overnight parking. They do have valet for 27 dollars overnight but I admit I like to save a buck or two when I can!Great hotel with a great staff in a great location. (Literally half a block from 4th street Live)This hotel is so nice! The place is huge! When checking the lady wasn't the friendliest, she couldn't use my rewards card  because it was under my friends name and didn't mind that I used it for the room. Then she still wasn't going to give us a gift bag because my rewards number was not put on the room, but ended up giving it to us anyway. Our room keys didn't work even after going down to get new ones. We were extremely tired and just annoyed Bc kept having to lug our luggage all over the place. Finally a gentleman came up and carried out luggage to our room. The room was so nice! It had a bedroom with huge windows and a living room. The bathroom was so nice too with a waterfall like shower. It is also downtown so it's close to everything. I would make sure that when you are using valet to make sure you tell the front desk because they will charge it to the room and not to pay again when getting your car. I got charged twice. I would definitely stay here again.One of the most unexpected, fantastic stays Ive had in a while. A clean, revamped hotel with an enthusiastic, warm staff who on three separate occasions hooked us up. Stay here when in Louisville.I never give ratings online but this hotel is my first exception. These rooms are amazing. The hotel is in a great location and beautiful interior layout. Whether you're single or with a large family this is where you want to stay in downtown Louisville.Was great. I travel a lot to Louisville for work & this was one of the best places I've stayed (along w/ the Seelbach Hilton). It is clean, modern, & comfortable. I would definitely go back!!This is a really nice hotel. Perfectly located I will stay here everytime I come to LouisvilleLovely hotel with garbage customer service. Booked a room for 3 nights a full 4 months in advance. Called to change my reservation (only needed 2 nights instead of 3) and didn't find out until I got my email confirmation that my rates increased $50/night. Called back thinking surely this was just an error... Nope! Was told by the lady answering the phone their rates change from day to day and by changing my reservation I would also be changing my rate. This may be their policy but it felt a bit ridiculous since I only reduced the number of nights on an existing reservation. I would've understood paying a higher rate to change the dates completely or add additional nights. Apparently Embassy Suites would prefer to make an extra $100 than keep a loyal customer. I ended up booking somewhere else. It's a shame because the hotel has always been one of my favorites.
review_content_20: I'm a Hilton Diamond member. This is by far the best Embassy Suites I've ever been too! It feels like a very upscale hotel...not just another Embassy. If you want luxury, a great staff and a great complimentary happy hour... Come here! I feel like I just spoke a commercial but I dish out bad reviews and I can give good reviews too. Best hotel in Louisville, KY hands down.This place was an incredible surprise. We've stayed at other Embassy Suites in the past and this was by far the nicest. The rooms are impeccable and service was great as well. The front desk attendant mentioned that the hotel was fairly new and that the building had undergone considerable renovations. The location is also perfect - right outside Fourth Street Live. Given the location, service, and normal amenities of an Embassy Suites (hot breakfast, evening reception, etc.) this place was an incredible value!Such a nice hotel! It was recently opened and you can tell, everything is brand new and very, very clean. The people are super nice. Great reception in the evening and breakfast spread in the morning!This hotel is phenomenal! It's gorgeous, the staff and service are wonderful, and it is perfectly located. Mrs. Armstrong at the front desk was incredibly helpful and corrected an issue that was my mistake in the most cheerful and efficient way possible. Great stay! We will be returning.As someone who is on the road for for 3-5 days a week, I basically live in hotels, and this was one of my best experiences with a hotel I have had to date. I happen to book a room here the first day that they opened and was blown away at how nicely done the hotel was. Parts were still under construction, but the rooms were great, service was phenomenal, and I was able to speak with many of their higher ups as they were at the front desk to welcome their first guests. Their director of sales Dustin was genuinely excited to see their first guests coming in and made sure that everyone was welcomed and comfortable. The complementary drink and food hours were great with some very friendly bar tenders who had some great local recommendations for some good live music. The location is right down town and close to tons of restaurants, bars, and some music venues as well too. I will definitely be staying here exclusively every time I am staying in Louisville.

review_content: Location of the Hotel is excellent - on main street right opposite the World Trade Centre. This has spacious entrance and reception lounge. The rooms are large and adequately furnished.Highly Recommend to all of my friends.Definitely need to retrain the housekeeping staff. Dirty sheets (I found hair that did not belong to me) no fresh towels until I requested them, etc. Heater in bedroom blew cool air, no vent in bathroom, no restaurant onsite, etc. I won't be staying at another Hampton Inn unless I can help it.Not my favorite stay at a Hampton Inn. Not at all. We got into town around 8 and were only staying for the night. We dropped our things in our room and immediately went out to dinner. The room smelled musty from the get-go but everything else was okay looking, if not a little outdated. When we got back to the room for the night around 11 p.m., we realized the door didn't lock, and upon closer inspection, looked as if it had been broken into at one point (not while we were there but in the past). The door was not hanging straight, the plate where the lock sits in the door frame was missing, and the hardware didn't match (as if it had been replaced). We called the front desk, they sent maintenance up, and they confirmed that the door was not locking. About 10 minutes later another employee came up to confirm what we were saying and moved us to another room. I have to wonder why they would put anyone in a room that was clearly damaged, but they did a fairly quick job of moving us. The next room was still a little musty smelling, but not as bad. Bed seemed clean, bathroom was clean, but the vanity stuck out beyond the door frame. Watch your spleen when taking that turn into the bathroom if you ever stay there :)Overall the staff was nice, but nothing about the inconvenience was mentioned at checkout (which I suspect is related to a shift change). Overall, this Hampton Inn isn't as bright and fresh as others at which we have stayed. I wouldn't stay here again if I could help it.The inn could use a bit of a refresh --it's not shiny and new as other Hamptons I've been to -- but the staff is exceptionally accommodating, and very nice.My husband, a Hilton Diamond member, booked a room with a sleeper sofa.  Realizing there was none in our room, we checked at the desk. The manager, feeling badly about their mistake, gave us a lovely suite instead.  (I said they are accommodating!)Besides the staff, I like the hotel's location. It's walking distance to several good restaurants. They have a free shuttle that conveniently drives guests around town.  Breakfasts are typical Hampton Inn: you won't leave hungry, but you won't rave about your meal.  Would I stay here again? Sure, why not.Halls have lot of trash and litter all over them which always concerns me. Room needs a deep clean, I found lots of hair from other guests which is a big no-no in my book. This could be a one off problem but it should have been caught by the supervisor.Cool location in downtown with access to lots of restaurants and bars.Highly recommend if in Louisville. The service here was great, friendly and attentive. Rooms are large, clean and good AC. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to KentuckyAverage Hampton Inn. Free surface lot parking, though you need to get a parking pass at check-in and put it on the dash. It is in Downtown- just minutes from restaurants and university medical center. The property is dated and ventilation in the rooms are rather poor. The price is usually higher than average Hampton Inn's, but is similar to other hotels in the Downtown area.Stayed here on a weekend trip to Louisville.  I will say that the lobby is updated and very welcoming, looks great!  The rooms on the other hand are nothing to write home about.  Small and outdated, but it works for a place to lay your head for a night.  The continental breakfast was good, great selection, but weird layout.  You're constantly in someone's way and it doesn't flow as well as it looks like it should.  Favorite thing about this place?  The hotel bar.  If you are new to Louisville, ask the bartender about where the locals hang out.  We got some great advice while we visited and truly believe that our experience wouldn't have been as great if we hadn't asked.  Thanks barkeep!Close proximity to dining and hospitals--however, lots of sirens! Great lobby bar and bartender was fabulous and friendly! Desk staff was very helpful. Hotel seems a bit dated and stale. Not-so-positives: Hard bed, sofa-sized pillows on king bed, bath towels weren't usual plush, Internet was BEYOND slow even in business center, tub very slow to drain, housekeeping was fair at best, one elevator was broken the first night (in very busy 8-floor hotel).The Hampton Inn: right off Interstate 65, friendly staff, clean rooms, decent continental breakfast.Stopped in the Hampton Inn a few times while traveling to or through Louisville.  Being next to the interstate and walk-able to 4th street is awesome.  It took about 10 minutes to get into the 4th Street Live district, and 15 min to get to the Palace Theater.  The rooms are very comfortable, and the rates are pretty affordable, especially if you have AAA or book through a discount site.The Hampton has a private lot, so you can rest easy that your vehicle will be safe and sound while you're out doing whatever it is you do in Louisville. Also, to all my cycling friends: this place is bike friendly, take your expensive carbon frames up to the room, then ride 'em down to Eva Bandman Park for the Cyclocross races.  That's the way to do it.Consistently out of coffee and didn't keep breakfast stocked.  Went down for breakfast at 9 am and almost everything was gone and no one was refilling anything.  Each morning tried to get coffee and it was out.  I was not impressed by the hotel at all.The best I can say is the staff was friendly.  But the hotel itself was very old and run down, it was in dreadful shape.  The furniture was old, parking was difficult at best, one elevator was broken, the towels were threadbare, and the water was brown from the tap.  I like staying in Hampton Inns but this was not up to par.  This site needs to be over hauled immediately.  I feel bad for the staff that tried to make up for the bad atmosphere.I recently stayed here on business and was impressed. The staff are friendly and accommodating. The free shuttle service is nice, it even took us to our meetings downtown. Nice lobby area and breakfast selection. The rooms were comfy. I utilized the fitness center and the business center and both fit my needs. My coworker used the pool and enjoyed it.I would stay here again! My only complaint was the ventilation in the rooms, especially the bathrooms, was rough. Other than that, it was a great stay!The rooms and lines are showing signs of wear, the push in lock on the bathroom door was loose and eventually fell out.  The housekeeping was spotty, the toilet paper had not been replenished nor the trash dumped,  The lobby appeared to have been updated.  Other than the close proximity to I65 and the Downtown, I would be apt to take a pass.  The plus side was that we had a window view to the fireworks and air show.I am returning back to Louisville for the University of Louisville graduation at the Yum Center. The Hampton Inn is a bit dated but the friendly staff and central location easily overcome the 80's decor. Our room was very clean and let's be honest, it's a bed to lay my head on in between sips of bourbon. They do have a bar on sight which is always a plus. The air conditioning may not be working as it is hotter than two mice making whoopie in a wool sock!Plenty of parking and it seems to be safe, secure and well lit. Overall, not bad for the price but may look at other options next visit.Good price, reasonably friendly staff, good location, free parking and a decent room. It's a bit on the old side for Hamptons, but the value is solid. Our room was quiet, the bed was comfortable, and the waffle iron worked. No complaints, but nothing special.Nice accommodations in downtown. Close to 4th Street (about 5 blocks), the ballpark, and waterfront.  Room was nice and large and comfortable. Small fitness center and pool, but much better than nothing!!!Free parking and very friendly and attentive staff.  This was our first stay (IM Louisville 2013).Bed bugs!!!  Bed bugs!!  I spent 2 night with my wife & infant son.  On our trip home we noticed these sores appearing on our sons arms.  Later that night I noticed I had them on my legs too!  Upon doing a little research we found they  were exactly what is pictured on many websites documenting the bites.  The next day I called the hotel to speak with the manager about an infestation issue and was hung up on twice!  When I finally got the manager on the phone he said he would "investigate it".  Two days later I received a voice mail from a management company saying that they did not believe there was a problem and that was that.  On top of that ,the hotel is in a very bad part of town and my wife did not feel safe walking around.Stay away at all costs!!Nice hotel.   Staff  was very accommodating. Nice large pool.  The rooms were nice and clean. Enjoyed the lounge and breakfast.  Will stay again.Diamond Member -  I already booked a king suite / king sofa study.  The gentleman who checked me in said he put me in their suite.  Top floor multi room suite with double door entrance.  Basically an apartment. They really take care of their Diamond members.  Was here for a week and the spacious suite made it very enjoyable and easy to get work done.  Service was excellent and the breakfast was delicious as usual.  Easily in my top 5 hampton's.
review_content_20: I stayed at this Hampton Inn for about a week with 11 teenagers and 4 other adults. My first impression is not very good. We had a long day of traveling, gathering luggage, and acquiring rental cars. By the time we got to the hotel it was just passed midnight and we were exhausted and the man working the front desk was not exactly the friendliest or the most helpful. I understand its super late, but isn't it his job to be welcoming, friendly, and accommodating? The rooms were nice, clean, and had working A.C. so we were happy campers for the night. In the morning we went down to breakfast, which was pretty standard, and actually ended up switching rooms. The guy who was working last night ended up arranging it for us so all of our rooms could be on the same floor and close to each other. That redeemed my opinion of him.The staff was very nice, the facilities are clean, the pool is fun, the workout center is under construction, and the WIFI works wonderfully. Also there is tons of food locations near by. My only complaint is the size of the rooms. A room with 2 queen beds does not have a lot of extra space, but overall a very enjoyable experience.Also, props to the staff for doing a good job dealing with a hotel full of teenagers. We were not the only large teen group staying that week.A comfortable facility with the two things I most crave in a hotel: a decent complementary breakfast and free wi-fi.The room was comfortable.  The heating was just right, and the bedding and mattress were ideal.  (They do need to rethink the pillows; they are not up to the standards in the rest of the room.)  A drawback is the maintenance.  My clock radio didn't work.  The first day, I mentioned this at the front desk.  They seemed interested, thanked me, and immediately wrote this down in a log.  I assumed that the radio would be replaced.  Never happened during the next three days of my stay.Nice looking swimming pool, although I didn't have a chance to try it firsthand.Location is convenient to downtown and restaurants.  Louisville is a rather nice walking town.  As they don't have a restaurant of their own, they should compile a list of good places that will deliver.Breakfast is pleasant, with good fruit options and a whole lot of breads, bagels, and pastries; along with a waffle station and heartier entree options (eggs, sausages.)Their shuttle makes pickups and dropoffs from the airport.  They will basically take you anywhere within a reasonable radius.All in all, a great facility for a very reasonable cost.  As soon as they fix the maintenance issues, they will get that fifth star.My needs seem different than that of the other reviewers. For a hotel at this price point not having wifi is just absurd. I appreciate it is accessible wired but that isnt nearly the same.The bed was also very stiff and the comforter was very off. The room was clean, service was fine, but i got the worst night of sleep in a while on this bed.This Hampton could use an update. Its not bad but, its definitely seen better days. This would not preclude me from staying here again.Typical Hampton formula with a local twist from the very friendly staff. They also have a sense of humor, which is sorta rare these days. The sign on the front desk saying "if you want someplace quiet to stay, you might want to go someplace else" was excellent.Walking distance from a LOT of things, including some great eats down on Market Street, the downtown entertainment area and a dodgy looking "adult store."Thumbs up from this Yelptard.very nice, as far as Hampton Inns go, that is. The rooms could use a bit of an update and there's no restaurant on-site, but the manager assured me that a refresh is coming soon for the rooms. I met the project manager for same at breakfast and she confirmed that this update is in the works. (See? It pays to talk to people.)There is a small bar in the lobby, which is nice. The barman was very friendly, but there are no beers on tap, which is a shame, because there are quite a few local brews that you really should sample before you leave town.The hotel is about five minutes from the airport if you drive like I do (ever seen "The Transporter" flicks? I drive like the devil himself. mortals could probably make the trip in 15 minutes...). The location is pretty good for walking around town, too. There are quite a few places to eat within a few blocks. The baseball bat museum is about a ten minute walk from the front door of the hotel, so do check it out if you get the chance.Lots of parking is available for free, which is nice.As with all Hampton Inns, there is a free breakfast every morning. Not exactly my type of dining, but it is free. Coffee is available all day in the lobby. Also good.I didn't see many cabs waiting at the front door, but the manager assures me that one can be had in relatively short order. Handy, to be sure.A nice stay in a lovely, up-and-coming (but, thankfully not gentrified) city. I will be back and I shall stay here.One of my favorite Hampton Inns. Clean and the staff always takes good care of me. pleany of great dining and beverage options a short walk away.The only negative is lack of wireless WIFIThis Hampton Inn is doing a great job of customer service! We used the complimentary shuttle van 3 times. How nice to be able to go out for dinner and not have to drive in an unfamiliar city! The breakfast was good, dining area large, open clean with lots of seating. This Hampton Inn had a bar open from 5:30 to  11 with a good variety of beverages to choose from. The king bed was comfortable. My only complaint was in a handicapped accessible bathroom there was no good place for your toiletries. Maybe they could add a shelf over the toilet?Nice hotel. Decor is a tad dated in my opinion, but overall a nice clean hotel with a friendly staff.Our  4-day stay at Hampton Inn Louisville Downtown recently was by far the best hotel stay we have probably had, and we travel often.  The staff, especially at the front desk, are refreshingly friendly, professional, helpful and knowledgeable.  Our young son forgot his backpack full of toys at the hotel and once we got home, we called the front desk.  They insisted on sending his bag back to us via overnight shipping without charging us!The hotel area is within walking distance to the best restaurants, entertainment and museums.  When staying in Louisville, we won't be staying anywhere else!This is a great hotel!  My boyfriend and I drove overnight from Philadelphia and arrived in Louisville around 9:15AM.  They were able to check us into a room almost immediately.  The room did not have a refrigerator (which most Hampton's I stay in do) but we asked for one and they brought one to our room free of charge.The hotel is also in a great location!!!  It's 2-3 blocks from 4th Street Live which is where all of the restuarants, bars and shopping is located.I had a block of rooms at the Hampton Inn for my wedding in Louisville this past weekend, and all of my guests loved it!  The woman who helps with large block reservations, Krista, was so incredibly helpful, and all of the staff was great.  Thank you! If you are visiting Louisville and want to stay downtown, this is a great place to stay.

review_content: Great modern looking hotel. Probably one of the best staffs at any hotel that I have visited in he Louisville area. The workout room is the best around with plenty of options and a nice lounge area.We come here for company events, most notably our company Christmas brunch.  They do a wonderful job serving a diverse group a nice meal.  The service was adequate and the food was okay.  It's not easy to put something nice together for so many people.I travel a lot and this is one of my fave hotels! We get a room here just as a getaway in Louisville even though I live here..It's like staying in a resort!! The lobby is modern, they have a luxe bar area and a great feature is the large fireplace outside for all to enjoy, with plush outdoor seating. The rooms are very clean, spacious and well-appointed. The small refrigerator is a plus. The views are very pretty as well. Great service, upscale Concierge floor and yummy perks. They also have a huge whirlpool and a very clean, large workout center with free bottled water, rolled-up towels. Nice touches everywhere...Love it here.Good old Southern hospitality !I have stayed at this Hotel for business , and they have mastered the art of hospitality !! Staff make you feel welcome every step you take, and my PLEASURE is a standard word throughout this hotel. I just came back form a 90210 hotel that was 5 times more expensive than this hotel but their service was awful. I am so grateful for  Southern hospitality because they make you feel special and all your needs are met with a gracious smile !! And parking is free !!The hotel appears to have undergone a facelift recently; it's fairly modern and really nice inside. The rooms are large and very well appointed.The staff is quite friendly and very helpful. We staged a business meeting here, and found the conference room extremely spacious and well setup.However, if you are in a hurry for something to drink or something to eat, go elsewhere. Four of us ordered salads for lunch. It took an hour for them to arrive. It took another 45 minutes to get our bill. The same night we ate dinner here. Again, an hour passed between placing our order and seeing our meal. A second round of drinks took 45 minutes.The next night, we went somewhere else to eat.All the while our server was pleasant and nice, just didn't seem concerned about the time it took to fill an order.As genteel as it is hospitable, the praise heaped on Louisville Marriott East by TripAdvisor users (who currently place this property among the top 5 hotels in town) is well founded. Even Marriott corporate lists the location among its top 5. Though the staff don't brag about the accolades, it's clear that this hotel runs like it's one of the best in Kentucky.Redeveloped beautifully by Musselman Hotels only a few years ago, guests can expect almost every (if not every) Marriott brand perk in a new, meticulously clean environment. App-based check-in? Sure. Keys that you tap on the door to access your room? Yes. WiFi that works (admittedly, not the 'newest' perk in the industry, but one that I never take for granted on the road...)? Of course.Guest rooms here are fairly standard in size and appointment: comfortable but unremarkable. Tiled showers, bright vanities and gooseneck reading lights on the bed's headboard were all nicely done.The only complaint that I might've had when planned a trip through town turned out to be a non-issue. If you're thinking of staying here and reading up on the collective opinion, you've surely learned that the hotel is outside of the city center and is surrounded by car lots. The Marriott East is not exciting to walk around, but is close to the highway and a major thoroughfare. A short drive (under-10 minutes) will get you to Whole Foods, fast food or the very popular restaurant Havana Rumba. In 20 minutes, without traffic, you're easily downtown.Notes:* The sunrise or sunset from the upper floors is nice and can offer a nice view of the city.* The Concierge Floor is on 10. Lounge hours are fairly standard with a Saturday close and Sunday evening re-open for the week. Light appetizers are offered in the evening, breakfast is available in the morning and there is an honor bar with wine/spirits. Light snacks (cereal bars, fruit, etc). and soda/juice are available.My future husband and I stay here every year for our anniversary.  The past three years have been wonderful.  We live about 45 minutes away so this seemsLike a small vacation when we are here.  The staff is friendly, the roomsAre clean and we never have any complaints.  We even asked to have our checkout time extended and the were happy to oblige.  We get the romance package and have yet to be disappointed.  The breakfast bar downstairs is ok, if you get down there early enough.  The restaurant/bar is AWESOME.  ReallyCan't wait till we can stay there againHotel was very nice overall for our baseball team to stay at while playing in Louisville.  My problem with the stay was our beds.  They are not comfortable as I woke up with a sore back both nights.  You would think with such a nice hotel, the beds would be pillow topped or memory foam for a $200 plus night stay.Great experience at Louisville Marriott East.  All the staff we encountered was very friendly.  Quick check in that was able to meet our requests for high floor and early check in.  Room 703 was clean and well laid out.  Breakfast at the restaurant was worth the extra 10 dollars when booking the room.  Pool / Whirlpool / Workout facility area is clean and well equipped with modern workout equipment.  There were plenty of towels in the pool area and refrigerated towels in the workout area.Super clean hotel! The staff was very friendly and professional. The food at the restaurant in the hotel is superb. Great hotel. I highly recommend this for business travelers.Don't let the location throw you off. The hotel is actually very clean, cozy, and classy. The price for the night was very reasonable. Wish I had time to enjoy the pool and gym - these also looked very nice. Free wifi and parking is a plus too! If you want to eat the best burger of your life, stop by the hotel's restaurant. Seriously. THE best burger ever. Like ever.At the bar for dinner. Chop is awesome, one of the best. Service is 5 star. Too bad I booked the Fairfield this trip. These guys even remember me from my last trip 4 months ago. One of the best bourbon bars I've been to. Close out your meal with your favorite burbon an the chocolate cake. It does a body good.I travel to Louisville a couple times a month, and have stayed at many hotels in the area. This one is my favorite. It's still fairly new, and the staff is really friendly (especially Carolyn in the concierge lounge). I'm giving it four stars because the mattresses are too soft for me, and on weekends the hotel can be overrun by youth sports teams. The bar has a huge selection of bourbon, some of which is difficult to find elsewhere.Marriott is very consistent. This hotel is no exception. Comfortable. great service... I would stay here again.Excellent, friendly service. The room was clean and modern with an excellent bed and shower. The restaurant was excellent and room service was prompt and tasty. The desk staff went out of the way to be helpful. The wifi was free with adequate speed. Highly recommended even compared to other Marriott hotels. Top Notch.Just stayed at this hotel and was pleasantly surprised. Rooms are good and spacious. The lobby is nice and the bar has a large selection of bourbon.  I am not a bourbon drinker but I was impress with the wall of bourbon. Lastly, the front desk staff were so friendly. Great service!We're staying here during our time in Louisville...I felt the need to give this place five stars. This place looks like it's new, so spacious and so clean! We had booked our stay ahead of time and check-in was quick and service was great! There is no card swiping for the room lock, just beep your card against the lock to unlock. It probably helps that my sister is a platinum elite member so we have access to the concierge lounge on the tenth floor, which is always nice. Overall, great experience, they know hospitality!Travel a lot for work and stay in many Marriott properties.  This is one of the best.  A little off the beaten path, but the beds are the best!    Staff is friendly, but everybody in Kentucky is friendly.     Modern decor in the lobby and the bar seems to be a regular gathering spot for many.   Easy in and out with no parking problems like you get downtown.    No places to walk to, but for a place to stay its a good choice.I stay in hotels for work, and this one is amazing. $40 million in upgrades in Kentucky...best television in the room I have seen, great fitness center, superb in room dining...feels 4 stars for 3 star priceYou gotta stay and eat here. It is 5 star. I travel all over the world and eat and stay at the best of the best . Make sure you experience the Marriott Louisville East. Tom from prospect PA.
review_content_20: Awesome hotel, I stayed overnight for a flight delay. Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, rooms were large and modern, I really enjoyed the bathroom (walk in shower stall), the fitness center was very large and had a lot of machines/amenities.  One of my favorite hotels I've been to so far.Great facility, well managed, excellent service. But do not accept a room near the elevators, they are loud an will wake you.  i.e. Any or many time(s) per night. There isn't a coffee carafe in room 318!!!!!!!!Great hotel. Pleasantly surprised at how friendly all the staff are. Plenty of easy parking all around the hotel. Nice lobby area. Rooms are clean and beds are comfy with nice comfortable sheets and pillows. The washroom is a bit small but was not an issue. I love the shower stalls with the glass doors. The only negative is that there is a large gap under the door to the hallway so anyone in the hallway talking sounds like they are inside the room. There is also the same large gap under the door to the adjoining room and so there was some people in that room and I could hear every word they as if they were right inside the room with me. There should be some sort of weather strip or something there so that there is more privacy. But for the most part it wasn't a bother.The Louisville Marroitt East in Jtown is the best hotel to stay at in the East End! The staff is friendly, restaurant is top notch and it is conveniently located near Hurstbourne Lane and the I64 Hwy.One of the best Marriotts have stayed so far.  Great service friendly staff. Awesome hotel. free wifi is slow. Didnt want to pay $10 for the faster Internet.Had to stay here for work. Where to begin - big red stain on the floor - paint, soda, blood? Who knows.  Next, sand paper towels. Finally - sheets that don't fit the bed - how annoying. If you can, look elsewhere.

review_content: We stayed here on a quick trip to KY. I found the staff very welcoming and rooms were comfortable and clean. Except the last night we stay they forgot to make our room while we were out, no worries it happens and the team was all over it. I was impressed at their concern. We stayed on the Club Level it was so worth the extra 10 bucks, great hot hotel breakfast and after 4 they had comp drinks and food. That is the big tip in this review! There are some great restaurants on the back side of the hotel, and all with in walking distance. We would stay again for certain!Gotta love a hotel with a pet policy that's not "hey let's gouge pet owners" This place was along our road trip route, and was pet friendly. That's how we found it, and I'm glad we did. The staff at check in was super awesome, and friendly. The room was nice, it wasn't amazing, but it was a pet room, so we weren't looking for amazing, Just comfortable.We arrived pretty late, and left first thing, so didn't get to enjoy the view or any amenities, but for what we needed, it was perfect!Kudos to the sheraton! They are the only brand between the edge of st louis and west virginia that allow dogs not only at a reasonable prices, but free!The location is in Illinois, across the river from louisville, plenty of parking, very friendly staff, only 10K points if you are paying by points and as i mentioned - free pet fee as long as the pet is under 80 pounds!The room was well appointed, a comfy bed, view of the river, comfy chair.The room was a bit worn - rug was stained - not sure if that had to do with being a pet room or not. Bathroom had a shower door - haven't had a shower door in years, and the shower head was tall enough for the hubby to stand up under! All in all a great stay! Thank you sheraton!Great hotel, friendly staff, and pet-friendly too! The view from the 10th floor was great, and the pool, hot-tub, workout facility, and lounge were all great as well. Would definitely recommend.A trip of a thousand miles, it is oft said, begins with a declaration of someone saying they know a shortcut.  Despite all the ridiculous detours around this city, I am always happy to stop and rest a while.After contending with the labyrinth that has become the Louisville highway "system," this weary wanderer found her way to this hotel.  I don't care how cliche it sounds: the olive branch-wrapped S beckoned like the beacon it was for me on this very dark and rainy night.I had been driving throughout the day, stuck beneath a literal cloud of fog and mistakes by rain the whole stretch of I-70 and I-64 between KS and KY.  Imagine my delight at discovering the elegant simplicity of a room with view of the west.  The clerk who handed me my key was quite pleasant and helpful.  There is a reasonably priced room service menu (the pasta and scallops are delicious), and the bed is quite springy.If you happen to stray from your road and are lost, or if you deliberately plan to stay, maybe give this Sheraton a glance.Good location to hop on I-65 and in 5 minutes be in the heart of Louisville.  Hotel is a little hard to find due to all the construction around the area, but we found our way by keeping a look-out for the red Sheraton lights!Room was clean and spacious.  Bathroom was a bit of a squeeze but adequate (door had to be completely shut in order to walk around to toilet / shower).Upon check-out I had to get the front desk to research my statement as I was charged at a rate different from the one I booked at but had the proof in email confirmation that resulted in a quick change to the correct price.Dog friendly hotel that provides good signage on the doors for rooms containing a pet "Let Sleeping Dogs Lie!"  Plenty of riverside places to take our pup for walks and he enjoyed his stay here on a floor with several other travelers with their dogs.  Smart to put dog owners on one floor since we understand one another.For the price and amenities, I have experienced much better.  From the beginning, and right out of the gate, the experience was a bit suspect, flaky and dicey. We booked this room through Expedia, which we later figured out that we probably will never do again. The Sheraton would not take responsibility for the booking that we thought we had secured. We originally booked a king size bed room on the upper level floor which is considered a better area of the hotel.    There was a 'complimentary' breakfast that was supposed to be included along with the room located inside a private access lounge. When we got to the hotel the gal said she did not have record of us booking a king size bed, so she offered us two queens on another floor. We said we wanted a king size bed and showed her the paperwork stating that - that is what we booked through Expedia.   She then reiterated that they're not responsible for what Expedia does.I now ask myself what is the point of booking something through Expedia if the hotel won't honor what you think you're paying for and getting?!  Next time we will just book directly at the hotel itself.  If you think you're saving money by going through Expedia, I'm now very confident that you're taking a big chance.  Booking through a third party seems to not be a very good bet; just a huge sketchy gamble at best!   Maybe we missed the fine writing in the booking when it probably said that everything is subject to change, and probably will - but NOT to your advantage !!! When we finally got to the room, there wasn't a mini fridge and there wasn't a microwave either.   Upon inspection of the room, I realized after a while that the bathroom sink had a really nasty clog, the carpet looked stained and dirty, and the ceiling above the shower was also stained like there was a previous water leak in a room above it. When we went to check out the lounge which was actually on the floor that we should've been on, it was nothing spectacular.   It was just basically a look out over the river and the city of Louisville.  It had a smattering of tables placed here and there and it also had an area with a counter set up that they use for the morning breakfast. There was a little cooler with a variety of complementary drinks, and that's about it.  Oh, and they also had a desk in the corner with a computer accompanied by a printer. We went out to dinner, and when we got back, there was a message on our phone in the room from the front desk. It was a message for someone else asking if their check-in was pleasant and acceptable. The hotel had an adjoining bar and restaurant that featured lunch and dinner only.  Later on that evening we went into the bar and had a drink and a dessert. The cake dessert was so-so.   It was basically overpriced and on the dry side.   We only stayed for one night, so in the morning when were going to partake in the complementary breakfast on the upper level lounge area, we got yet another unsavory surprise. We noticed the breakfast was very limited/bare bones and paltry. It was really nothing spectacular or anything out of the ordinary.  I have seen better at much lower scale/rated hotels/motels. It actually looked very sad and poor for what we paid.My fiance went down to the front desk and asked if we could get the better breakfast buffet that was offered downstairs.   It was a much more comprehensive breakfast.  The gal also argued with him about that and said that wasn't part of our deal. NOW she wants to honor it!He had pre-paid for the first breakfast which was actually more in price - 30.00 extra to be exact!  WOW   It was a very frustrating and strange situation overall. He actually ended up having to pay AGAIN extra for the breakfast downstairs at the buffet.  That buffet was acceptable, as the food was hot and had some redeeming quality to it. I think that is one of the few reasons I am giving this hotel one star.  Otherwise, it's all basically a bust as far as our overall experience.   Pardon me for saying, but the whole situation was really just a bunch of uncool, uncaring and low brow bullshit. They really got over us on us as far as what we actually paid for and what we actually got. And to also put it ever so bluntly, it's just amazing sometimes when you feel like you're getting bent over for every nickel and dime that you spend.  I take my precious money and the spending of it very wisely and seriously.  I also take proper and professional customer service very seriously.   Integrity in the backing up of what someone is selling is very serious business too.  How some businesses can pretentiously think they can do whatever they wish and get away with it  is beyond frustrating and annoying.  Karma will certainly have the last word.The next time we stay in that area of the country, we're going to travel vacross the river into Louisville and get a hotel over in that area.   Hopefully we will have better luck, as well as a better experience overall.I had a really great stay here.  The staff was friendly and very helpful.  Changed my room quickly when it was obvious someone had smoked in it. . .Place was clean and the breakfast was great with lots of options although very crowded.  There are a couple of eating options inside the hotel as well as within walking distance.What i really love about Sheraton is the shuttle service.  Not only did I get a ride from the airport, but also to places downtown for work and dinner.  Just let the driver know ahead of time.Hotel rooms are dated.  My room actually smelled a bit like cat pee.  I wore slippers whenever I did not have shoes on as I was grossed out by the carpet.  Wish there were better options of places to stay in the area, but unfortunately, I'd have to move to the Louisville, KY side of the river.Overall not impressed with the rooms (stayed in multiple) - in dire need of new carpeting. Heard a male and female wrestling (or something... Keeping it PG folks) in their room from the hallway, so sound proofing may be lacking.  Easily hear conversations from the hallway.  Staff was friendly, but overall I feel like I have higher expectations for this chain from stays at other locations.The staff and management of this Sheraton are fantastic. This was my second stay here in two years and I'll definitely be back. It's convenient to downtown Louisville -- right across the river -- with a fast, free shuttle that makes going out easy and safe (and you don't want to miss out on all the great Kentucky bourbons when you go out in Louisville, of course!). Shuttle driver Frank is a treasure -- he has lived in Louisville his entire life and is a great conversationalist and a gentleman. Housekeeping got me everything I needed. My room was spotless, quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel itself is a good size -- not too big, not too small -- so the pool/gym areas were never overly crowded (and were also very clean). The little bar/restaurant area downstairs is very convenient and serves a nice breakfast. I also really appreciate that parking is free. All good!I struggled with this Sheraton experience was so up and down. Some issues are out of the hotel's control, but overall I was not thrilled with my stay here.  I have stayed at numerous Sheraton properties with my husband and I expected a lot more, but I can't say it was a "bad" stay all around.First, what was great about the hotel. Convenient Location. We were a $8 cab fare from Louisville with quick highway access and a great view of the city.  This can't be beat in my opinion.  I don't know what hotel costs are in downtown Louisville, but if they are high like most big cities, staying here is a no-brainer.  Free Shuttle Service. It runs until 11pm, and we used that to take us to dinner on Saturday night.  You are of course at the mercy of their schedule but if you aren't in a huge rush or are flexible with time it's a really nice amenity.  Hotel Condition: Hotel is clean and the rooms we stayed in were very nice and spacious (upgraded to a suite the first night, "business king" room the second night).Had no real issues the first day.  Was upgraded to a suite and the room was great- bed was comfortable (as they usually are at Sheraton) but we had 3 in the room so my friend slept on the pull out sofa which was terrible with a huge bar right in her back, she ended up having to sleep long-ways on the bed so she could sleep at all. Was also an issue for the girls that were staying with us the second night. Won't deduct too much for that though, as I don't think most sofa beds are comfortable.  The real problem in this room, about 4 rooms down the hallway from the elevator, was the elevator noise.  We heard it all night which I have never experienced in a room not next to an elevator.  Again, this is not something the hotel can really change, but the walls are paper thin- we heard not only the elevator but doors slamming, people talking etc. The next night we moved to another room where we were hosting a few more people and this room happened to be right next to the elevator, and the bed was actually up against the wall where the elevator is!  Why it isn't on the other side of the room baffles me, but needless to say, ALL of us were woken up throughout the night by the elevator.  Also, I had requested a refrigerator several weeks in advance for both nights (which I paid for- $10 per night).  It was there the first night, but when we moved to the second room there wasn't one and I had to call down for it.  It was a problem because we needed to have things chilled quickly for the others that were arriving and that did not happen.  Also, it was half the size of the fridge we had the first night so that was frustrating. Overall the staff was fairly accommodating.  I didn't feel like they went out of their way to make you feel welcome, but they were ok.  We did have one woman who was pretty condescending when we were asking about the shuttle, basically saying "too bad for you he'll get here when he gets here." Everyone in my group ended up asking "what was her problem?" as we walked outside. Club lounge was overrun with unsupervised 10-12 year olds (in town for a softball tourney) who were pretty consistently cleaning out the fridge, again, not the hotel's fault but just added to the long list of things that made our stay less than memorable.  Will definitely stay here again if I need to be in Louisville because of the convenience, but will probably choose somewhere else if I need to host guests. I wanted everyone to feel welcomed and we didn't really get that here.Bottom Line: definitely not the level of service I would have expected.Came to Louisville for a family fun filled weekend. Decided to stay at the Sheraton. The room was quite a bit more than the website! I paid $215 for one night stay, and got 2 hours sleep due to the elevator being right behind my bed!! We were told it was close to the elevator and there may be noise from people getting on and off the elevator. We were not told that you would not be able to sleep due to the elevator being directly behind the bed and "grinding" all night! When I spoke to the front desk, I was offered a free continental breakfast that was included anyway!  Very displeased with my stay!!Great location right off of I-65.  Easy to find, ample parking.  Staff are friendly.  Rooms are clean, beds are comfortable.  Pool and hot tub are nice.  Hotel is pet friendly and accepts dogs with no added fee!  A great value overall.This was a great little hotel for our over nights on our road trip to and from FLA.   I like the "new" Sheraton - they way the chain has updated it's old stodgy reputation of dated hotels.The staff was super friendly.   I am a Starwood Platinum member and enjoyed the member breakfast at 6am so we could hit the road and not worry about having to take time to stop to eat.    The rooms were very clean and quiet.   They allow pets as we had my dog and my mom's dog.   The location was great for road tripping - easy on and off the highway.   it also has a nice view of Louisville.   Love the free wi-fi and free parking.  I hate when hotels gouge guest with crazy parking fees.  On our way back to MI we walked to a near by restaurant on the river.   It was nice to have that as an option.Great place to stay. Very pet friendly, comfortable beds, accommodating staff and surprisingly great room service! I never set my expectations high when it comes to in room dining but everything was really great and well priced! Indulge and get the Derby pie or the bread pudding. Yum! The creme brulee was a miss but 2 out of 3 isn't bad! Great wine selection as well. Free wifi is a plus and the business center makes business on the go very easy. The hotels in Louisville were twice the price and this place is practically in Louisville with a beautiful view of the river with great restaurants nearby! Except King Fish.. Skip that one!This hotel is nice! Totally rocked a deal online for well under a hundred a night - Shazam! Bonus - pet friendly, I do not lie. It will not seem like it when you pull up and I even had a few confused looks from other patrons on the elevator but you can rest assured that they are indeed pet friendly. On the Indy side of the river, great view of downtown Louisville from across the bridge. Just cross the bridge if you want to hit downtown, or stay on your side of the river and enjoy several dining options - seafood, buckhead (general), rockys (italian), hooters, pizza, Sheraton bar/grill - all well within walking distance. Some great riverside dining options for atmosphere. Tip - The area is currently screwed up pretty bad with construction so your nav system may puke. Just under 7 miles from Churchill Downs and I suspect a view of the big firework show as well? Not sure, but there is plenty going on within a stones throw of this place to make for some fun. I am tempted to come back for both of the aforementioned in 2014.As for the hotel itself, better than your average bear, on the upscale side as you would expect, rooms are nicely appointed with microwave, mini fridge, comp bottled water and starbucks for the instant machine. Even the TP in the bath was of the kinder/gentler variety ;-) Free Wi-Fi.Bonus - the ice bucket provided actually works, there was still unmelted ice in it the next morning. Parking was super convenient in front or back, check in was easy peasy and friendly. In fact the only thing I can ding this place for is that the water well in the coffee machine in the room was funky enough that I passed. I will definitely keep this place on the hit list for the future.Great service at this hotel! My fiancee and I found this hotel deal here by luck. I liked the workout facility and pool/jacuzzi it was very well kept and clean. In addition the hotel service desk were so friendly and had recommended good places to see in Louisville during our stay. We were so happy with our stay at this hotel!When I first got to the hotel I was shocked to find how nice the view was. The room I stayed in had  the perfect view of the bridge and you could even see buildings from Kentucky. The beds were comfortable and even had decant pillows. Then I got to the bathroom, and it was smallish and had no ventilation..then the hotel decided to charge $4 for a 5oz water bottle!! A water bottle I could get for 99 cents at a gas station!! The pool room was so hot and humid you could barely breathe. Then when it came to me having an issue, none of the employees were helpful especially Eric who decided to tell me that he was not going to get a manager when I asked for one. It's a shame that such a hotel in a great location had to be so disappointing with such unfriendly staff. I will never go to this hotel again and because I work with business travelers I will be sure to let them know not to go either.Stayed here for Thunder Over Louisville. Clean rooms with a very cordial staff. Added security personnel was appreciated. Room size and amenities are modest for the room rate. Certainly plan to stay here again next year.
review_content_20: At the last minute I found a gem on Expedia which made the Riverside Sheraton super-inexpensive for a weekend stay in the lap of luxury. The beds were too good to be true. Had I been able to fit one in my purse I would have taken a bed home with me. Certainly good enough for a good night's sleep. The staff was courteous and called the room to see if there was anything else they could bring us. In retrospect, I should have asked for something cooler than a newspaper. There were water bottles and all kinds of free goodies in the room. Double-plus-bonus?! ...while the Sheraton is a very classy establishment, they accept furry friends with only the signing of a liability waiver!! All of the staff loved my furry friend and made us feel very welcome.Note to tourists: if you plan to visit nearby Falls of the Ohio State Park during the winter season, please be advised that it will likely be underwater which the Park website will neglect to mention.  ;)I love this hotel.   from the moment I stepped to the front desk it's been perfect.   pet friendly, nice clean room, extremely accommodating.   they loaned us a charger for my daughter's phone.   they delivered a microwave and refrigerator to our room.   best experience.I arrived late and was pleased that even in the freezing cold someone helped get my bags. I had a comfortable first night. The next morning I had two different chargers on my card. I returned to an unclean room and was told the reservation they had was for a day even though I had a receipt for three! After talking it over they gave me an extra night stay and said the one charge has been  refunded. I go to check my account again and there's a third charge!! I haven't even left yet, but at this point there's going to be five or six pending charges and who knows what will happen?! They are suppose to call my bank and let them know they refunded two but can't explain why I've been charged so many times!!!! Probably will find another hotel when I'm here next time!!I and a co-worker stayed at the Sheraton Louisville Riverside Hotel this week and would definitely recommend!  Loved the room - it was quite spacious, very clean, and the bed.... awesome!  SO comfortable!  Originally we had planned to stay just one night there and then drive up to Indy and stay one night in Indy.  Due to a day/night of horrible weather (tornado warnings/watches all day long!), decided to cancel the hotel in Indy and stay at the Sheraton again instead of driving in the bad weather.  They were very accomodating, allowed us to keep the same rate as the first night (which for what we booked (using AAA) included breakfast), and even stay in the same room.  I will agree with another reviewer - if we had to pay for the breakfast I probably wouldn't have been too happy.  While they do have a good selection of items (eggs, pancakes, sausage, bacon, biscuits,gravy, fruit, yogurt, bakery items), you could tell most of it had been sitting there for quite a while.  However, we just asked the staff that was working for fresh items and they brought them right out.Staff is very nice and courteous. Hotel is very clean, the showe was awesome! Free parking too.Needed a place to stay since the Marriott around the corner totally screwed me over.  Called the hotel and spoke with Trish, she was awesome and accommodated me just as I needed.  Was given a room on a high floor with a great view of the Louisville skyline.  My 6 year old loved the indoor pool and we were treated awesome by every staff member that we encountered.  The only bad part was that the WiFi connection was iffy and only worked about 1/3 of the time but I was able to go in the lobby and use the computers there without any problems.   Beds were incredibly comfortable and the shower was amazing!  I liked this place a lot!Traveling with famille of 6. Two rooms adjoining worked well with the price being very competitive. Rooms appeared to be new and very clean. Staff was friendly and professional. They have an indoor pool which is important to us. Have to keep the kids busy or it gets real ugly. Lots of places next to hotel to eat. They also have a large pizza house attached to second floor.I recommend the Sheraton Louisville Riverside Hotel to all of my family and friends.If you need a room for Thunder Over Louisville.... this is the place to be!Not a bad hotel.  Pretty average for a Sheraton which is fine.  Avoid the hotel breakfast - nasty.This place was nice.  It was nothing special, but a good place to stay.  It had free internet, a nice room, a restaurant in the building (along with many in walking distance), a pool, and very nice staff.  No free breakfast.  I stayed here for an interview the next day in Louisville and it was an easy trip!

review_content: Clean room. Well furnished and decorated. Very affordable and convenient to 4th Street and the Palace, where we were going for show. Pleasantly surprised to find the regular room had a mini-fridge, coffee maker, microwave, iron, and hairdryer. There were some cigarette burns but it was a smoking room, so it comes with the territory. Overall a very good experience. My only complaint is the parking lot is shared by a Papa Johns and the drivers seem to leave their cars just anywhere. Oh and parking at Econolodge is an extra $5. Which felt weird, but no big deal. I would stay there again for any downtown Louisville event.Clean, comfy cozy room. Was surprised by a little wet bar area in the room. The front desk is too small. Good location and worth the price.This is really great, low cost option to stay at in downtown Louisville. I went there for the ATA show which meant 3 nights there and had a great experience with the staff. Don't expect too much from it-it's still an Econolodge- but expect a clean place to stay. The area around it has a club and the "Love Boutique " nearby so I can't speak to what weekend nights are like, but the week nights I spent there were exceptionally quiet and unremarkable (I mean that in a good way.). In fact, it's way better than the comparably priced hotels nearby-some friends of mine tried to switch to this hotel after we shared experiences the first night. Would totally stay here again.Check in was fairly quick and easy. However the first room that I was given had a leaky toilet that got the entire floor wet. Even though I didn't discover the leak until about a couple of hours later when I went to use the bathroom, they were able to move me to another room a couple of doors over. You really can't beat this place with the price and the convenient location. But keep in mind that with the lower price per night comes some of the riff raffs, so mind your surroundings. Overall this place was a bit nicer and a small step up from a Motel 6.I'll have to agree with the other reviews and say that this is a surprisingly nice Econo Lodge.  Clean rooms.  They seemed to be updated rather recently as well.  Parking was plentiful and well lit.  The morning breakfast was lacking, but for the price of this hotel I don't think it's worth complaining about too much.  Very close to all the downtown attractions.  I'd probably stay here again for a short trip.The two stars are explicitly related to cleanliness as this hotel was clean and comfortable. The customer service, though, was atrocious. We were greeted by a man who responded to our questions with one word or a cold stare  I've seen more friendliness from an agitated moose. Then this guy begins banging on our door asking us to check out, THIRTY MINUTES before check out time and with a very clear, " DO NOT DISTURB" sign in place. If you're reading this, sir, take a minute to book a massage so that you might relieve some of that spite you can't seem to avoid hurling at your guests. Needless to say, we won't return.This is the type of place that could very easily be 'ghetto', run down, etc.It's NOT.  It's clean, the gentleman at the front desk (fish tank owner) was super friendly, easy to deal with.  The room had a good ac unit, reasonable parking (5 bucks).  Would return, stay again.I had one of the worst customer experiences at your Econo lodge in downtown Louisville KY.  I see on your website you are to provide clean, high value lodging and to make life easy for your guest. This certainly was not my experience.   Tim, at the front desk, offered no help with my check in.  The room was not clean and smelled of smoke.  Also in the room, there were burn marks and holes in the furniture.  When I called the front desk from the room phone, it was covered with personal lube. I would not recommend your hotel to anyone.Maurice at the front desk was awesome and so was the head woman of the cleaning staff. We were not happy with our room because some idiot had smoked in it. They changed our room immediately, no questions asked and quickly. They really made this experience enjoyable.So happy to find a decently priced vacancy when my father was airlifted to Univ of Louisville hospital. We were able to book our room at 3am. Check in was quick and easy. The outside walkways and stairwells are a little rough, but my room is great. Clean, comfortable and fresh. After an emotional and stressful day, it was beyond wonderful to be treated so well. Great job, Econolodge!We checked in Friday evening and even though I handed over my Driver's license and credit card with my names on them, we were checked in under another person's name that started with the same letter. We were called back down to the desk to fix this after 10pm and not charged for parking to make up for it. We stayed over a Friday and Saturday and weren't able to sleep well either night due to outside noise and a very saggy mattress. We tried running the air unit fan to drown out the motorcycles and other noises. The way this unit worked either the fan could be on or the A/C would run until it reached the set temperature. So we could either not sweat and deal with the noise or drown out the noise and sweat.The room was relatively clean, but so cramped my husband and I kept running into each other.  The room had a mini fridge and microwave which was a bonus because I don't think the site mentioned that.  They offer continental breakfast but we went to restaurants instead because it didn't look so great. I think due to the reviews here on yelp I really expected the place to be better.  This hotel made my husband and I decided from now on to get hotels at least $50 more per night to get out of this bracket of places.Clean, awesome location - don't expect it to be more than it is.Continantal breakfast was adequate and staff was very nice.Great location with reasonable price. I had a great stay at this hotel. Staff is amazing. Rooms are basic but nice and clean enough. I had a great sleep. I recommend this hotel for travelers who don't want to spend much on hotels and get great service and clean rooms. Off course no frills and fancy but it worked for me and I am sure it will work for everyone!!! Had a great time!!The location is mighty fine and the price is right.  This is a motor lodge meaning your door opens up to outside. Our room was clean with the basic necessities in working order. (hair dryer, fridge, microwave, tv) They only give you soap & shampoo, so pack your own lotion & conditioner.  This is definitely not the fanciest place to stay in Louisville but it most certainly does the job.This Econo Lodge was a good place to stay with a fair price in downtown Louisville. When other places are charging triple the price, why not stay here when it was reasonably priced and reasonably clean? It's walking distance from 4th Street Live and other restaurants/bars in the area. If you don't stay out until last call, you can have the displeasure of eating Papa John's Pizza right in your room since it is on the same property as this E-Lodge. Free breakfast served until 10am.Excellent value. Room was clean and I felt safe in a somewhat,  less than totally safe neighborhood. I was within walking distance to many good restaurants and to my clients facility and it saved them about $150/night over the Marriott directly across street.Perfect place to stay in Louisville. It was super cheap and right downtown.  The staff was perfectly cordial, the rooms were clean, the bed was comfortable and the wi-fi worked.I didn't partake in their breakfast but I wish I has as our breakfast that morning was sub bar.This is where I'm staying every time I'm in town!!It was cheap and the location was prime. But when i checked in the clerk was sleeping and the couch and acting like i was a dick for needing to check in. When we got to the room the hallway in front smelt like piss and the ice machine was integrated into our front wall.  At night the hallway of this place was like being in the dorms on welcome week. There were loud drunk stupid people everydayscreaming in front of my door til 4am. I dont expect much out of hotels, nice clean bed, quite room, and friendly service. I didnt meet any of these....Not bad. Not the ritz, but not bad. Also not 200$ like its neighbors. Right across the street from a 24/7 convenience store, walking distance to everything else. A little noisy; doors slam loud and there's traffic noise. The sheets were clean and bed bug free, but I suspect the coverlet was not clean. It's over there on the floor. lol.
