Nice amenities - fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. Nice tvs with lots of channels. Furniture is all updated and I love the little armoire for my clothes. Bed was a little hard but I slept good. Overall I think it's a good value for the money.The Econo Lodge was a pretty good motel for the price we paid (Under $50 a night).  The room came with a TV, fridge and microwave.  The bathroom was clean.  The bed was pretty gross. The bedding had crusty stains on them.There was some noise at night outside our door and window but not as bad as I thought it would be.Breakfast wasn't great.  They did offer cereal, oatmeal, apples and toast.  The coffee was really bad.Tried to get a room for the next night again but instead of charging us $49 they wanted us to pay $130.  We left and went to a much nicer hotel ten minutes away.Econo Lodge is an alright place to stay if you are going to Forecastle.  We just left our car there and walked to the festival every day.They made us pay 5 dollars a day for parking which was a little odd since Louisville isn't a big city or anything.
review_content_20: We enjoyed a long weekend in the Kentucky area and this Econo Lodge was our hotel of choice. Located in downtown Louisville, it is very conveniently located to many attractions (Slugger Field and the Louisville Slugger Museum, among others!)Even though he outside seemed very dated, the room was clean and tastefully decorated and the bed was very comfortable. A microwave, fridge, blow dryer, coffee make and iron were available in the room.The free breakfast was perfectly acceptable...cereal, boiled eggs, toast, danishes, bagels, apples, juice and coffee. For afternoon, evening or for a late night snack, there is a Papa Johns is located on the same lot and they were very friendly!The only downside was the parking. At one point, we had to park across the street in the overflow area, but moved our vehicle back into the lot when space became available. This is an economy hotel, so do not expect to be pampered or have access to many "extras". But for a clean and comfortable place to sleep between excursions, it's great. We would definitely go back!

review_content: To echo other reviewers, this place is definitely better as a meeting space / small event type uses than as a place to stay.  The common spaces were adequate and clean; parking is plentiful and available both on the lobby and event side of the complex.  Overall, it's a fairly small hotel, but with several meeting space options and event support.  It's located in a fairly busy / chain-oriented area - not exactly much of a "Keep Louisville Weird" feel, but for small or medium sized meetings or informal events, it gets the job done fairly comfortably and effectively.  Semi-convenient, in terms of location - avoids a lot of the local construction nightmares, just the usual traffic frustrations.  Hotel is about a block back from the street, but there's a small-ish sign indicating the boulevard  where one enters the access road to the hotel.Catering is fairly standard stuff, but definitely adequate (both in quality and quantity) for meetings and lunch.  Catering / event staff were effective and unobtrusive during a recent week-long training: they met all arranged needs in a timely and professional manner.  I didn't have any problem getting help from the staff, and everyone I worked with was pleasant, competent, and helpful.This place sucks. The Internet is garbage.  My room looks straight out of 1974. I work out of town a lot.  I am here for 2 weeks and I am dreading every second of it.  I work long hours when onTDY here. My roku stick and Xbox are how I wind down and relax.... this wifi is like dial up. I called their Internet provider and they said they could give more bandwidth to my mac address with management approval. I called the front desk and the manager wouldn't do it. . He said the hotel was full so that was why the Internet was slow.  Funny. . I have stayed at the residence Inn when it was full and the Internet speed was excellent. . I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn when it was full and the Internet was just fine WITHOUT HAVING TO ASK FOR MANAGEMENT APPROVAL  FOR EXTRA BANDWIDTH.A full hotel is no excuse when someone is paying an average of 200 bucks a night to be here. Avoid this place.Nothing new that hasn't echoed previous grievances. But to put it in an easier to consume format:1) Room they booked us in was still inhabited by other tenets. We were moved to another room.2) Air conditioner did not work. Room was boiling hot. We were moved to another room.3) Third floor smelled solidly of smoke in this "non-smoking" hotel4) Did not warn us that there would be construction on half of the hotel-- the noise of construction woke us up early every morning5) Walls are paper thin; could hear every argument in a neighboring room6) Alarm clock was completely non-functioning7) Room was not cleaned regularly8) Hotel promised free breakfast, but the dining area was under renovation. Luckily we were given IHOP vouchers.On the positive, the check in staff were very nice!Place is pretty hit and worn down. Paper coming off the walls. Fans, not running, in the hallway like something sprung a leak.  Needs big bucks put into it to bring it up to par.How IHG allows this sh*thole to use one of its labels on it is beyond me. Should have been demolished several years ago!No water pressure, outdated decor, stains all over the place, etc, etc. COMPLETELY DISGUSTING IN EVERYWAY,There are many other places to stay in town, go elsewhereThis place was ok but not the best Holiday Inn I've experienced.  Supposedly we were even in the remodeled wing but the elevator buttons were still broken and the hallways seemed very dark and worn.  The doors were paper thin so you could hear everything said by people walking through the hall.  The air conditioning was an old fashioned system, where you pick hi or low fan and have a dial for setting from hot to cold.  This meant the thing was blowing all night and we both woke up with sore throats. The ceiling of the room had the pebbly texture and there was quite a collection of dust (we hope it was dust and not mold) on the ceiling.  Not a pleasant thing to notice.  We were here for a wedding and the facilities there were nice enough.  Very simple ballroom layout but the acoustics were actually decent and we could hear the speeches clearly.  Staff as a whole was proficient but not particularly friendly.  Even with a concierge on duty I didn't get a greeting when walking in or out.I would give the accommodations 1 star, but the front desk staff deserves praise for trying to band-aid endemic problems of this very run down facility. The rooms are priced at the high range of mid tier Louisville hotels ($100-$150) but the quality is unacceptable.  The quality and accommodations in the competing $70 dollar a night Hurstbourne area hotels is much better.The manager will write a polite response attributing the problems to remodeling - nevertheless the same issues repeat in every Yelp review.  I had to change rooms 3 times.Many of these issues could be corrected for current customers by meaningful hotel management action:- Contractors smoke - the smell is pervasive. We observed contractors smoking in the elevators.- Contractors start hammering and making loud noises in the morning hours.- Rooms aren't always cleaned before checking in customers.- Advertisements are misleading.- One of our mattresses sagged and pillows in every room were uncomfortable (stuffed with puff balls). These were the some of most uncomfortable sleeping arrangements I've ever encountered.  In this price range other hotels have a selection of comfortable pillows. - Lobby restrooms weren't always serviced.- Water and towels in the gym weren't replenished.- Hallways in the pool area did not look sanitary.- Room air conditioning units did not cool and the hotel is uncomfortably hot, even in winter.- The fold out bed was almost unusable.Worst hotel.  We had a block of 10 rooms.  Each room was dirty and had bugs.  Gnats and roaches.  We brought it to the managers attention.  She could have cared less.  I told her about the cockroaches and she didn't believe  me until I showed her a picture from my bathroom.  It was disgusting.  If this was a $20 a night motel I would expect these problems.  It was so bad our entire group left and went to another hotel.  I alerted the manager of our intent hoping she would do something.  She said "what do you want me to do about it". Enough said!!!  We went to the Hilton Garden Inn and had a great experience.   Upon checking out, we noticed that they had charged different rates to the different parties in our group instead of the group rate they quoted when the reservation was made.  To add insult to injury, they charged and entirely different rate to our credit cards, which was $72 dollars more than our bill You should avoid this place at all costsI did not stay here. I attended a Mary Kay meeting as a guest of a consultant.What I *can* say about this location is that the conference room we used was clean and spacious. And the lobby area was lovely. And they are obviously open to being the host location of things like this. They look to have a conference center attached to the hotel, but we were in a room directly across from the check in desk. And it's in a good location, close to the highway, malls, restaurants and not far from downtown (for those who might be using the hotel to actually stay there...)We stayed here on 10/25-26 and I was not pleased. Check in was pleasant, the lady at the desk was friendly. When we returned for the night, we found that someone else was in our room. She was very rude about it, and we went back downstairs. The guy at the desk was nice, and he quickly got us another room. I'm glad wwe didn't leave anything in the first room, because I'm sure it would have disappeared. The room was your average hotel room. It was a bit outdated, but it was clean. Had a faint smoky smell though. The TV was difficult to operate with the remote. The room was also very warm, and the air conditioning did not filter into the room well. It was ok for the purpose of sleeping, but I'm sure I'd choose another hotel next time.Is this the low end of the Holiday Inn brand?  If so, and after staying here, I think the other Holiday Inn's with this name should immediately bump themselves up to the next level. This location was a dud.The front desk was was unengaged in the guest check in process to a point where they barely acknowledged me at the desk; although once they did, they were civil -- albeit barely.  The rooms were clean and spartan.  The decorations were old but in reasonably good condition.  It had been a long day, so I didn't really notice a lot of noise. Walking into the hotel didn't do much for setting the tone.  The entire outside of the building smelled like lysol or pine sol -- not sure which odor was more prevalent -- but it was overpowering.The hotel lobby was nice enough and actually elegant looking but for the price of this hotel, the level of service and amenities just wasn't anywhere close to a value.If I could leave no stars then I would.  We checked into our room, got our keys and had to leave due to working a large event.  When we returned , other guests were given our room.  The Horrible evening front desk manager would not bring us new keys for our new room.  We had to take our weeks worth of luggage down stairs to get a new key to a room that was not what we reserved.  We never got our wake up calls, which we needed because the alarm clock didn't function.  The AC unit was not functioning correctly, our room didn't get clean most days and when it did we didn't get towels or dirty items were left in he room.   Cash was taken out of luggage and the staff was not helpful when it was reported.  Horrible experience .Bed Bug Issue:  Very disappointing. Stayed at this Holiday Inn, Louisville East-Hurstbourne, for two nights in September, on 5th floor. Immediately following this stay, my wife and I noticed many bites on my son who sleeps on our bedroom floor next to my suitcase I routinely keep in our room. When we noticed a bug on me one night, we pulled back our mattress and found several bed bugs. What followed was a $2,250 tab to an exterminator to heat our home, as they had spread to other areas very quickly.When reported, the hotel Manager "verified a small incident" in my room. The Manager originally extended 5000 pts. When presses for some consideration of my $2,250 exterminator fee, the room cost was refunded. I am still stuck with an exterminator bill for which they would not help. Unfortunately, I am in the process of having to pursue a legal solution. I have traveled over 20 years and never had a bed bug issue until after staying at this hotel. Would not recommend.The staff service and convention areas were very nice. The restaurant inside the hotel was a nice touch as well. But so far the rooms arw the worst I have ever seen for a holiday inn. Maybe it is because we are at the older portion of the hotel. All the decor are cheap and bad quality. The lights in the hallway all have spider webs on them. I would say be here for the conference but stay somewhere else.We walked into our non-smoking room and were blasted with the smell of cigarettes. After a 9 hour drive we told them we will sleep there, but we don't want to pay the fine. We go back to our room to find the toilet won't flush. There is also a dirty, hairy fork on the floor next to the foot of the bed. Stepping on it wasn't pleasant.We were given another room. The key didn't work and we had to go back to the desk again. Our pets were really stressed by this process. They also took us from a king to a double bed room.Worst of all? Nothing but a shallow, fake apology. Nothing given as compensation. Even something as small as a free breakfast would have made all the difference in customer service.Kinda sucks.  I see this place averages a two-star. I'm putting one in an effort to pull the average down further.  I asked for a room which was quiet, but they gave me a second floor room across from the ballroom. 6am Saturday morning we wanted to sleep in a bit and there were dudes for a weekend conference sitting at a table outside yaking away which woke us up. We could hear the conference activity loud and clear within the room. The room (#280) also smelled like maybe it was a smoking room at one time. Stinky = Not cool.  Staff at front desk is...not super friendly. We were able to move to a better room on fifth floor(with a view) though and get a discount which smoothed things over a bit. We were disappointed that the breakfast was kinda yucky and the waitstaff 50% did not speak English and were absent/inattentive/rude and bothered with basic requests like "may I please have silverware". Don't plan on having breakfast here.  There is an IHOP and a Waffle House within walking distance. You luck will be better there.  Or, BYO breakfast provisions. The TV control interface is a major pain in the behind just to try and watch TV and channel surf (which annoyed me). One last thing, the pool in the hotel is cold and the water is kinda cloudy(dirty?).  The hotel posts a sign that says no more than five(?!) people allowed in the pool at any time or face up to $100 fee. Crappy rule. Good luck. There are better places to stay for sure.  Don't expect extras at this place, nor "extra mile" service.  That's all for now, folks.Somehow, I feel like I've been staying at a different hotel than the other reviewers. I'm presently in my second week here, and will be back next week, happily. My room is clean, comfortable, and well maintained.  My TV is a a large flat panel with good picture. The restaurant and bar staff have been friendly and ready to serve every time I walk in. The free breakfast is usually at Holiday Inn Express,  not the regular Holiday Inns, so maybe that's where some confusion came from. I've had nothing but good experiences here, and do recommend this location.This hotel is-- in one word-- bland.Even their update looks like it was designed for the 70's. Everything from the furniture to the TVs is straight out of the disco era.Location is very good, however, with lots of restaurants around. But good luck in getting out the parking lot and back to the highway. Ask the hotel on how to do this...One upon a time in a grander time of proms & homecomings in 1982 Holiday Inn Hurstbourne was a spectacular place! But just like our bad 80's bangs & shoulder pads something's should never come back. RIP Holiday Inn Hurstbourne I will remember you as you where in 1982 in my imagination.Literally the worst holiday inn I have ever stayed in. The rooms stinks like old fryer grease and smoke even though there non smoking. I figured the hotel chain had standards but obviously not the case. We stayed at a hotel on the other side on the road the week before and it was very nice for $10 more. We didn't even dare go to the pool, for the many shady occupants that had half the hotel smelling like Cheech and Chong had been walking around. Surprised the place isn't condemned let alone being a part of a major hotel chain.
review_content_20: Totally underwhelmed. So many better choices for the same price.  Not a one star, just not impressed.This hotel gets one star because you can't give them zero stars.  The bed had blood on the comforter.  The room wreaked of pesticide.  There was noise from maintenance.  There was noise from the house keeping staff.  The water in the shower was barely warm.  The maid ignored the DO NOT DISTURB sign and just walked in to the room.  The room service is awful and not edible.In the past I had co-workers report bed bugs at this hotel.  On the bright side with the strong pesticide smell maybe they killed most of them.  The hotel is the worst Holiday Inn that I have ever stayed in.  Don't stay here.We were just all over the place with good and bad things throughout our stay. I will list them here:GOOD: We arrived 2 hours before the official check in time and were told we could have our room right away.BAD: Getting in and out of this location is very difficult. There is this roundabout way to exit which is not marked clearly. If you dont use this exit you will be forced to make dangerous u-turns on the divided highway out in front (Hurstbourne).GOOD: The room was spacious, clean and updated.BAD: Someone vomited on the carpet in the hall outside our room the 1st night we were there. Even though attempts were made to clean it and reduce the odor, it remained very noticable until we left 5 days later. GOOD: Breakfast in the dining room was a large, hot buffet with many choices. $8.99 for everything, $6.99 for just fruit, cereal and bread.BAD: If there was an "included" breakfast, we did not see where it was or have it offered to us.GOOD: The workout room was well equipped with free weights, machines and TV.BAD: It took a long time for the room to be cleaned and restocked with water and towels.GOOD: The hotel offered an "environmental" service, where you could opt to just have your room "refreshed" rather than have new sheets, towels, etc.BAD: How environmentally friendly can they be when the tub faucet dripped a stream of water continiously for the 6 days we were there, and reporting it to the front desk yielded zero results?Basically, for what we paid we could have done a lot worse, but all in all just expect a very basic stay.This is one of the poorest Holiday Inn locations I have ever stayed in.The hallways and doors are in SERIOUS need of updating and/or replacement, and the rooms aren't in much better shape.  The location isn't the best in town, and the staff are less than great.I'd skip it if there's any other choice available at all.Booked this hotel via priceline for $39 (plus fees/taxes) on a weekend.  So for $39, this wasn't bad.  If I paid normal rate, I would have been unsatisfied.We arrived at 1 in the morning, checked in, requested a 7am wakeup call, and planned to be gone by 8.  At 745a we woke up, wake up call never came.Room appeared to be clean, everything functioned properly.  Just looking at the outside of the guest door (which appeared to be 70s era vaneer) though, you understood this is not a 3 star property.  Again, nothing gross, but certainly not a deluxe hotel.The white baby grand piano in the lobby was ostentatious to say the least.  It's horrendous when hotels don't provide most relevant services like wake up calls.If you're going to be in Louisville and get this for cheap from Priceline, not a bad value for that price -- but be sure to set your own alarm clock.Stayed here overnight for a business conference.  The hotel is convenient to the interstate and several restaurants nearby.  Accommodations are typical.Rooms and service are good; has a Starbucks within walking distance.We are a couple of weary California travelers who booked a room here via Hotwire when we realized we needed a room to rest and recuperate before seeing family after our red eye flight.  I called from the airport to see if we could have an early check-in.  Spoke with Molly, who was soooooo accommodating.  She let us check in right away, gave us a nice, clean, huge room with a pretty view of a little lake.  She signed us up for their free rewards program and sent us to our room with 2-1 drink tickets, discount meal vouchers, and complimentary bottled water.  It's so refreshing to receive five star service at a three star hotel.  Molly, you are going to do just fine in life.  It was a pleasure!Poor service by the front desk.  Spoke with Marie Boone & she refused to help me switch rooms, despite the hotel's emptiness (I suspect a common occurance).Rooms - noisy & dirty.  Poor renovation with unsightly post construction attention to detail.Considering the price - one could do much better.

review_content: I love this hotel brand and this location is exceptional. Extremely friendly staff and great location walking distance to good restaurants and such. They have great 24/7 food options and a step above the microwaved processed egg breakfast. Their rooms make you feel like a king. Extremely comfortable pillows and beds in every room and every room is a suite with a pullout couch. Oh, and the best part is the price is pretty inexpensive for what you get.My only real gripe is that the Internet was a little slow, but if you are in the area I highly recommend staying here. For while my first choice for staying somewhere in Louisville is the Brown... This is a good backup in East Louisville.My family and I went to Kentucky for my cousins wedding back in July and stayed at this Hyatt. I've been to a few other Hyatt locations before, and this one was a little different. Rooms: the rooms were basic. I hated that the sink was outside of the actual bathroom, and the shower area was way too small. The beds were semi comfortable, but the sheets were extremely uncomfortable. They had a sitting area with a couch and aside from the bathroom sink being outside the actual bathroom, they also had a desk and another area with a sink. The AC worked phenomenally thank god. The first night I was barefoot and when I was putting shoes on, I noticed my feet were black, so.. that's disgusting. I called to ask them if they could re-clean and they did thankfully. Price: I didn't pay for this hotel stay, but for the 5 nights I believe it came out to $2,000.... a little too much...Staff: They were friendly. I guess it's true what they say about "Southern comfort." And they constantly brought us room service since we didn't have our own car... Location: it was literally 5 minutes away from my aunt and uncles house so it was ideal for our family, but it was awkwardly placed right by a main road which I found slightly annoying. It's one of the nicer hotels in Louisville, so I would recommend it. I guess us spoiled Californians are used to the nice beach side hotels.The Hyatt would not change my reservation due to bad weather. I booked on trip advisor so they were unwilling to change my reservation. So some business is keeping my $227. Your welcome for the free money trip advisor and Hyatt. Thanks for not helping.I love the hotel from the service to the comfortable beds. The breakfast in the morning is amazing and late Check is ok you would just have to let the desk know. If you need help with anything just let them know. They have a shuttle that can take you a 2mi radius and picks you up. You don't have to drive your car.it's also walking distance from restaurants and stores. I live in louisville and find time to get a night here away from homeI am a business traveler.  Here's my perspective:This place and the rooms are funky. It's hip and trendy which doesn't always translate to easy and convenient.The rooms are more geared to a leisure/social setting with a large portion of the room designed for the couch and sitting area.  It is not well equipped in the bed area for rollerbags, etc.  (again much of the space attention is devoted to the living room and desk area (with another sink and counter).  The bathroom really is small to the point it is difficult. The sink is out in the bedroom area and the commode is in with the shower. This space is very tight and it is made worse because of a lack of room to put clothes, towels, robes without dipping them in the toilet. I am picky about not sharing my immediate shower space with the toilet.  If you are a big person or need room to dress and undress in a closed-door bathroom---forget it. If you want something pretty clean and a little different---especially for a social get together, this is a good choice. For a professional traveler, it seemed to be a little awkward for just sleeping and "getting ready".  3 stars for that reason. The staff was nice and eager to please. Breakfast choice was better than most similar hotels.We very much enjoyed our stay. We were limited on hotel options because we had our two small dogs with us. The staff was friendly and we enjoyed a very nice complimentary breakfast the next morning (it feels like that's a dying trend at hotels anymore). The only nit picky things I'd have to add are the reviews are right- the bathrooms are soooo tiny. Not a deal breaker but I wish they would just make the doors into pocket doors and it would be a game changer. Also be warned it is pricey to bring dogs. They came with a $70 cleaning fee which I understand but is a bummer when we were only there one night and they stayed in their crate anytime we weren't there. Ah well....that's the cost of furbabies. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area. It's a quick 15 minute drive to most touristy type stops.A hotel room 10 minutes away from downtown for $80? I was shocked at the price, and did not hesitate to make a reservation here recently. My wife and I were in town for a friend's wedding and we loved our stay here. The stay is friendly and the accommodations are really nice. The room itself featured a great king size bed and also a large sitting area with a kitchenette and fridge. Traveling for the first time with a newborn, I thought we were going to run into some issues but this experience was great!Free hot breakfast buffet in the morning is a huge bonus!My only knock on this place is the lack of "snack" options - one night my wife and I wanted a snack and they don't really have much to offer. No vending machines or anything like that, just a counter in the front with some sweets and soda.Stayed here for business. Despite booking ahead of time the only available room was on the first floor next to the pool. So I got to experience the terrible sound insulation. It's alsmot like there are no walls between the bedroom and hallway. Would be great if you could close off the living area and sleeping are for extra sound insulation. Breakfast was very good if you get there before the rest of the guests or else the room fills up, nice touch that is often overlook in today's world. Really wish they placed the loud families in the spots that they will make loud.Great location near plenty of restaurants and shopping.   Several places within walking distance.  The staff was extremely friendly,  housekeeping was excellent.   I like the room set up with the sitting area and desk.  Wi fi was speedy and reliable.  Would definitely recommend this place.If you can tell from the amount of pictures I took, I love this place and any other Hyatt Place! I love the upscale modern feel of the whole hotel. The furniture and decor are really nice. I love the service. I have been to 2 others in different states and they are always on top of their game when it comes to the front desk and much of anything else. I love the rooms with the flat panel TV that swivels between the living room and bedroom. The sink is really nice with the stone counters and I like that they have a refrigerator with a whole separate sink by the door. The couch is always comfortable and has a good amount of throw pillows. I also like the nice warm throw blanket that they also supply. the breakfast is actually one of the better ones I have had for what it is. they have oatmeal, cereal, bagels, toast, donuts, juice, milk, fruit, yogurt, and they also have a menu that you can order from at a cost. I would probably go out if I wanted something warm because the prices are a little high for what they offered. This place was in the middle of what ever you wanted to do, everything we did was no more than 15 minutes away.I stayed here when I attended a wedding at the Olmstead down the street.  Not only was the location great, but the rooms were very nice for the very low $80 a night price tag.  I liked that there was a lounge area separate from the bedroom area that had a sizable flat screen as well as a coffee/tea breakfast nook.  My party was very well accommodated by the staff.  They let us get rooms on the same floor and didn't bat an eye when we asked to change our taxi arrival time not once, not twice, but three times.  I can't help it if my beauty routine takes longer than anticipated!To top it all off, checkout in the morning was a breeze and made even more delightful by the complimentary continental breakfast.  I highly recommend staying here!I recently stayed here for a business trip, this was my first visit ever to a Hyatt Place and was uncertain on staying there but I did review some of the prior reviews which made it a bit more comortable.Upon my arrival, I was immediately greeted by a gentleman at the front desk who was friendly and helpful to say the least.  He processed me through quickly, explained about the complimentary breakfast and off I went. The rooms are spacious, it gives you the sense of staying in a suite....the sectional couch is extremely comfortable, the flat screen tv is awesome....the in-house coffee was great, the mini fridge came in handy to stock up some snacks.  The bed was ultra comfortable.  The entire staff there was helpful and friendly...they definitely have my business for my next visit out there!Rooms are "cool" looking, but (call me crazy) I prefer a room thats comfortable & functional...I care less how trendy it looks. The bathroom was a joke. If someone's on the toilet, you can't open the door. It must be 3x4 feet...literally. The bathroom sink is in the bedroom area (weird, right?) Big flat screen tv, but it's located in between the living room and bedroom (which are only separated by a thin "shade"), so if u have a kid sleeping on the sofa bed, you can't watch tv without disturbing them. Also, I was told it had an indoor pool when I booked it, only to find out there wasn't. The only good thing was the breakfast, but that's not enough for me to ever want to stay there again.Probably the best hotel room I have ever stayed in. The bed was comfortable and you have a separate living area with a couch that folds out into a bed if needed. The TV is mounted on the wall and you can move it so you can see while laying in bed or sitting on the couch. The rooms also have a small sink, mini fridge, and coffee pot. Pool was nice other then a little crowded. The only downside was the air conditioner. When we got in it was extremely cold so we turned it down. After that it was really loud the whole time.We got in late and they were happy to help us with the bags to our rooms. The beds were very comfy and they have a mini media center you would hook your xbox or laptop into if you have a vga or HDMI cable. The rooms are big and it smells great and the floor and bathrooms are spotless. The wifi worked ok but I didn't expect a fast connection at all. The pool was nice to use and I happy to have it there. We didn't eat breakfast there because we wanted a hot breakfast. Would I stay again yes.Alright...I want to give this place more stars, but I can't.  I absolutely LOVE the actual rooms.  They're huge. They have 42 in flat screen tv's mounted on a swivel on a wall between the "Bedroom" and the "Living Room" That's right...all the rooms have a living room. With a big L-shaped couch and ottoman. All very very cool.  But, I think in all the updates on the rooms they left the bathrooms exactly the same, but they moved the walls or something and smashed up the bathroom.(Disclaimer: This next part of the review revolves around pooping)I was injured while pooping in this hotel room.  The toilet was so close to the wall/door of the bathroom that the toilet paper roll holder actually hung over the toilet seat.  I'm not a small man.  But, it hung OVER the toilet seat.  So, it dug into my side while going to the bathroom.  Also, I had to sit sideways on the toilet because the toilet was so close to the door.  RIDICULOUS!  It was so uncomfortable that I honestly would have preferred pooping elsewhere...(Pooping stories over)Other than that, the staff was nice and helpful. They gave us advice on where to go and what to do while we were in town. The contenintal breakfast was....ok....pretty much what you'd expect.  But, the bathrooms in the room are awful...and made me give them a not great review.  Pooping comfort is important!Just checked in.  Staff is incredibly friendly.  Room is awesome.  Bed is comfy.  TV is HUGE.  No complaints at all.  Seriously for the money, awesome hotel.  Missing finer touches of a luxury hotel but for my money this place is incredible.I've stayed in 2 Hyatt Place hotels now(Louisville and Indianapolis) both exactly the same even the lobby is the same layout.   I really love them.  Nice set up with the large flat panel TV.  The bathroom is small but the sink is outside the bathroom so it's great for a couple to get ready at the same time.  Great breakfast... Very healthy:)  Only thing I don't like is no trash can in the bathroom!?Hyatt did a great job laying out the rooms for the business traveller.  I like the big comfy room.  The only thing that would make the room better was being able to see the tv from the desk whiile trying to work.  The room was clean and tidy.  The staff was knowledgeable and friendly.This hotel provides value with a contemporary, classic flair. The lobby area is really nice, it feels like a boutique hotel which usually comes with a much higher price tag. The hotel features self check in and has a nice snack bar/coffee shop and Starbucks cafe. Guests can order and pick up a variety of items through touch screens. In fact, the Internet features are a striking feature of this hotel. In addition to the standard wi-fi, it was nice to have a gaming console which also permitted a mp3 or CD player hook up to a large 42 inch plasma screen TV. The hotel staff were very friendly and gave me a tour of the facilities. The room was very clean. The only drawbacks...hence the 4 rather than 5 rating was the bathroom which felt really tiny and the lack of storage space if you were staying for more than one night. But, on ambiance and creating a nice experience on a reasonable budget, this hotel is definitely a step in the right direction!
review_content_20: booked a room here last minute on a road trip to the east coast. our first experience with a "Hyatt Place". we were already in a good mood because of what a great price we got last-minute (advertising well under $100 for a handicapped-accessible room (we didn't really care, but it does affect the bathroom layout in slightly inconvenient ways); they are being rational and pricing down leftover rooms at the end of the night ... an empty room is revenue lost). we weren't expecting much, but this far surpassed our expectations. hyatt has obviously thought pretty hard about what typical travelers need and don't need, made sure they get the stuff they want, and cut the other stuff. feels like the garden inn or residence inn concept, but they just do it more nicely.walking in, we weren't sure we were at the front desk, but it turns out they had one guy playing bartender and food server as well as doing check-in. in a hotel of this size, though, the lean staffing seems to be fine. if you think about it, how many non-resort, non-big-city, passing-through-town hotels really need bellmen, front desk staff, concierge, room service, etc? it feels very european in terms of how cleverly used the space is. everything is ultra-modern; automated check-in/check-out kiosk in the lobby, and i was struck by the number of input options for the big-screen TV.  but the rooms themselves don't feel cramped at all; you have a sitting area, plus a bedroom area, and (at least in our room) a big bathroom.and yet when I remarked at check-out how new it all seemed, the woman on duty said this location was actually due for a thorough renovation. !!! renovating a property where everything already seems extremely up to date: now that's good management.service here was both friendly and efficient: to have one person doing everything, that person has to be very efficient, but it seems like they did in fact find very friendly and efficient people. another nice bonus: conveniently located next door to a Brick House Tavern (open late, good food, reasonable prices) as well as a Barnes & Noble. and near the freeway.oh and to top it off?  the *included* breakfast is actually good and includes savory items - mcmuffin-type sandwiches.  none of the usual lame "some bread, jam and juice' continental breakfast business.  this is a *real* breakfast.  and more of the clever efficiency: the plates are stacked above the buffet, saving room, and enabling them to put their money where guests stay.honestly, i have stayed at hotels that charge 4x more that were not as good as the stay we had here.we will happily try another Hyatt Place in the future and would definitely stay here again if passing through Louisville.  heck, we'd even consider paying $100 to do it.I traveled to Louisville on March 16, 2008 and stayed at this hotel.  The service is excellent.  The front desk (Wayne) loaned me an umbrella, and I was grateful for that.  The bathroom downstairs had complimentary pads and tampons in each stall.  That's a detail that I sincerely can appreciate.The hotel has a "boutique" hotel theme.  The room has a plasma screen t.v.   The bathroom is a little small, and I didn't like the sink being separated from the toilet.  Gift shop would be nice.Overall, I give this hotel a 10 for friendly service and for details.Can't wait to stay here again!First off...I'm IN LOVE with the couch...I'm stalking on where to buy one for my house;-)Service was great, bed cozy, etc.  I do agree with the smallish bathroom.wifi was nice and reliable.  Room was spacious enough to lay out all of our clothes and gazillion bags so I could restructure for the next leg of the trip.  (and clean....wouldn't get heebie jeebies from sitting on the carpet;)But really....I love that couch....did I mention that?There is a Hyatt Place near us and I told hubby we should go stay there for our anniversary just to cuddle on the couch and watch a movie;-)  lol  (It doesn't take much...)Compared to our last stay in Louisville at the dive-y-est Motel6 ever, it was a complete 180.  My perpetually uber-frugal, cranky if he spends money hubby, is sold on hyatt place.  We cant wait to bring the kids back next time for the convention.  Every 2nd February we'll be staying at Hyatt Place East;-)Breakfast: Yum.  A step up from your average, fresh fruit, tazo teas and well staffed to keep up with the clients eating.tv's are cool, rooms are clean and comfortable. but the wi-fi didn't work on my first visit, and I commented on that. I got an email they fixed it, but on trip # 2, still no working wi-fi.

review_content: Great hotel. Clean, spacious and beautifully decorated. Easy check in and check out. The only thing that bothered me was that the pictures of the pool on the website compared to what it actually looks like. The pool is tiny compared to the actual size. I expected more, and partially booked this placed based on the pool in the photos. We did enjoy the complimentary breakfast. They also had snacks and drinks in the evening but we were out during that time so we didn't get to check it out. I liked the over all layout of the room but they put us right next to a birthday party with at least 15 kids, and that was extremely irritating. If I wanted to hear screaming kids I would have brought my own. I guess I can't blame them for it, just bad luck. They were out by the second day. It is located on a business campus which made the scenery a bit blah. There are many things nearby though. Downtown was about 15 minutes away.Would I stay here again, maybe, depending on what kind of weekend I'm trying to have.This Embassy Suites, located in an obscure business park, should be marketed as an amusement park for kids and adolescents.  The centerpiece of the hotel is a large indoor pool located in the lobby.  Since this is an architectural atrium design, the sound of screaming kids echoes throughout.  In addition, groups of children, wrapped in towels, frolic in the hallways leaving moisture seeping into the carpets. It is an ersatz Disney hotel, great if you want to entertain your children.  We came here for a restful night before we embark on our move from Louisville to Salt Lake City. Restful? Hah! Our one bedroom suite was large and tastefully decorated, but the screams of ecstatic children eliminated any peace or respite. In addition, they charge an extra $75.00 to bring your pooch with you. Thus, I wouldn't call this a "pet friendly" hotel as advertised.  Fortunately, we talked them into not charging the $75 at check out. In summation, this Embassy Suites is great for kids and miserable for adults. Caveat Emptor.Very nice hotel overall.  Clean and comfortable with small but good laundry facility and mostly friendly and helpful staff.  A few small things kept it from getting the full five stars though.  Front desk staff member at check in was kind of a grump which is never a great way to start a stay, smiles are free and go a long way for customer satisfaction.  The bedside light had a broken on/off switch and I had to stick my finger in it to turn it off which was a bit scary.  Finally, the wifi was HORRIBLE.  Trying to watch a movie was impossible as it kept dropping and surfing the web was tough.  In closing, I would stay here again but would like to see the above issues addressed.This review is so belated! My S.O. and I stayed at the Embassy Suites-Louisville about four times between December 2014 and February 2015, and our travel backgrounds vary but our experience at this hotel was something we definitely agreed on: they kept us coming back and we always had a great stay. Our longest duration here was an 8-day stay, and we enjoyed the most obvious perks of the Embassy Suites: the free cook-to-order breakfast every morning, and the Manager's Happy Hour (which is every night between 5:30 p.m. - 7:30 p.m.). Our rooms were always clean, and despite what I've read on other reviews, we never heard anything from the atrium -- even on New Year's Eve. Here's what we learned (i.e. a few tips & tricks): * The hotel gets busy with kids from Thursdays through the weekend, probably because it's in the popular East End and is an incredible value (the breakfast/bar amenities mentioned above, plus we saw they had a pool, which kiddos probably enjoy). * The gym has two treadmills and two ellipticals, plus a selection of free weights. It gets busy around 6:00 a.m. Guests here get free access to the Louisville Athletic Club, which might be more worth your time if you want to drive 2 miles. We didn't. * One of the elevators is a little wobbly, but seems strong. * In all of our rooms, the fridge was always set to ice-cold (literally) and we could never find a way to change this. * The pretzel nuggets served during Happy Hour might change your life for the better, but if you don't have any self-control, you'd better just back away slowly. * Actually, the food here is pretty good, especially for a hotel restaurant, and the kitchen is very accommodating. The veggie burger is good and tastes homemade; the flatbread pizza is easily customizable; the turkey reuben is awesome and healthy. Even the snacks during Happy Hour are pretty reliable and contain a fair amount of fresh vegetables!Overall, here's what we REALLY loved: The friendly service everywhere in this hotel. By the time we finished our last stay, we actually had a running list of everyone we wanted to acknowledge *by name* for going out of their way to give us a great experience: * Chauncey learned our breakfast order by heart, but she also greeted us by name each day and gave us a friendly chat and "Good morning," even when we didn't get anything in the cook-to-order breakfast line. * Diana, the morning hostess, was so friendly and sweet. * Justin, one of the night cooks, made us an awesome dinner one night and gave us great menu advice since we had eaten just about everything on there. [He's a talented guy.] * Angela and Simone provided excellent kitchen support and service.* Nick and Monty went out of their way to bartend with excellent service and advice. "Bartend" is actually quite an understatement: Monty is a true gentleman, very soft-spoken and polite, while Nick suggested a great local beer for us when we pried him for other drink suggestions outside of the hotel bar. * Kyle always greeted us with a smile from the front desk and helped us out with all of our room/hotel questions.* Erica, one of the housekeepers, was extremely professional while she was in our room AND while she was around the hotel. This staff is just so impressive and I truly hope they are well-compensated for their service. This team definitely helped us feel comfortable and they set the bar high for future travel.Really enjoyed my time here. Clean, contemporary, and large rooms with more than enough space. Always nice to have a fridge and microwave and plenty of desk space (in your own suite, and also plenty of room to work in the lobby). The highlight of this place is the stellar complimentary breakfast...omelets/ scrambles and other hot foods made to order and a nice selection of oatmeal, fruits, donuts, breads, potatoes, yogurts, etc.Stopped here for non business and had a pleasant experience.  The rooms were clean and modern and the workout area was adequate for me to set up my bike and trainer which was great.  One of the highlights of this place is the made to order breakfast and the word is out on this group.  So if you want a good shot shorter lines and getting everything you want get up early!  They experience quite a rush and they do get cleaned out of some of their items, especially if it's toward the end.  Certainly worth another stay next time i'm in the area.In town for a music fest, and staying 3 nights, we were out for a fun, safe, weekend with a few perks. This Embassy Suites (EB) did a fine job with the pre-prep. I coordinated with Clay Cadarette, the Front Office manager to ensure my friend, who arrived before I did, would have a smooth check in. (Great job, Clay!) He e-mailed me the paperwork and I got it right back to him with his stamp of approval. Super nice touch! Very responsive!Staff were **all** smiles and Southern charm. I mean everyone! Not one grump in the group.The room was clean! Nice-sized fridge; bar sink; microwave; those weird two pouch coffee pots, good supply of toiletries,  and comfy beds. The bedroom even had a nice vanity area. I'm not sure I've see one before in an EB (and this trip just put me in Silver Elite status - woot!)Hotel is located as they advertise, ~ 15 minutes from downtown. It is an ~ $36.00 cab ride from hotel to Champion's Park, one way.Friend called because she thought there was an issue with the toilet. Maintenance was lightening-fast and looked right into it. (There wasn't really an issue anyway, but the keys are "lightning fast" and "friendly")The reasons this EB doesn't get 5 starts are the following: **no on site shuttle (I thought their web site said they had one, but when I rechecked it did not, so no issue there), it's just odd to me that an EB anywhere doesn't have a shuttle.**No *real* room service. The Atrium restaurant (inside the EB) had a decent standard breakfast with ample food out for all the traveling families, (cheerleaders, student atheletes, etc) but rolls up their service at 11 to reopen AFTER the complimentary b'fast buffet at, I think, 11:30 AM. That leaves a serious food/bev gap if you are a group of metal heads attending a music festival and wanting to relax in your room with some chub grub following a late night show. So, step it up Atrium, don't advertise all those delicious eats and drinks and cut us off at 11PM for 12.5 hours!  [To their credit, the sweet folks at the front desk turned us on to a restaurant that delivered until 4 AM - SCORE! So, that kept the munchies at bay, as we used them two times).**After hanging out at the festival and dodging crowd surfers all day, a body needs some R&R, so we couldn't WAIT to hit the hot tub. Again, closes at 11 PM. No ifs, ands, or buts. Night one, we missed it and night 2 we were able to squeeze in under the finish line for ~ 20 minutes of hot tub goodness. It was a clean hot tub, stocked with two types of towels, one is super plush and large and the other more like a hair towel, but big enough. On our checkout day, Monday when we hoped for one last hot tub before hitting the road, we are greeted with a "Hot tub is out of service, sorry for any inconvenience" sign. Again, not a big deal, just a little bit of a let down. **disappointing coffee maker. This is my personal pet peeve, so I can't really blame them. Friend called this EB and was told that the in room coffee pots *were* Keurig. That's all we brought w/ us were Keurig pods. If I had known that actually, no, they do not have Keurig, I would have brought my own, or my 4-cup. On day 3, the "just outside of the buffet area" giant coffee pot was empty. So, we doubled up the little padded coffee thingys that go in the drippy thingy into the paper cup and made do. The in room phones are wireless, so if you program in your wakeup call make sure the phone is on the hook. Ours wasn't which nearly mucked up our departure time. So, keep the phones charged and on the hook or the auto-wakeups do NOT work. Bring a little alarm clock.Across the street is a McAllister's deli and there are shops and restaurants super close by (within 2 miles was a nice looking outdoor mall).If you are looking for a full service EB; complete with something like a Ruth's Chris delivering all night right to your room, and an in-house spa, with a shuttle van that will take you anywhere within a reasonable radius (25 miles) look elsewhere. If you are looking for a solid EB, with friendly folks and super-great management (Clay) who do want to meet and exceed your expectations, in a safe, comfortable, lovely suburban setting close to shops and eats, stay here. When in the area, I'll be back, but I'll bring my KeuriSo my last few stays at Hotels in the Hilton chain have not been so great. So when my husband booked our stay at this Embassy Suites I was not expecting too much. I was blown away. This hotel was very nice. It was clean, updated and laid out well. The staff was nice. It was full and there was a wait to get food in the morning, but they worked to keep the food refilled. The only issue was there were not enough tables to eat at but like I said they were fill. Would go back again in a heart beat. Very nice!Beautifully decorated, good staff, great location and nice amenities.  Of course, the evening reception and cook to order breakfast are always a highlight at Embassy.  The photos on Yelp are outdated; the hotel has been remodeled and has a nice modern vibe.  So, why three stars and not four or five?  The beds.  My wife and I both tossed and turned all night.  And, two queens would be so much better than two doubles.  Someone else may find the mattresses just fine--I'm sure it is a preference thing, but boy does my back hurt this morning!ALL I HAVE TO SAY IS WOW! Okay, I'll say a little more...It is a great hotel - especially for the price. The value is amazing and the location is great. It's a super safe and fancy area.  We were greeted with free snacks and cocktails in the evening, when we checked in. They also have a free cooked to order breakfast. The room - or actually a 2 room suite - was comfortable, clean, quiet and had everything we needed. The wi-fi was fast and the little kitchenette was nice, so we could have a "home cooked" meal. We are on month 2 of an almost 4 month national comedy tour, so we really look for places that are a stand in for "home". That is not always accomplished but IT WAS HERE. It really did feel like home, only a fancier and more modern home than ours :-)Exceptionally clean and hospitable. By far our best hotel experience since our two year old was born. Breakfast was good and had ton of options.  Cocktail hour was low key and refreshing.  Lobby was welcoming and room was large, clean, comfortable and had a convenient layout.  Price was good, too! Makes me want to seek out more Embassy Suites!Clean and pristine! Staff was phenomenal. Chaunacy the cook rocked!Quite possibly the very worst Hilton property I have ever had stayed at in the last 25 years!Front desk staff is incompetent.  Junior managers are not empowered to satisfy the customers.  Senior managers are absent on the weekends.  General Manager absolutely lacks customer-focus and has a "fine...we don't want customers like you" approach to troubleshooting problems with his staff.  Their response to my first problem caused my second and third problems and the whole experience just spiraled downwards.  Thanks to these people I was late to a business meeting and had to shave in the car on the way there.  Not exactly the experience I expected when I made the reservation at my favorite brand of hotel.  I had enough problems with this property that I will NEVER stay there again when I am in town on business.  It is worth noting that I stayed in 3 different Embassy Suites hotels within the 10-day period I stayed here (Chicago - Louisville - Nashville) and this place just doesn't measure up.Of note (and the reason they received even a single star) is the omelet guys - very friendly and banging out great food.  Other than those two...this place represents a complete waste of money!  Do yourself a favor and sleep in your car or on a park bench instead of making a reservation at this property.Super solid two-room suite hotel. Fresh hot breakfast selection in the morning was well stocked and varied. A non-dairy milk option would have been nice however... The room and bathroom were very clean and the Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries smelled great. Bed was on the softer side, down pillows. There were huge flat screen TV's in both the bedroom and separate sitting area. Used the laundry facilities and they were reasonably priced at just a dollar per load. Only complaints were the noise on friday and saturday nights. The atrium layout amplified the sound coming from the pool, ballroom and bar areas and we could hear it all the way in the back bedroom. Probably would not have stayed at this hotel if we hadn't received the military discount, but at around $100 a night with, it was a good deal for the quality.this review is long over due.  My crew and I have stayed here 3 times now. Everyone on the staff is great from the front desk, to the bar, and the morning breakfast staff.Theresa, Trent, Danielle, Nick, Monty to name just a few. And especially Diana who works the morning breakfast shift along with the two lovely female Chefs.  Oh yes and the rooms are comfortable and clean.  Thank you Embassy Suites for your welcoming hospitality. Mary Donaldson - LA, CAWhile on business in Louisville, I stayed here for a couple of nights.  The hotel is a typical Embassy Suites, including the signature layout.  Rooms were clean and were modern.  I took advantage of the complimentary Happy Hour which included free drinks and finger foods.  The lobby and lounge are quite nice as well with modern furnishings.  The complimentary made to order breakfast was great as well.Stayed there last week, great place great pool clean and the free breakfast was a big plus for the family would recommend it to everyoneThis hotel can't seem to honor their reservations. Had a reservation booked per our usual through the Hilton website. Was placed in a smoking room, then told "those are your preferences online." O rly? We are Hilton Diamond members, stay over 30 times a year and have NEVER stayed in a smoking room, nor have our preferences EVER reflected that we want a smoking room. But according to the staff all of a sudden we're smokers after 12 years. I checked the website and, as stated, we do not prefer smoking rooms in our preferences. They were unable and unwilling to make it right by finding another room in their hotel or in another Hilton property.  We also called the Hhonors line and the rep also noted that we did not have "smoking rooms" checked as a preference. If you're gonna overbook you could at least not lie and claim that it is our fault that you only have smoking rooms left. We walked out and went across the street. In the future try not to lie to your customers.We have stayed here 3 times and I am now ready to write a review. This hotel is the ultimate in southern hospitality.The employees are cordial and attentive. This is the cleanest hotel I have stayed in anywhere in the south.The only thing with this hotel is it's ALWAYS full so make your reservations ahead. You can't walk in and get a room. Some things are worth planning ahead, and this hoteli is one of them.Oh yes, free breakfast and happy hour too!Excellent rainforest coffee N made to order breakfast. Room odor was stale. HVAC has no thermostat. I like the modern setting.
review_content_20: A very good place to stay if you are out in Louisville, KY area. The hospitality is very good.This hotel is lovely.  Lovely rooms, lovely ambiance and all around it smells clean and fresh.  This is a must for a hotel.  I would have given it five stars but it was too crowded at breakfast on a Sunday morning.  I think they need to add more tables and chairs to their breakfast area.  We did come when people were having a family reunion and maybe that could have been the reason.  Other than that it was a pleasant experience.The best hospitality of all the hotels I've stayed at in the last 10 years.I was very impressed with how the staff operates.  Front desk staff is very professional and the wait staff is the reason I ALWAYS come back to this place.  This location is a further drive for me, but well worth it.The atrium set up can make it a little noisy if you're directly above the bar area, but quiet in the bedroom if the door is closed.Nice setting. Staff is friendly.The staff is friendly, has what you expect from a Hilton location. The rooms are dated and could be refreshed a bit.The only reason this hotel received four stars it is isn't the most glamorous modern hotel out there, but for the price it was very nice, clean, and had great service. We came for the Kentucky Derby and it was such a great experience. The staff were all extremely friendly and excited for everyone going to the derby. Breakfast was delicious and fresh. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Also, we were celebrating my birthday and they surprised me with Champagne on ice with chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us in our room.Excellent hotel, however, I downgraded it one star because the HVAC unit is antiquated (no temperature control) and the toilet had trouble working correctly.  However, the complimentary reception and breakfast were good. The rooms (and public spaces) were clean and modern. The bed was comfortable and overall it is in a nice neighborhood.I chose this hotel because of its proximity to family I was visiting, and it proved to be an excellent choice. Check-in was quick, and I was able to get into my room immediately even though I was a bit early. The room was clean, comfortable and absolutely enormous. Bigger than my first apartment!  The suite style is an excellent setup for parents traveling with small children.  Any parent who has been stuck in a hotel room at their child's bedtime, unable to turn on the tv out of fear of waking them up will know what I am talking about!  Guest Services was truly wonderful. Though I am normally very organized, I forgot to pack a razor.  They sent one up within 5 minutes of my calling. The included breakfast is just what a hungry traveler needs- a FULL yummy breakfast cooked to order by some wonderful chefs who showed this Jersey girl some true Southern hospitality.  Thank you, Embassy Suites for a wonderful stay.We usually try to stay at Embassy suites whenever we can, We came into Louisville late and stop at another hotel, they were full, but, said Embassy Suites might have a room, we couldn't ever find Embassy suites in autoclub book or yellow pages.  Nice hotel, but we stayed at embassy suites Lexington the night before and it was far superior....DO NOT eat at the restaurant across the highway, I think it was called Limestone.....Terrible

review_content: This place was chill little ghetto spot for a very reasonable price. Located near a score of good restaurants and easy freeway access. The service staff was super friendly and helpful which makes up for a lot.The room left something to be desired. It wasn't particularly clean or at least did not appear so. I had some insectoid roommates that didn't cause me much problem although some folks might object to these free loading 6 legged freaks.All in all, this place served its purpose, a place to crash my face into a pillow and wake up warm and dry the next morning. Good enough for me. If you find yourself frequently complaining about what a hotel may or may not lack.. this may not be the place for you.Do Not Stay Here. This was the creepiest hotel ever. I swear we were the only ones here. We asked for a non smoking room. Nope. I swear I could feel my lungs screaming. We did check for bugs. Didn't find any a plus. We still slept fully clothed. Then to top it off at 12 (midnight). Someone tried to come into our room. I shouted "Stop" and ran to slam the door shut. The guy apologized & said he was a security guard. You could hear him checking all the rooms. And then went up next floor to check those rooms. (Weird). I wish I had checked the yelp reviews before booking this place. My sister booked it for me because it was close to the airport. Never again!!!Would love to give the quality of customer service a big fat ZERO thanks to Laquana and her complete lack of customer service skills. Called simply to discuss adding an additional night to my stay, instead was treated extremely rudely from the moment Laquana answered the phone. My simple call turned into a one sided debate, with me being lectured by Laquana... Poor customer service costs businesses billions of dollars each year and besides losing my annual business, Fern Valley just lost the business of my entire Salesforce which routinely travels to Louisville on a quarterly basis. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this placeBusiness travel isn't always glamorous. There are delayed flights, luggage getting lost, rude people, stinky taxis, etc. But usually when you get to your hotel room, you can kick your shoes off and sit in peace for a minute or two.But I wouldn't take my shoes off if you're staying here. In fact, I'd keep them on, along with your clothes, zipped and bundled from head to toe.My company booked a block of rooms for us in October for a convention down the road. The first red flag was the reception - dingy, indifferent front desk personnel in scrubby-looking polo shirts, keys that weren't registered/didn't unlock rooms... and oh, those rooms.To get to the rooms, you have to walk through the seven layers of hell, or, rather, the dilapidated and decaying lobbies and hallways. Carpets are pulled up or curling, elevators smell like dank cigarettes smoked 20 years ago, garbage piled up in the receptacles. I mean, there's not really a nice way of saying it, and I don't feel like I have to be nice because it's so gross, but this place is just dirty. It's old, it's dated, it's dirty. The people working there don't give a flying fook about the property - it shows.The fire alarm went off 4+ times during our stay. At night. And why? They didn't know and were not fussed enough to FIX IT.The bar didn't take credit cards. There's no on-site food. It's just.... no.No. No. No. Never will I step foot in the Fern Valley Hotel & Conference Center and I urge you to most likely never do such a thing, either.*I know there are many more details I am leaving out, but I feel the need to post this here because I wrote an original review the day after I got back on Trip Advisor and it's NOWHERE to be found. Interesting.If you'd like to feel like you're staying in the hotel from "The Shining," go ahead and book yourself here. But don't expect the mountain views. It's that creepy; doors left wide open with no one in them, piles of laundry in the hallways, holes in the walls and chicken nuggets on the floor (not kidding). The front desk, which is mediocre at best, says they are being "renovated," but after two nights here, I have seen zero work being done. I didn't even bother with the breakfast, seeing as how it's probably as good as the "free wifi," which is completely nonexistent (goodbye data). I would have never stayed, but was booked here for work, and you know what they say... All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.Gross. Never again. Loud kids screaming down the hallway, old looking rooms, no room service, no drinks...3stars? I think notZero stars!!  DO NOT STAY HERE!!  I cannot even understand how the health dept hasn't shut this place down. Inside and out this place is a &#!@ hole. From the floors to the ceilings, it is completely falling apart,  EXTREMELY run down, dated, has a old, somebody -died- there type -of- musty odor. Many of the doors don't have room numbers on them, so they got real classy and wrote the number of the room on the door with a black sharpie... then. when you walk in the room, you're greeted by BUGS  climbing on the curtains in your room. Keep in mind, this room is going for $150 a night!! The room is no bigger than a 1010, the wallpaper is peeling off the wall, the baseboards are separating from the wall, the ceiling has patchmarks, paint is literally coming off the walls and the carpet reeks. The second we walked in and took a look around, we went online and looked for another place to stay. To make matters worse, the front desk could care less and still charged us a full night, even though we explained the situation and told them we're leaving. So, we are currently driving an hour away to a much, much nicer hotel. (There is a convention in town near that bug- infested dump,  so everywhere else was fully booked.) We GLADLY jumped in the car to drive away.  Disgusting.I have stayed here in previous year but for the price the facilities are not up to par like they should be........but the staff is courteous and accommodatingThis is a sad excuse for a hotel. Don't let the pictures on their website and descriptions fool you- first of all there is no free continental breakfast, let alone breakfast of any kind at all, no wifi, pool, restaurant, bar, or even an accessible ice machine. Let's just say that I am not picky with hotels, I have staged at some very cheap hotels with not the greatest accommodations, but this is by far the JANKIEST place I have ever set foot in. You walk in to a lobby with caution tape everywhere that you look. A gift shop is on the left, AKA a closet with 3 bags of fun sized chips sitting on a shelf. As you continue walking though the hotel, you realize that literally every accommodation that is advertised on their website is either broken, shut down, or roped off with caution tape. The carpet smells like mold and is peeling off the ground. The pool is drained and has something growing on the bottom of it. The elevator was last inspected in 2013 and smells like urine. The hotel room has the deadbolt literally ripped off of the doorframe.  When my room of 4 people ran out of toilet paper, we asked the front desk if we could have some more and were told that they couldn't provide more toilet paper, so we had to find a closet to get more from. When we tried to call the front desk to ask where the ice machine is, we realized that the phone was merely a decoration and had no cord to the wall. To actually get to the ice machine, you have to limbo under a roped off area of caution tape, walk down a dark hallway on carpet that surely has mold or something else growing on it, and go into the depths of this sketchy excuse for a hotel. Some rooms are missing room number plates and have sharpie written on them instead. Do I need to go on? Save yourself your money and spend it on somewhere else. PS there's literally a White Castle in the parking lot of the Fern Valley.... That's gotta be the biggest red flag ever...I'm a military officer and travel all over the country. It is very frustrating when I stay in a 4 to 5 star hotel and they charge me internet when the less expensive hotel down the road has free internet. I state the previous to really say that this hotel is a 1 or 2 star at best with the WORSE free internet I have ever experienced in my 15 years of traveling around the country. If it wasn't for a huge convention being in town I wound NEVER-EVER stay in this hotel again. Stay away from this hotel if you can if you want good dependable internet.....this hotel ABSOLUTELY sucks when talking about the internet !!!!  14Feb2015....this is an update, above was written couple days ago. I had booked this hotel until the 16th but could not take it anymore and had to change hotels. The experience got worse. The day after above review there was no hot water the next mooring and then the cable went out on television most of the day. I will say to a minor credit to hotel they did reimburse me for one night, but that still does not take away how horrible this hotel is.....i really feel sorry for staff because they are very nice and try to be professional but the hotel itself is just awful. The owners need to wake up and take care of this place.This place is a dump. I do not say that lightly. My room is scary. I'm looking at the floor and there are about 6000 colored stains on the carpet - like gum or the result of a pinata party with red velvet cake. Absolutely disgusting. I'm not going to even think about walking barefoot on this carpet. I haven't yet checked the bed, I'm actually afraid. Stay away, far far away. This place wants $150+ a night which should cover the copay on your trip the emergency room to treat whatever fungus or disease you will pick up by actually spending the night here. If I wasn't so tired I would blow this place and just drive the 4 hours home and demand my money back but now I actually have to brave sleeping in the bed.The folks who manage this place should be ashamed and embarrassed. I feel sorry for the people who work here, they are overworked and have to apologize way too often. Definitely the worst place I have ever stayed.I would say that this place is losing money hand over fist.  Came there for a couple of days for a training class in one of their conference rooms, our company reserved rooms for our attendees. When I arrived the night before I drove around the place looking to see if it was open. Both sides of street looked dead and there were just a few cars. Like only the workers??  I cancelled and stayed elsewhere. The next morning at training I saw the expected. Everywhere you go you smell the carpet, see the disrepair and notice the deferred maintenance. This is a hotel from the sixties or seventies and has not been updated since. This place needs a lot of budget to update throw away items and a team of maintenance to start actually fixing something. Everything looks like a twelve year old has worked on it, they can tear it apart to see what's inside but can't identify problem much less reassemble/fix. Not sure how they pass inspections.First day. Just had the lunch. The lunch is as bad as the rooms. Rosemary chicken, wild rice and green beans. Chicken resembled raw hide chew toys, rice was like plastic filler and the beans were just funky.  Brownie was pretty good.someone pissed on the carpeted elevator 2 days ago and they probably still haven't checked on it.The staff was friendly and they gave me an extremely reasonable deal upon arrival. I had  a great stay and it was an incredible deal.This was my worst hotel stay in memory.  Nasty smelling common areas around a cloudy indoor swimming pool.  Dirty carpets in my room.  4 fire alarms the first night.  Ancient mattress with tired pillows.  It was a complete horror show.  I returned home exhausted with some kind of insect bite on my shoulder.  Never again!We stayed here in Nov. 2014 and I will never stay here again.  The first room we were assigned to the keycard would not work.  Finally got it to work and someone else was already assigned to room.  Next room again keycard would not work and finally got it to work.  Once in the room the toilet had a long black hair on it.  There was mold on the heat and air unit.  The air did not work and has to ask for a fan just to cool room down. Ask for a refrigerator took us 3 refrigerators to finally get one that works.   Beds were not only small but very uncomfortable.  Staff was friendly and said they would give us a discount.  They have us 10.00 off our bill.This is the shittiest hotel I've ever stayed in. Incredibly grungy, no dark curtains to shut out lights that are on ALL NIGHT LONG at the pool, toilet running constantly, sink dripping, no soap or shampoo, gross foam pillows, lumpy bed, etc. It's almost as if the place is going for some kind of shit-tastic trophy. Yuck.My first stay here tonite. Probly not again though. Room is ok. Adequate elec outlets but hidden on wall at bed's headboard! Tv is not so good with very limited channels. Otherwise a pretty good room. Pillows are obviously needing replacement long time ago too. Heater works good, and is cold weather now, so sure needed. Bedding is otherwise pretty good. $165 is a lot for this. Nicer and newer places usually avail for same prices. Big farm show in town, so rooms are scarce. Thos works ok and is close to Atlantic Aviation where our airplane is parked. Wi-fi does not work either.Not a good place to stay. If you have any other option go for it. Room has everything broken from TV to restroom sink. I was too tired to call at 2 AM so had to crash there anyway. But if you have option, find another hotel to stay.The hotel that renovation time forgot.  Lobby smelled like a sewer.  Garbage overflowing in bathrooms.   Conference room was so hot and no one took any action to cool the place down...people were leaving. Automatic doors broke,  shower drain not working...stood in a foot of water during my shower.  Fire alarms kept going off, electrical wires hanging out of wall,  checked in to a blatantly dirty room,  no electricity in replacement room.....  dont stay here.
review_content_20: I like this hotel very clean they offer free WI-FI ,has a swimming pool, flat screen television for those of you that have gaming systems such as myself who knows how important that is LOL. and is nicely priced for the amenities and level of service you receive I would definitely recommend this hotel.THIS PLACE IS A DUMP! Funny thing is - at the checkout counter they encourage you to visit yelp and rate their facility. I feel like this is the Bates Hotel. I grew up in Louisville and rememeber company parties at this site - when it was a Holiday Inn. The sayig holds true - you get what you pay for. But heck at least at the Super 8 or Motel 6 they invest to make their property look appealing. I am checking out tomorrow and CANT WAIT! The location is ideal to airport and lots of restaurants, but until the owners invest in this properey ......ewww!The staff ws pleasant and I made my reservations via Hotels.com...... they lied!!!! Gave this hotel 3 stars. If I could have went below one star I would have. I don't consider myself overly sensitive but this place is icky!No no no no!!!!! Don't stay here!!!!!!I called the hotel an hour before I got there and they still gave me a great deal on a set of 3 rooms that we needed for one night. The parking lot was huge and big enough for our 5 commercial trailers to be parked there for the night. Great food Great serviceGreat priceWe attended a conference at this hotel where the reservation had been made for us. We checked in late and found the night staff to be a bit over-bearing...like we were children who'd never entered a hotel before and we had to have everything explained to us in great detail...when all we wanted was to pay, get our keys, and go to bed. There is one elevator for the place and God forbid if your room is on the opposite end. We had to walk the entire upper circumfrance of the hotel to get to our room that was...right above the front desk. The man who insisted on walking us around talked down to us and reaked of cigarette smoke, which did nothing to help my allergies.However...the room was fine. The bed was big and comfortable and the shower was very hot and accommodating. We did have to make several requests for toilet paper refills. The bar was simple and have standard fare like burgers, chicken tenders, skins, sandwiches...which were good. Our bartender was fantastic...very friendly and took care of us with quick service. Too bad they didn't offer music or a DJ or karaoke.It's an older place that looks like it was a Holiday Inn in a previous life. It worked just fine for our purposes, but I don't think I'd purposely go back. The pool was like bath water and it was filled with about 20 screaming kids. That's not the hotel's fault...but there was an employee keeping watch over the pool and he allowed tremendous horse play and running...someone could have gotten hurt. Oh...and it's not a hot tub...it's a luke warm tub, but the jets in it kick tailfeathers!This place was horrible. We went on a 3 1/2 week cross country trip and this was the worst hotel of the whole trip. I booked it because of the cheap price and it was not worth it even then. It was in a questionable part of town, the front desk people sat on the phone while i stood there and didn't even address me, they also MESSED UP billing me and checking me in, and somehow it took 3 people to fix the problem.
