The place was dirty and i didn't feel comfortable walking in bare feet. And the elevator was terrifying. It made horrible noises and swayed and even got stuck! Don't get a room here!! Go on hotels.com or hotwire.com or something and pay the extra 10 or 20 bucks and get something decent!!Possibly the WORST hotel I have ever stayed in. Do NOT stay here. Heed my warning and the cautionary tales of other travelers, or you too, will be adding your rant on this Hotel profile.Hands down the worst hotel I've ever had the opportunity to stay in. Found it on Hotels.com for almost $70 a night....probably should have been more appropriately priced at $25 a night. If I had not pre-paid I would have left immediately.To begin, its not in what seems like the safest part of town. I am not from Louisville, so I admit I am making an assumption, but the general area seemed to be less than inviting. The desk clerk, although very nice, didn't seem to have a firm grasp on what he was doing. There seemed to be a lot of 'sketchy' characters loitering around the building. The room we had was fairly close to the pool, which was full of screaming children, even at 10:30 pm when we checked in. The pool, probably due to the insane amount of children, seemed dirty and not very sanitary. There was food all over the ground of the pool area, and in general the entire place had a smell that was just a little off. The room sort of stank of old urine...the toilet paper roll in the bathroom was half used, and hadn't even been changed. The mattress had what looked like a huge blood stain on it. We ended up just sleeping on top of the comforter. I probably could go on for ages, but I'm sure anyone whose read this far gets the idea. I would have rather just slept in the car or drove straight through. If I could give negative points I would.

hotel_name: Crowne Plaza Louisville Airport Expo Ctr
review_content: I stayed here for a business convention a few months back. The location was perfect for the areas I needed to be in. But the real reason for my review is the customer service. I had a leaking water noise coming from the ceiling in the corner of the room. It made noise throughout the entire night. I called Maintenance and they said they would send someone to look later the next day. OK, sounds good I thought.Then the room service girl brought my breakfast in. She asked how my stay was, and if there was anything I needed. I joked about the water noise and how I had called Maintenance. I don't quite know what she did. I didn't take it for more than just small talk. 30 minutes later, Maintenance was at my door. It was a surprise, and I know it was because of the conversation with the room service girl. I appreciate it when people go out of their way.We're in Louisville every February for a show at the KEC, and since the rates were cheaper here this year, we decided it give it a chance. Rooms were clean, the bed was comfortable, but over a five-night period, I was awoken three times at 4am each morning with yelling in the hallway and the slamming of doors.Also, after checking out about 8am and driving over ten hours towards home, I remembered I left my iPhone charger plugged into the wall of our room. I immediately called the hotel and had someone at the front desk check with housekeeping to retrieve it for me. To no surprise, they didn't see it. I guess it's 'finders keepers' with the maids at this establishment. I know it's my fault, but have they never heard of a 'lost & found'? Highly disappointed and we definitely won't be returning next year.Huge disappointment. I heard the area was shady but took a chance. Well when I got to my room and the door was repaired where it had previously had the deadbolt busted I knew I didn't want to stay!  One elevator wasn't working and the other one was screeching and most of the buttons were busted for the floors. Very dated decor. Canceled right away!!!!For the price I certainly expected more.Probably one of the best airport hotels I've stayed at.  Super close and convenient to SDF...one right turn and you're headed to the airport.  The rooms are immaculate, the beds are super cozy, the staff is very very friendly and helpful and the restaurant is convenient.  I would say the only downside is lack of free coffee or continental breakfast in the mornings and as always, the room coffee isn't worth the bother.  They were very accomodating as "Snowmageddon 2016" approached and the room rates were awesome!  I definetly recommend it!My husband and I got one of the "executive" first floor rooms that opened up to the big conference or exhibit room. It's weird - and makes for a dark room.  I would rather be on the 7th or 8th floor.Kids were here for a YMCA event. LOTS of noise all around us.Eventually noise in the exhibit room stopped only to have the hotel crew take down (and at 6am set up) tables for the next day. But my biggest complaint being adjacent to this space is that the lights were on in that large room all night and the curtains are hung away from the wall so you can't block it out. We'll I suppose I could have taped it close! Perhaps it would cut down on noise, light, and traffic (if management was concerned about our complaints) if they would turn out the lights and lock the doors at a reasonable hour (like 11pm)?The walls ARE paper thing, we hear talking coming in from all four sides -- next door, in the hall way, and in the conference room - even when the kids aren't yelling. I can concur with the fact there is no refrigerator in the executive suite. REALLY?  But I found out small refrigerators are in other rooms.And right from the beginning ...both hotel vans were parked under the portico (nice and dry) while the guest were left to unload their cars in the rain.  Perhaps the vans could stay on the far side and not be parked on both sides of the entrance?And don't look for a "do-it-yourself" luggage cart because they only have 1 "for rent" and it was in use. And I only know that because the bell hop did not come out to greet us so I had to go looking for help. So if you need a luggage cart, the bell hop has them locked in their storage area. With a property this large, I guess the carts really do go missing.The positives: the king bed was VERY comfortable, wi-fi is not an extra, the room was clean, there was a coffee maker, a lighted make-up mirror, and the TV worked. The restaurant was a nice retreat from the kids. Food was ok.These are a lot of complaints for $169 per night. I MIGHT come here again only if I get a room on a top floor.I was here for a company gathering. The ballrooms were using were clean, and the staff bussing the tables/dealing with the food were pleasant and cleared dishes and this away quickly. The food was good, I was at the front of the line, so it was fresh and hot. The drinks were expensive. I knew to expect this a bit, but it was still a bit high for the limited bar that was available.I can only comment on the conference/exhibit area. My employer held a very nice reception here for recent graduates. There are huge chandeliers hanging from the ceiling and as far as I could tell everything else was very nicely cared for (tables, walls, etc). The food was alright, I wouldn't say phenomenal, but what I ate was good. Fresh fruit was awesome! The wait staff seemed to be very accommodating, I requested coffee and the waiter came back with a carafe and cleared our tables promptly.The great thing about this hotel is that it's literally right at the airport.  It's an enormous property with something like 600+ rooms.  Normally with a hotel so large it's hard to pay attention to the small things, but not here.The rooms are clean but a bit outdated and the hotel should definitely consider some modernization.  The outside of the hotel is more impressive than the inside.   I think it doubles as a conference center so it's almost always busy.  They offer a shuttle service to the airport as well.  Unlike some Crowne Plaza locations, this one doesn't have an executive lounge.For a quick overnight stay this hotel was fine.  If I were staying for a longer period of time, I'd pick a hotel in a more fun area with more modern rooms.This is not a bad hotel, but for me it's always a comedy of little things that make a stay unpleasant or annoying. *Took 20 minutes to check in-on person working front desk on a Saturday afternoon. *Shower not functioning in room, but managed to jury-rig it-had to scramble to get ready for meeting. *There are no lock boxes in the rooms, at least in mine-not wanting to tote my laptop around all day, I just risked it, putting it in my large suitcase. *Pool in center of hotel courtyard open late-screaming kids not conducive to getting work done. *The walls and floors are paper thin-I heard kids and people yelling until about 1 a.m. and I could hear every door on my floor slam all night long. (I can normally sleep through anything, but this place is loud.)*CFL lighting makes the room dingy and sort of depressing, and, the whole place could use a refresh, as it is quite dated.*The whole hotel smells like a cheap car air freshener. Long story short-not a hotel geared toward business travelers, in my opinion, and not totally on top of its game. That said it is a stone's throw away from airport and conventions center, making it awfully convenient. Also, at around $120/night, it's certainly affordable.Room was clean and very nice. The only issue we had was the a/c didn't work. Tried to call the desk and kept getting busy signal. Went down to desk and a maintenance person was sent to the room and repaired a/c. This is the 3rd time I have stayed here and I will come backSee that picture below?  Yeah, that's the view from my room.  No, really, my room looks out into the exhibit hall.But, hey, there are pros and cons to this arrangement.Pros:* If you're an exhibitionist or ever wanted to be one of those gals in the windows in the red light district, well, there you go.* If you're not planning to be in your room a lot and want to get some sleep, this room is great.  It's dark, it's quiet, and as long as you leave the drapes closed, it's almost like your own private cave.Cons:* Well, it looks out on the exhibit hall* It's dark and actually quite depressing if you're just sitting in there on a nice sunny day.  I will say that the dark and depressing actually motivated me to go out at night, which is a good thing.  So should this be a pro?  I don't know.The thing that makes this place 4 stars is the service.  Actually the service makes it 5 stars but the exhibit hall view takes it down a notch.  Everyone that I encountered over the duration of my stay bent over backwards to make sure that I had everything I could ever need.  Everyone kept a smile and a great attitude too, even though it was a crazy Derby weekend.  I was seriously impressed.  That alone would prompt me to return.  It also doesn't hurt that this place is super close to the airport, convention center and Churchill Downs.  I didn't sit in any insane traffic like I expected.I really enjoyed my stay at this Crowne Plaza, way more than expected.  I'll definitely be back the next time...just maybe in a room where I can open the curtains.One star, and that's for the plants in the gym to liven up the place. Decent food I hear. But my room tv was completely not functioning. How am I suppose to fall asleep while watching my programs? Fuck. Oh and I better not get bed bugs, Kentucky.I'll have to say this was a step down from the Crown Plaza in Jacksonville. I'll have to say that the front desk was very stuffy & not apologetic for my bad nights sleep. My room smelled of mildew and the heater was so loud that it kept waking me up.I do have to say, I was rather surprised by the overall three star rating for this place.  My experience was four star fo sho.So I was meeting my brother for Lebowski Fest and regrettably, we were only able to stay for one night of it.  COMPLETELY his fault, as he had to keep repeating to people we encountered the entire time we were there.  Historically, when in town for Lebowski Fest, I've only ever stayed at the Courtyard Marriott across the street.  My brother had taken his bar exam at the Crowne Plaza a year ago so had some familiarity with the place.  I had left the booking of the hotel room up to him for this trip, and the Crowne Plaza was his choice.  I arrived at about 5:15pm Friday night.  The first thing I noticed (after scoping out the Lebowski Fest pre-party scene in the parking lot of the Executive Strike and Spare across the street) was that the parking lot was PACKED.  Could these all be fellow Achievers (??), I wondered aloud.I finally found a parking space and then had to haul all of my $h!t (and there was a lot of it) inside.  I staggered into the lobby and up to a check in counter.  I had to make prior arrangements via email with a very helpful lady since the reservation was in my brother's name and I knew I'd be arriving before him and wanted to be able to get into the room right away so I could begin assembling my Lebowski Fest costume.  Check in itself was rather quick and painless, though there was an awkward moment when I noticed the fellow checking in beside me was given a parking pass for his car and the woman checking me in didn't say anything about it.  I then said to her "Do I need anything for my car?"  "Oh, you have a car?" she asked, incredulously.  "Nah," I thought to myself sarcastically, "I rolled out of an airplane carrying a giant sized plastic bag full of toiletries, among all of these other completely impractical things." So I got my vehicle pass (didn't put it in the car until later) and dragged my crap into an elevator where I rode up to the 6th floor.  After dumping said crap in the room, I immediately grabbed the ice bucket and my little cooler and strolled down to the ice machine so I could get my Stella cooling on the rocks ASAP.  I noticed a curious paper taped outside of one of the doors to a room.  I tried to read it, but it was a bunch of weird, scientific words that made zero sense to me.  Interesting, I thought, but continued on.  As we later found out, they were having some sort of tropical fish convention (guess that explained all of the cars in the parking lot) and people were advertising the fish they had outside of their doors.  Anyway.  So the room itself was very nice.  I don't think I took any pictures of it or anything else besides my costume, of which I will spare you the sight.  We had the standard two queens.  The bathroom had that awesome setup with the two sinks, one inside where the shower and terlet are and one outside.  We overlooked the airport and part of the parking lot so I was able to both watch planes land (I'm terrified of flying and airplanes in general) and see if any parking spots opened that I could direct my brother to upon his arrival.  That actually came in quite handy as he parked quite literally, in a space right below our window.  When my brother arrived, we lounged comfortably in the room drinking our beers and watching YouTube videos on my laptop, thanks to the free wifi.  Oh, the code was given to me at the front desk when I checked in.  We arrived back in the room after the Fest at about 1am, promptly fell asleep and didn't wake up until like 9:30am.  Nice beds.  My brother was not a fan of the pillows though.  I can't comment on the shower since my plans to utilize it completely fell through due to obscene laziness.  I'd hauled that huge shopping bag loaded with shower goods all the way to Kentucky for nothing.  Overall, according to my brother, the rate was the same here as it was the Courtyard Marriott but this definitely felt like a nicer hotel, not just a stop-through place to lay our heads.  I just might decide to stay here again when in Louisville for Lebowski Fest next time.  In the past they've offered a discounted rate for Achievers, which is awesome.  I don't know if they did this year and if so, if my brother took advantage of it.I was in on the remodel a few years ago and was pretty much in every room redoing the cable...... So when the lady and I decided to stay in Louisville after the concert at freedom hall we picked this place..... And it sucked. There wasn't a single working vending machine on our floor or the 3 above it.... No fridge in the room.... And the staff was extremely rude. Absolutely not worth 150 bucks a night.We stay at this Crowne Plaza every year for Lebowskifest, as it's right across the street from the venue.  The group rate is very reasonable, and the rooms are overall very nice.I've seen some complain about the quality of the rooms, but so far, I have yet to find a room that isn't clean and in relatively good shape.  The beds are comfortable, the shower has good pressure, and the rooms are quiet.  Another bonus is that the free in-room wifi is actually fast, which is nice for a change!The only downsides are the severe lack of elevators and the room keys.  If you're on a top floor, you can expect it to take nearly 5 minutes to call an elevator and make it to the top.  Just one more elevator off the lobby would solve this issue.  As for the keys, the keyreader for our room this year and last year was very unreliable, as were the key cards, which seem to get too easily wiped.  I had to request several sets of room keys over the weekend, which was annoying.All in all, this Crowne Plaza is a nice place to stay, and is certainly a decent place for the money.We've stayed here every two years for ICUEE trade show and it is always a little old and worn. They try to update it periodically and seem to have done a good job this last update.Room is comfortable and the bed is very nice.They have been extremely friendly and accommodated any reasonable request.Kind of pricey, though, for the age of the property.My sister and I came yesterday. She has a Nursing Classic here today.  When she checked in, in the midst of TONS and I mean TONS of LARGE white Huskys (YES DOGS), they were very kind and told her they had a suite available.  She discussed she didn't book a suite. They said oh it's a very nice room. Same price (?), you'll love it.  So it was a nice large two room suite.   We dropped our bags off and immediately went to dinner.  Well, needless to say, the food was good, service quite slow, but we didn't mind.  Time to chat,  etc.  AND for anyone who knows me, I'm a dog lover.   Two fur babies of my own, but as we were sitting in the dining room, a lady with 3 of those large dogs, proceeds to walk them  through the middle of the dining room.  They were not quite under control as she was tangled in the leashes.  One of the dogs stopped at another table of people.  One patron said something good to the lady and I overheard her say, she was told she could come through the dining room.  One gentleman at the table where the dog stopped said something and the other one said, oh it's OK as long as he doesn't try to sniff my ___.   There was a service dog in the dining room as well, but it was well behaved and layer under the table.  But as I said, love my babies but dogs have no place in a public dining room in a hotel that LOOKS LIKE THIS ONE (FROM THE OUTSIDE).  SO, dinner is over and we walk back to our room and my eyes had been burning and we're red from the time I came in here.  We noticed I need the halls such a STRONG  odor of someth in no like cheapy air fresheners.  Plus, our floor had fans running in several places.  We get to our room, I jump in the shower and when I get out I hear these LOUD BARKING and HOWLING DOGS.  they were across the hall and on both sides of us.  My sister had a class and was NOT going to be able to sleep with that noise.  So, she tried to call downstairs. It rang over 50 times before they finally answered.  She explained and they said we should've been placed on another floor.  Yet, that wasn't our fault.  They decide where you go and they could see we DIDN'T have a Big White Dog!   They offered to move us but said that's all they could do.  I called back to say yes, we need to move if we want sleep.  She said they would do that and so kindly said there WOULDN'T BE A PENALTY CHARGED FOR MOVING.   I said oh there won't be a penalty.  We came upstairs waited for the security guard to bring our keys (he walked up and said, here. As he handed the keys. Never offered to help with our bags etc.  We come into a suite.  And OMG....DEBATED WHETHER TO LEAVE OR TRY TO BE CAREFUL AND STAY IN THE UNCLEANINESS!  YOU COULDN'T sit in the chairs at the table. They looked as if someone had not been able to make it to the restroom...or chocolate syrup had been poured on them.  The sofa had strange looking stains that resembled other bodily fluids. The carpet was filthy with sections cut out and replaces and the door to the balcony had just a raw piece of wood nailed to the bottom.  It was 10 pm by this time.  We were tired of dealing with the stuff.  My sister wanted to lrave.  I was worried about her sleep because of the class.  We decided on staying. So, we walked around with our shoes on.  I MUST COMMEND THE MANAGER ON DUTY THIS MORNING FOR SHOWING SUCH POLITENESS AND GIVING US A DISCOUNT.So A bunch of us got together and put on a CON called Imaginarium. On Sat night ball room C was rented for a party, of course the hotel came in with their "cash bar".Once a guy seen I and several others had our own drinks we were approached and was told that unless we bought their alcohol we had to take ours out and drink in the hallway or anywhere else but that ballroom because it was a "liability". All bull sh*t of course. So we, and we as in 15 of us abandoned the room to move to the hallway just outside the door and proceeded to open bar for the whole party.  Next year i'm bringing  70 bottles with me. Wow. Whats next? No sex in the rooms unless we buy the condoms, K.Y. and toys from you?Very displeased about this. We as a whole spent ALOT of money on/at your hotel. Next year i'll make sure to book a room across the street and walk over to work the convention.Not to mention I open the curtain of my room window and all there is there? A stupid wall with a drain pipe.  No view,  had there been a fire it says to break window and get on ledge? What ledge?  Trapped is what I would of been!. I will be posting this review in every place I can.I booked a room here because it was the official hotel of Lebowski Fest.  The hotel was also hosting the American Cichlid Association National Convention.In case you were wondering, a cichilid is a fish that you put in fresh water aquariums.  There were actually aquariums set up in people's rooms and they were selling fish out of them.  Strange does not even begin to describe the atmosphere.The room was okay, especially for only $89 per night.  The hotel could have been a lot cleaner.  There were crumbs all over the hallway.Or maybe that was fish food?
review_content_20: Really not a bad hotel.  We used Hotwire to order & I was a bit skeptical after reading the reviews about the dog show guests.  Prior to arrival, I did call the hotel to voice my concerns and Michael assured me that he would change our room to ensure that we were not in the same vincinity as the dog show guest.  Upon arrival, the checkin was helpful and professional.  The reasoning behind the 4-star rating is just due to the dated decor in the hotel.  The room was very clean and we slept very well.  We drank the coffee which was pretty good.  Parking was a mess, mainly because this is a large hotel.The bed was ok. The lobby is nice. The people were friendly. The price was ok. I would go back.If you like having your sleep interrupted, this is the hotel for you! We stayed there three nights, and were woken up every night. If you do have to stay here, make sure they don't put you anywhere near the elevators, as drunken morons will be sure to wake you up at 3am. That and a 2am fire alarm the cleared the hotel sealed the deal. Other than the noise, not a bad place. The rooms are fine, no bedbugs, no ghosts...I'd just avoid those elevators, maybe the whole ground floor.Needs some updating but was overall a good stay. It was on the expensive side but I believe it was because the FFA conference was in town. The hotel was very busy. The breakfast was worth the money. Would stay their again if it cost less.this hotel is clean and busy!  although the staff isn't very personable and not as friendly as other Crowne Plaza's in other states.  it's almost as if the Louisville location doesn't have enough staff to accommodate the volume of. Guest they have!     But , over all the rooms are nice and I can  rely on that!  RESTAURANT bar only had one waitress and not enough time to wait on everyone in the bar!1 mile from the airport.Cute, detailed rooms. Comfortable beds. Cush chairs. Subtle decor.Hot headboards. Spacious desk area. Plenty O space Rooms.Friendly Staff.Good stuff. One of my favorite chains, and POW BAM BOOM in one of my favorite cities.Did I mention the free wifi?Double like.Friendly staff. Even though it's located across the freeway from the airport -- which is super-convenient -- they've maintained that Louisville charm that so many of the downtown hotels have. Nice IHG Rewards Club benefits. Enjoyed the in-room 3-step #Relaxation spa amenities. I almost ranked 3-stars bc the bed linens had a weird rubbery texture and the hallways need a spruced-up makeover. Next time I'll book a later return flight so I can try their Sunday breakfast buffet. Sounded delish!Very nice hotel. This is like a 3.5 hotel close to 4. Huge king size bed. Some rooms like mines have a 47in flat screen tv. There is a nice pool and pretty nice fitness gym.It is minutes away from airport. 20 mins from train station and on a bus route.Right now they having a dog show in conference room of the hotel. Watching dogs no bigger than 6 inches high strutting around head high, walking around jumping over things for prizes. Was a funny sight to seeThe 6 flags amusement park is about 10 mins from here. A host of museums if you like history and fine arts. Not much of a night life from what I am told unless you wish to roll down in the hood. But I am sure somewhere you can find a good time. I am here for a bowling tournament so night life entertainment was not my focus. But over all this is a nice hotel to be inHotel is nice and in a good location. Customer service needs improvement.  Waited in line for check in, the lady gave me the wrong room (one that was occupied) after hauling my stuff back down to the desk, I waited in line again.  No apology, nothing.    Later that night while eating at the blue horse, I found it nearly impossible to get service.  All in all the trend was lack of customer service.Decent place! Our room was clean, the heat worked, but was scary loud when it kicked on. It reminded me of the furnace from the basement in Home Alone.Each bed came with four pillows - That's Right!! 4! And not just those stupid decorative pillows, either. I'm not even counting that one. The bathroom was nice because it had a separate sink and mirror from the toilet and shower. One thing I disliked - why is the air so dry?? Not sure that had anything to do with the hotel operations, but dang.I'd stay here again.Great convenient location. Have stayed here before. There was a gas main break on the street the hotel is on and we couldn't get to it for hours. When I finally got in, even though it wasn't their fault, they gave me a discount on the room. The only down side is the hotel bar. It closes early, even when it's packed and the manager is really rude.Five stars. Room exquisite, clean and quiet, a feat as it was Derby week. Staff oozing Southern Charm. Head Chef Paul is #1-he assisted me in the evening to locate my lost package for an event the next day. Hat shop "Hey Lady!" was wonderful their staff too was terrific. Best filet in memory at the Blue Horse Restaurant too. Please don't hesitate to book your next event/room at this jewel near Louisville Airport!The Crowne Plaza is a well-used hotel.  You'll find imperfections on the walls, fixtures loose in your room and noises coming from the ceiling and walls in some areas of the hotel.  The hotel itself is fairly clean, but it definitely is in need of large-scale renovations.  The staff, however, is pleasant to deal with and generally helpful.The hotel does accommodate many professional events through several of its large conference rooms and dining areas.  The indoor/outdoor pool is nice.The hotel itself is pretty typical Crowne Plaza. What I really liked about it was the customer service and staff. Very willing to please, sincerely polite, and ready to go the extra mile to make a stay special.Room was nice and clean. Bathroom was nicely kept up. Very convenient to the airport, just a few minutes away. Relatively quiet, but being this close to the airport you have to expect some noise. Wifi speed was good, and complimentary. Bartender was great albeit a little overwhelmed with little to no help. Chicken sandwich was ok, and the prices were good.Nicely decorated, loud hotel within a 5 minute shuttle ride from the airport, and located next to the Fairgrounds. This Crowne Plaza offers a) no refrigerator in room without request b) microwaves only next to some vending/ice machines c) no lock boxes in the rooms, and d) no hot tub. They boast of a shuttle anywhere "within 3 miles" yet even though scheduled an hour ahead to get to a yoga class, and after receiving a friendly "see you then", once I arrived to the lobby, another driver refused transport due to a group movement to/from the fairgrounds. The women's stretching room rug is worn and dirty. Think carefully and choose more wisely, my friends.I hate this hotel with a passion.  It feels so dark, and secluded, and just weird.  I've been here at least a dozen times and hated every moment.  The beds are comfortable, and the rooms are clean.  It just has a weird vibe that I don't like.  And it's an epic-freaking-journey to get to the higher floors (which I invariably always get put on).  Half the time my room key doesn't work and they rarely apologize when I make the Tolkien-style journey back to the front desk to get it fixed.  Oh well, there are still plenty of worse properties to stay at.Room is nice and everything's clean, but I can't help but feel it lacks a lot of amenities for a more 'upscale' hotel. No refrigerator, for example, was a bit unexpected- not to mention our rooms were ready about half an hour late. The beds are comfortable and the staff is friendly, so that's a plus.It's a good hotel for short stays, but the lack of useful amenities is disappointing, and makes it a lot less appealing to anyone looking to hole up somewhere for a while.Writing this post bright and early since the lawn clean up crew has been working for about an hour now outside my window. What's the point of putting up the sleep do not disturb sign on the door when this happens. And when I called the front desk a rude lady named Kim said..."oh is there a leaf blower outside your window?...is he waking u up?..." DUH and they she says..."yea they have to get that done there on a schedule" SAY WHAT! Yea they have to get it done but not in the morning! Rooms are mid level at best, food was bad last night...never again.The wife and I stayed here when moving her from Louisville to Raleigh, NC. The fact that it happened to be Derby weekend was an unfortunate coincidence.That said, it was a great stay.The bed was really comfy, and it was decent-sized bathroom. We were only there one night, so I can't really speak to cleaning service, but even booking at the last minute, the room was clean and well taken care of. Free internet - it was fairly fast and reliable, and we ended up watching a few things on Netflix without issue. Such a welcome difference from the "higher end" hotels that attempt to anally rape you for internet service. *coughHiltoncough*No fridge, microwave, or other amenities, but it was a great place to sleep before driving for 10 hours the next day. The kids that were running all over the place weren't actually heard in the room, so that was nice. Good experience here, and I'd recommend it for others.
review_content_40: Really nice rooms. The view in room 213 is a breathtaking vista of a/c units on a roof. The pool is super awesome and large. There are a bunch of conference and banquet rooms for various events. No laundry facility on site, but there is a decent laundromat about one mile away on Preston. $150 bucks a night.Decent hotel with all of the basics you'd need while traveling. The heating unit comes on with a big clank, but other than that it was fine.This hotel has the Most ridiculous customer service.i stayed there for literary 10 hrs for one night, they charged me for 2 nights, and when I called, they put me on hold for more than 10 minutes. Eventually I called from another phone and someone picked up and told me the manager was not there, I have to call again to fix the deal. When I asked for slippers during the stay, they were surprised like hotels are not supposed to have slippers for customers. There's no late check out neither.  Worst hotel experience ever, of all the hotels I been to, this one is shitty, customer service is shitty.I assume they get most of their business by being near the airport.  I don't see any other good reason to be there.  The internet was free but did not really work.  It kept dropping off and on every minute and I gave up after being frustrated for a bit.  In this day and age, if you can't offer a decent internet connection, that's just poor service / infrastructure.  I won't be staying here next time.This hotel has a lot of great things to offer. 1) location is great, easy access to highway and close to expo center 2) great pool staffed w / lifeguards! 3) good buffet especially for kids 4.95$ price! Now the disappointing things are things that make an enjoyable hotel experience! Accessible Internet access. They stated that it was free but in my room it was spotty and only could access near the door but who wants to stand at the door to use wi-fi. Another disappointing thing was the plumbing above us was super loud!!!! I thought there was a flood above us because I heard so much gushing water and very frequently!  It woke me up about 4x throughout the night and I worried that I was going to wake up in a puddle of water in my bed ;( couldn't enjoy my night due to water!!! Don't stay in room 159 this had many bad experiences especially paying $200 a night for a room:(Having the fire/smoke alarm go off while you're in the shower is not fun. A person at the front desk called as I was exiting the room and asked, "were you taking a shower". She then explained that the humidity was too much and set the alarm off. It took over 10 minutes for the security guard / maintenance staff to disengage the alarm. I called the front desk to ask if it would go off again, as I was going to finish showering, she said, "it shouldn't since I re-set the alarm".Of course, it went off again. I called the front desk and another representative answered the phone. I asked him if he was sending the same guy to repair and he said, "if you'd like me to, yes".This time, and actual maintenance person came to explain the issue. At the conclusion, he asked if I left the bathroom door open when I showered and I stated I did. He then asked if I would be staying another night he would fix it. I assured him, I'd never be staying at that property again. I posed a question to him: why fix it now? Apparently, this is a known issue since the front desk person knew what set the alarm off. I told the maintenance employee he might want to "fix it" so the next guest wouldn't have to go through the same thing.I've stayed at your property before, but this was the last stay. Having the alarm go off is one thing, but the response was not ok.It is, however, a great looking property.Here are the things I like about the Crowne Plaza Hotel:Centrally located near the freeway.Respectful and efficient staff.Even at its busiest, there is still parking.Great dining options near by.Clean and classy without being pretentious.While all I require of a hotel is little more than shelter from inclement weather and smile when I check in from the lonely night. The decor reminds me of the hotel the Ghostbusters first found slimer in during the first movie. So... yah... bad ass.The staff is super friendly and is not comprised of unhelpful parrots that only give you one of the 3 answers they are trained to when asked a question. On more than one occasion staff has thought outside the box to help me with a request. Big plus in my book. There is free wi-fi, however no refrigerator. The rooms were exceptionally clean. There is a restaurant attached, which I have reviewed separately however I will mention that if you decide to order in; walk down to it and order from the hostess and not the bar. Most of the times I have been there the bartender seems over tasked all the times I've been there and had much greater success with the hostess. Overall, this hotel comes with my recommendations.This is the site that the American Board of Radiology uses for its oral examinations...  The scent of adrenaline permeates the dark hallways palpably for those days.  Both the Executive and Executive West will be undergoing rennovations... but the kind of sprawled out layout really recalls a different era of American History.If I didn't have to go here every 10 years, I might like it more.  As it is, it's an indelible memory of hotel stress.  :)If you like hard mattresses and foam pillows this is the hotel for you, I don't.Pros: awesome beds super cold A/C nice front desk staff clean free wi-fi close to the Strike & Spare bowling alley Cons: no continental breakfast $10 grilled cheese half a roll of toilet paper in our room no refrigerator$110 a nightOverall: Too expensive for what was lackingAll you need to know is this: BED BUGSI have stayed here twice in the last month.  The place is okay, not great.  There are other hotels on the same street that may be worth a shot.  I expect more from a Crowne Plaza.  Their hotel here is drab, old, and dreary.  It needs a major makeover.  The worst part about this place is the Internet.  The hotel is wireless and it is awful.  If you are able to get a connection, good luck finding any available bandwidth or being able to stay connected.  These hotels needs to beef up their internet connections!Food is no where to be found near the hotel, except in the restaurant.  I will say the hotel restaurant had excellent food!  It made the stay bearable.This hotel has been renovated and it's real nice. I know some people who have stayed here way back when and they say it's changed a lot. The room is clean with FREE wireless. So a star for that. No fridge though. The price is under a hundred bucks but the company paid for it and maybe they got a good discount. I'm not sure what the normal rates are. The parking lot is a pretty good size. They seem to have a bunch of meetings and conventions here. There were a few downstairs. I'll check out the pool and the gym tomorrow. GVERY EXPENSIVE !  for what you get, which is no more than a nice Holiday Inn.  The only advantage for me was it was right across the road to the fairgrounds for the NSRA street rod nationals .Very nice hotel, but the thing that gave this one 5 stars was the excellent service.  After a long day it was really nice to experience it.   Even though the hotel is next to the highway and airport it is extremely quiet.   WIll stay there again..First, allow me to apologize for this review. It's going to be very, very, very long. I have only been to Louisville once in my life so far, and I was traveling there in July of 2007 for the amazing and exciting Lebowskifest. If you've never heard of this Lebowskifest, then please do Google it, and get with the program, man. So, for the Lebowskifest, the festival's hotel was The Executive West. It's very close to the airport, so that's a plus. Looks like a really nice place from the outside, but without looking like a cookie-cutter, modern McChain-Hotel. This place is old school, and I hate to use that term because even though "Yo-MTV Raps" was a great show, the term old school has been raped by overuse. The interior decor of this building is rather attractive, even though it's dated as hell. Lots of wood paneling, old furniture, and ancient wallpaper. I think there has obviously been a few construction expansions in the history of this building because this place is huge, and it can take quite awhile to walk around inside the halls just to get to your room. There's a pool, and a gym, but you may get enough exercised just getting to and from your room. The outdoor pool area was beautiful, and it had a cool fountain/statue thingy out there, as well as a bar. I discovered one little hallway that faced the outdoor pool, and there was a long row of rocking chairs lined up so you could sit down inside the air conditioning and watch the people in the pool through large windows. Pretty neat I thought. This hotel is overpopulated with a very rare wild animal, a wild animal that once inhabited many American homes and hotels, but has since been killed off by modernists. This animal is the classic American rocking chair, complete with seat pad. Seriously, these are the best chairs known to human butt-kind, and they were everywhere. We had one in our room, and it was lovely. Staff was very friendly and efficient in their business. The room was great, cold air, comfy beds, little desk, high speed wireless, so even though it looks old school, (my sister and I kept joking that our Grandma was charged with decorating the rooms and interior of the hotel), it has modern amenities. There was also a very noticeable smell inside the hotel. Smelled like water damaged carpets to a certain extent, or mold probably. I didn't think it smelled bad, but I did notice it. I kept looking for the high water mark on the walls where the flood waters must have been some years ago, but I think the smell was a combination of old carpets and wallpapers, old furniture, and possibly an overzealous carpet shampooing schedule by the hotel staff that leaves a musty, damp tinge to the air. Whatever, it's great, it smelled like old people in there. As if my grandparents were all alive again, and sitting around smoking their Camel cigarettes. Have you ever seen, "Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas," with Johnny Depp? If you have, just imagine the scenes of him when he's running through those old Las Vegas hotels with their kooky carpet and mirrored walls, it's a step back in time, and I felt like I was Hunter S. Thompson himself, (Louisville born and bred), stalking the long forgotten hallways of the American Classic with a can of beer, and on a quest for some pot and a good story.THE KEETHI stay at the West often. It is like a home away from home and the friendly staff makes traveling easier. It has been recently remodeled and tragically the crown molding in the rooms has been painted. There is a pool, workout room, bar and dining on property.

review_content: What a beautiful hotel and fantastic staff! The bar and waterfall downstairs aren't too shabby as well! The rooms are accommodating and beautiful. Perfect for a staycation! And this hotel is near everything you could ever want to do or anywhere you could want to go while visiting downtown! Brendon's Catch 23 is next door and will blow you out of the water!!! Meta is a few blocks over along with 8Up! And you can even cross the street to hop into the Seelbach hotel to look at the beautiful chandeliers! All in all... I would stay here again!I loved my stay at the Hyatt here!! The room's have been completely remodeled and the people here are really nice. There are lots of really nice restaurants near by and I tried Sway for the first time that was really tasty. I just wish there were more elevators.Nice looking - close to shops and downtown. Rather large and inexpensive.... No fridge in room , both sides were adjoining rooms, they charge by the half hour to use the computer and or printer, pool closes early. Fix those issues and two more stars here we come.I was in Louisville for an event and the organizer reserved a block of rooms for what must have been an extra fee as the $250/night our group was charged for a room with two double beds is more than the price advertised on a couple travel websites I checked. Why would you charge more to reserve several rooms (ours weren't even grouped together or in the same floor)?This hotel is awfully stingy for the price and although the location is very convenient if you are going to a convention or to live on 4th Street, that doesn't make up for a variety of faults. For a room at this price point, I'm going to have some expectations that I might not have from a lesser priced hotel. For example, there is a parking garage connected to the hotel, but it is neither free nor is the cost reduced. The rooms do not have a mini fridge, though there is a note that one is available if you request it. The beds are doubles instead of queen beds. Nothing is free...Bottles of water in the room cost $3.50, no free breakfast for guests and if there was free WiFi, my room didn't have any instructions as to how I could access it. They did have little jugs of water with fruit floating in it (tastes like water) in the lobby with a big sign next to it that reminds you that this exclusive benefit is for hotel guests only. I ended my stay thinking, well at least I can get a free cup of coffee with the little single serve coffee maker in the corner. I added the water and put the little coffee packet in..."oh, it's not plugged in" and then I realized the plug is so short I have to put the coffee maker on the floor to use it. Gah!Well maintained hotel, perfectly good rooms and friendly staff.   Location ideal for someone coming in from out of town to hit up fourth street parties.Only problem I experienced was the elevators.  There are 18 floors, and for some reason the elevators take a very long time to come back to the lobby.  I believe there was a convention in town, so that perhaps was slowing the elevator due to traffic.I'd stay here again. :)They have a restaurant/bar here that looked decent (if not expensive) but I did not try it.We traveled from NYC and ended up staying what we thought was a decent hotel but treated like 2nd class citizens by gossiping employees.  Advice that your family stay at other friendly hotels in town.  The room service was bad due to lack of staffing. If you like hot meals cold,  this is your kind of place.  The there was a bank robber hiding in the parking garage.  What a welcome.We arrived in Louisville at night and checked into our room at the Hyatt Regency. It's a nice King Suite on the top floor with a very comfortable bed. With the business rate, we had free wifi and buffet breakfast every morning. The restaurants buffet was incredibly delicious and southern gourmet with some healthy options as well. Each day I went down to the buffet and took it back to the room, trying the different breakfast dishes. We also ordered up a refrigerator for our room for free, to keep our beverages cold. All the comforts of home, while being on the road. The location is right in the middle of a bunch of restaurants and the convention center. On our first day in Lousville, a snow storm hit and dumped a lot of snow. While the snow falling was romantic and fun, it also blew out the power to the hotel. Although it was not their fault, we had to relocate to the Marriott for the night until it was fixed. It was a pain, but they handled the transfer smoothly for all of the guests at the same rate we paid at the Hyatt. When we came back, we were treated with champagne and appetizers. Everyone here was very nice, even after I got sick and couldn't leave my room - the housekeeping lady and room service lady offered to bring me hot tea with lemon. That was the moment that completely won me over, the hospitality.Just arrived, they gave away my room but "did me the favor" of booking me at a hotel down the block.  Had to walk around downtown Louisville in the middle of the night because of them.When I got checked in the next day, the manager left an apology note in the room... Addressed to someone else.  Not a big deal but shows the lack of attention to detail in the organization.The staff at the Sway bar are great, best part of the hotel.But, stay somewhere elseThe Hyatt is an amazing hotel.The location is great. It is easy to get to, it is central to downtown. You've got a short walk to the stadium, conference center, and 4th Street live.The in house bar and restaurant are both good if you are feeling lazy.A hotel room is a hotel room to me. The rooms are clean enough and nice enough.  I'm much more focused on location and price.The hotel is in a nice location walking distance to many bars and restaurants. The Sway bar and restaurant is clean food was good and the staff was very friendly. The new rooms are great nice artwork, bed and pillows were comfortable and the TV is a nice size. The staff from start to finish were helpful, pleasant and extremely professional.A very nice place to stay when visiting downtown Louisville.  Clean rooms, friendly staff and great location.  Of special note: they host college interns from all over the world and I had the opportunity to interact with several from Romania and South Africa who are pursuing degrees in hospitality management.  Nice kids!  I am guessing their presence probably indicates something about the internal ranking of this property within the Hyatt brand.Nice small Hyatt Regency.  The layout of the lobby and car is a little funky - you sit at the bar with your back to the front doors and a bit on display.Nice friendly staff.But no Regency Club or floor.  So while it is a Hyatt "Regency" it is missing the "Regency" aspect.REaaaal close to giving this place the 5 star... recently stayed here for the first time, second time here for a conference. Can't get over how friendly and accomodating the staff is at this place. Srsly everyone from the lady at the parking garage, the people at the desk, bartenders, everyone. The hotel itself is quite nice. I was so busy doing the conference, I don't even know if they have a pool ;)Very convenient how they have the hotels connected together via walkways on the second floor. That's something I think I've only ever seen in the colder/snowier places.This was our first time in Louisville and the room was very nice, clean and well stocked as most are.  However, there were no outlets on either side of our king size bed, on one side the lamp and ihome radio were not even plugged in, although the sheets were clean they were not fitted and once you layed in bed you got tangled up.  The morning buffet breakfast was ok, but not all available options were set out.  We did not know they offered pancakes, waffles or omelettes and other meals as part of the buffet.  All in all it was still a decent place to stay but a bit of a disappointment for a 4 star hotel.Great hotel.  All decked out for the PGA Championship.  Staff has on cute golf outfits and they have FABULOUS golf themed flowers all over the hotel.  I love how they are celebrating the PGA!  My associate didn't receive his luggage and had a cocktail party to attend and one of the managers loaned him one of his very nice sport coats for the evening.  His wife brought it to the hotel.  How nice is that?  Thank you Brett Ambrose and Mrs. Ambrose for going way above and beyond on that one!!  Really, who does that??  Brett needs a big promotion!!!!!!!  Kelly at Sway is very nice and personable.  The entire staff has been super nice.  I usually stay at the Galt House when in Louisville but this was a nice bright change.  Bad was my shower floor was warped and could be unsafe.  Great were the FLOWERS and the staff.I was walked here due to my other hotel being full. At 2 in the morning, the front desk was unmanned, and I had to go around the corner of the partition to get service. The service I got was awesome! I even scored a free breakfast buffet for two, a $36 value.The room was typical Hyatt. I expect the consistency they provide from property to property just as I assume a Big Mac is the same in Louisville or London. Great location in the heart of the party district of 4th street.My wife and I got a deal to stay here last weekend. It's right on 4th street, so you can walk to all the bars and restaurants. The parking is a little deceptive. You park in a garage that costs like $10 per day, which they don't tell you, and there's no validation or anything. But it is easy to get from the hotel to the garage.The hotel itself is very nice. The staff was very friendly. The room was clean and spacious. It came with an alarm clock that had an iPod dock. They have a nice pool and an outdoor rooftop tennis court, which I've never seen before.Overall, a solid hotel.Seriously convenient location if you're here to party - 1Walking distance to a LOT of really cool stuff - 1Horribly slow service for check-out...20 people waiting for 2 employees - 0Need a card to get into elevator after 11 p.m....not good for the drunk people - 0No hair dryer in hotel - 0Can hear through front door into hall during sleeping hours - 0T.V. remote sucks - 0Over-priced - 0Unhappy, grumpy employees - 0Did I say seriously convenient location? - 1This is my favorite hotel in Louisville and I am here at least 6 times a year.Clean hotel, courteous staff, good hotel gym, and a good restaurant. If you go to Louisville, KY you should stay here.I like this hotel fine, but it could use a little renovation, or at least some new carpeting. The rooms are fine, but outlet placement isn't the most convenient. Having said that, there are definitely enough of them, just awkward to get to if you want to charge your phone and not have to go across the room to retrieve it. Registered guests are given free internet access. Love that!My room smelled a bit too much of Febreze, or whatever that 'hotel smell' is. I believe they use it when someone smokes in the room previous to your own arrival...wish they'd find a less obnoxious scent, a nice citrus perhaps? :)The location is phenomenal, easy to get to from the airport and very convenient to some great restaurants and entertainment.Staff were very friendly and welcoming, answered any and all questions I had.Beds are comfortable, no problems there at all!
review_content_20: Great hotel.Great location.Too many bachelorette parties.Great food options all around.Comfy beds, amazing interior!I would have rated it higher if these issues didn't exist.1. Mini fridge to keep my drinking water cold.2. Hair dryer (instead of contacting the front desk). Aren't hair dryers a standard in rooms? I know at other Hyatts they are available in the bathroom.3. More outlets in the room. Having plugs in the lamps to charge your phone. Especially when you are relying on your phone as an alarm and want it plugged in all night.4. IHome clock radio has a dock, but doesn't work w iphone 5. The port is different. And couldn't set the alarm in the clock for some reason.5. The walls seemed to be paper thin! I could hear the person in the room next to mine peeing, talking on his phone, and taking his 30-min shower. It was ridiculous.Also, there was another conference and all the floors are visible from the 1st floor. Kind of like an atrium. The bad thing about this design is that every single sound resonates throughout and it was like people were talking right outside my door. Having to attend a conference in another hotel at 8am every morning made it difficult for me to get a good night's sleep. Plus, the paper-thin walls and hearing someone on their phone until 2am didn't help either.Overall, the inside of the hotel is very nice. It can be a bit dizzying looking down to the lobby from the high floors. The room was decent. The bed was comfortable.I had a great view of the Aegon Center. The hotel is right across from 4th Street Live and near the river so you can just walk around and do some sightseeing.All in all, I probably wouldn't stay here again. Mainly because of the thin walls and lack of sleeI love the Hyatt chain in general but this particular hotel needs a little buff up on service. My room was okish. Older tile surfaces and wall treatments. The maid service was a little below standards. I stayed 4 nights, no dusting happened next to my bed, and my sheet would not stay tucked under the mattress. Woke up every night in a sheet twist. Old rough towels in the room. First day,  door hanger for breakfast was present, next 3 days I had to tape a piece of paper to my door from the bedside with my breakfast order. If you get a room on the 4th St. side, it's gonna be loud. Tip of the day... if you park your car, don't go to the obvious driveway front of the hotel, go to the back behind the hotel. No sign to tell you this, so good luck. Otherwise friendly service at the bar, and front desk staff.A fairly unremarkable hotel.  The room was pretty much average.  No in-room safe, mini-bar or fridge.  Sealy mattress was comfortable, furnishings nothing remarkable... generic cabinets, etc.  The internet connection was abysmal.  The hotel doesn't have nearly enough bandwidth, and in early mornings and evenings it's like using a dial-up internet connection of 20 years ago.  There's also a shortage of elevators.  There are 3 to service a large high-rise.  During AM (corresponding to most people's checkout time), on three successive days to get an elevator took on average of 10 minutes.  And then the elevator stopped on virtually every floor, with people waiting to - and unable to - get on to the elevators. This is NOT a 4-star hotel by any stretch of the imagination.I wish I had known there was some religious children singing group in the hotel before I booked. They sing the national anthem at 11 pm every night.  I get that every group needs needs their outlet but I would like the option to opt out if possible. Maybe it's because of the people but the ice machine is empty. Probably because all the adults in this group are hoarding  the ice for their cooler. Also, the people at the front desk gave us this typed note from the manager reading that this group was here and how you would be hard pressed for hot water in the morning and the elevators would be jammed up. Basically it said it sucked to be you unless you were part of this group because we are catering to them and only them.    We come to louisville at least once a year because my husband is from here. Needless to say we won't be back. You have to call from the front desk for everything and they have an attitude. Just stay somewhere else and I promise you'll be happier.This is like my home when in Louisville.  I love the room service, food is ALWAYS excellent. Housekeeping is very thoughtful--they seem to arrange my make up brushes in ways I would never think to, and it's always nice to be welcomed to this cleanness when returning from a long day out.The Hyatt is always accommodating with early check in.  I like the convenience of the bag check up front, and you can also check out umbrellas and highlight markers at the front desk as well.  Eisteen bro bagels is in the building, as well as the gift store which has a decent selection of items for a hotel gift store.The hot tub and pool are on the fourth floor and is always a treat--except for my last visit in which it was being painted and was not open.What really irritates me about this place is the business center.  Apparently we are being charged to use the computers now.  So you have to swipe your credit card in order to use the computers.  It's like $5 for 30 minutes of use, even if you just want to use the printer.  I find this ridiculous, especially when you can go to lower level hotels and use computers and printers for free.  Yuck.Nevertheless, this is my one and only gripe about the Hyatt.  I just steer clear of the business cubicle and pretend it does not exist, and I'm fine.Celebrity Sightings--Tommy Lee                              Eddie MoneyThe Sway Restaurant wasn't staffed greatly. (I was there for a conference.) The waitress was overwhelmed and was probably just as frustrated as we were.Place is clean, rooms are nice but the front desk leaves something to be desired, the valet service was slow checking in as well.I had booked a room with two queens but the changed it to a king which was a problem because I was travelling with another couple and we aren't doing the 3 to a bed thing.  After arguing with the clerk a manager finally came over and solved the problem by giving us two rooms for price of one...but that was after being rudely interrupted several times by desk clerk and basically told that I was screwed and I'd have to live with it.Top notch service.  If you're in a pinch, Priceline bidding can usually yield a room here for only $50.  Parking is $10, with cheaper on the streets if you're really watching your wallet.Room was nicely turned out, with a deep blue and off white color scheme and spotless clean.  We were well treated and will return if in the area.  I highly recommend it  - and if you do Priceline bidding, know you can get an incredible steal!!Great location. Valet parking. Comfy beds. Friendly & accommodating staff. Thank you for a great weekend!I booked this hotel on a whim for the Derby Marathon, price was good and location was great.The room was nice, king size bed, bathroom etc.However the noise outside the door in the central area carried up and was noticeable in the room. The adjoining room doors seemed like they were made of paper and the walls of cardboard, I could hear the conversations in each room.The tv was not in a favorable watching place, and many channels did not work.The internet was provided free of charge from the front desk otherwise they will charge you.I would not be staying there again due to the noise.I found myself kind of annoyed while here and feeling a bit pickpocketed.  This is why.Upon arrival, I had to pay additional $$ for parking.  I would have preferred to have known that in advance. In the room, I did not care for the the dim lighting and low quality toiletries.  Instead of finding two drinking glasses in the room, there was instead bottled water that upon use, is charged to your bill.   Can Hyatt spare an extra towel in the bathroom?  How bout an extra coffee pod?  Hotels used to let you brew your own pot of coffee, now its brew your own cup and only a cup.  Geesh.More importantly, who ever heard of AN UPSCALE HOTEL WITHOUT FREE CABLE OR FREE NETWORK TV?  Even cheap motels have, are you ready, color television and cable.  Can't read a book in the room cuz the lights are too dim.  If I wasn't out enjoying the city life of Louisville and had to spend more time in this barren room, I'd have been pretty pissed.  But alas, I only had to sleep there and laughed it off vowing to never return.I was in town for a convention and stayed here for one night. The location is perfect, adjacent to the convention center, 4th Street Live just down the block and a few blocks from the Yum Center. Lobby is nice and open, room was clean and service was excellent. I had booked a king but received a double, not a problem for me but they were very apologetic and gave me a voucher for free breakfast. Overall my stay was great!  If I ever have to stay in downtown Louisville again this will be my first choice.We stayed for two nights over the weekend as part of a wedding block of more than 20 rooms, and it was a constant string of disappointments.  First, we arrived more than an hour past check-in, and the rooms weren't ready yet -- not ours (the maid of honor), not the bride's parents' room, not even the bridal suite was ready!  When a party books more than 20 rooms months in advance, there is absolutely no excuse to not have those rooms ready by nearly 4:30 p.m.Next, I had to print a simple 8 page, black and white document.  I was directed to the business center, and at $6 for the first 15 minutes and 70 cents per page, it was going to cost me $12 to print an 8 page document.  Not very accommodating.When I got back to the room and tried to take a shower, the drain was backed up, so I had to stand in four inches of other peoples' filth while I was trying to clean myself.  Another disappointment.Finally, it took us 20 minutes to check out because there was a line in front of us all complaining about their poor experience (none of whom was part of our party).The room was fairly nice (as you would expect from any Hyatt Regency), and the location is great, but for $200/night I expect much, much better.Ehhhh....A perfectly serviceable hotel in an ideal location for those looking to sightsee.  Besides that, ehhhh....The Hyatt seems to have one foot stuck in the old school, and one stuck in the present.  Example: why does any hotel in a vibrant downtown area need a restaurant (let alone two!)?  Every time I went past they were either nearly or completely empty.  During breakfast, there was more of a crowd in the adjoining Einstein Bagels.  You have to figure that part of your hotel charge is going towards keeping those relics of hospitality alive.  Least they could do is shut them down and have wifi included in the rooms.  It's a $10 charge btw, but free in the lobby.Our room, and the hotel in general, seemed a bit dated.  There was nothing BAD.... just felt dated.The pool was refreshing.  I've been to so many hotels that have indoor pools that are more like hot tubs.  The water is warm and feels more like a soak in a community bathtub rather than a swim.  I was glad that the Hyatt was a bit different.  The water was nice and cool.... which was a perfect remedy after a full day of sightseeing in sweltering Louisville.For the advertised rate (full disclosure: which I didn't pay.  We booked our stay as part of a package.), I expected more.  But again, there was nothing lacking.... this hotel is just due a facelift.  But man.... the location is perfect.  Right in the Museum Row area, literally across the street from 4th Street, and a five minute drive from the Bardstown Rd neighborhood. Recommend.Do not stay here. Horrible service, and grossly unorganized. They do not honor their event contracts, and sway you to downgrade your rooms without offering compensation.  Much better options around town for your friends, family, and events in downtown Louisville.Was here for a trade show.  Staff was very nice and friendly.  Giant open atrium style. Similar to embassy suites.  Easy to get vertigo.  Tons o food choices across the street.  Eats b good.Would have 4 or maybe 5 stars but any hotel that doesn't provide a coffe maker or free bottled water in my room doesn't rate.Staff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel has a $15 dollar special per nite which covers Internet, parking and breakfast. I chose that option. The Internet in my room was very fast, pleasant surprise and made paying for wifi bearable.Food and drink prices are $$$$ at this hotel, I recommend closer restaurants and bars on 4th Street Live.Visited this hotel for a conference, and they were ill prepared. Front desk staff was rude and unhelpful. Facilities were adequate but not impressive. Ridiculous charges for in-room internet access. Good location if you're looking to pick up 50 year old women drunk on box wine who think Front Street Live is cool.Other than location-wise this hotel sucks. No food from 11pm to 5 pm unless its breakfast on the weekend. The restaurant, Sway, is horrendous. An hour to get the food and it was not busy. The food was VERY salty and too much pepper on EVERYTHING. I saw multiple others returning food. Compared to the standard mid-high end hotel service I am used to, this hotel is way below par.
review_content_40: I was attending an event at the adjacent convention center and the location could not have been better for me. It's the closest of any hotel and connected by the LouieWalk skyway. On the down side, on Friday and Saturday nights in summer bands perform at 4th Street Live and the music goes until about midnight --it makes it a little tough to sleep unless you have earplugs. The bed was very comfortable--nicely appointed, and the desk provided a good workspace. They have iHome alarm clocks so you can charge and play your iPod/iPhone if you need to. The bathtub and sink could use a little renovation. There were visible cracks, but there was plenty of hot water and is wasn't really a problem. I ordered room service twice during my stay, and both times it was delivered by Inigo who was ridiculously polite and helpful. The food was quite good and a welcome treat after a long day out. Every person I came in contact with at this hotel was warm and helpful. They really make customer service a priority. They were really busy when I was there with several large groups, but the hotel didn't feel crowded and over-extended. The housekeeper accidentally broke my AC adaptor for my laptop while I was out for the day, and by the time I returned to my room --before I even noticed anything was wrong --the front desk had sent someone to the Apple Store to buy me a brand new AC adaptor--nicer than the old one I had. I was shocked by this INCREDIBLE customer service. Talk about going above and beyond. I've never had customer service like that. As a female traveling alone and never having been to Kentucky before, I felt very safe here and highly recommend the Hyatt Louisville. I hope to stay here again.Stayed here while in town visiting friends, scoping out a long-distance hiking trip (American Discovery Trail), caving in KY and seeing Widespread Panic at the Palace. Warning, this place fills up fast when a convention is in town. It is conveniently located on 4th street. Not really much stands out. I like Einstein Bagels, in the lobby, so that helps.Went to check the car into valet and they said we needed to hide all beverages??? All beverages was in our bags and all others in a plastic bag and in paper bags.. Crazy ass Kentucky laws... We ended up not even checking into Louisville and left for Chicago... Corrupt lawmakers!!!!I hotwired this place recently for a quick overnight trip to help my friend find a place to live (she's moving to Louisville, lucky bitch). The room was clean and had been updated, so the sheets were nice, as were the toiletries. You can tell it had some older fixtures (like the tub), but they did a good job modernizing the rooms. In terms of size, it was definitely spacious for two people. The lobby, even though it's at the bottom of the atrium, still felt dark. The staff was pleasant. There was an Einstein's Bagels, which I thought seemed a little odd, but I guess it's okay for business travelers on-the-go.My favourite of all the hotels we stayed at on our road trip. This Hyatt was big, comfortable, and the room we were given had a pretty cool view of 4th street. The bathroom was well appointed and luxurious. Really enjoyed the fact there was an Einstein Bagel shop in the lobby, which made getting hot coffee early in the morning a snap. The fitness room was pretty great, a bunch of machines (treadmill, elliptical, bikes), weights and weight machines. The room itself was nicely decorated with comfortable beds. My two gripes would be the fact that we were given a room with double beds. When I requested a king room the girl at the desk said "Oh we don't have any available." The hotel appeared to be only about half full so that statement grated on me a bit. The other was the supposed internet access through the TV in the room. It never worked. It was $10 for that, but to be fair, they did remove the charge when I explained the problems.All in all, its no Brown Hotel, but I would stay here again.Visited this hotel and conference area with my husband on a business trip. His company had a booth at a conference here and I wandered around the hotel and went to a local mall to shop.Very nice facilities. I used the Internet/computer area reserved for guests, which was nice. Although we weren't staying there, I saw one of the rooms that my husband's coworker was staying in and it was comfortable, stylish and clean. It's convenient to several restaurants and bars. Almost looks like a mini-Vegas in this area of town! We chose the Hard Rock Cafe but there are other options.Great location but nothing special.You have to pay for Internet, you have to pay extra to get in and out of the garage, no free breakfast. If you are going to charge more for your hotel, you have to give something back in terms of perceived value, even if it's sticking a serve yourself coffee area in the lobby. It does have fast elevators, but things are a bit worn around the edges. The pool is one of those things. The water was cold, there was no hot tub or showers in the bathrooms, the door to the outside was not closed and it was low 30s outside. The tiling and room itself were old and in need of updating. Double beds look like they are made for hobbits. You kind of get the idea that someone from the airline industry decided to do what they do to air passengers but in a hotel setting. The difference being I have way more choice in choosing a hotel and won't be choosing this one any time in the near future.Valets - 4 stars (cute and helpful) Front desk staff - 3 stars (some great, some okay) Elevators - 3 stars (fast and kind of cool) Pool - 3 stars (nicer than average and a way cool whirlpool with seats) Rooms - 4 stars (great toiletries, well appointed even though our view sucked and BIG televisions with flat screens) So, 3 stars over all with a bit more for the cheap Hotwire.com rate (woo-hoo!).Nice place. Nice staff. Didn't have a reservation but they accommodated nicely and set me up with a nice room with a nice view that had a nice bed with some nice pillows.Many "earthy" tones abound. Soothing. Thanks.Thank god for the $77 Hotwire rate as this hotel is no better than a Hampton Inn or Fairfield. For a 4 star, room service was over at midnight as was the bar. Our room was underwhelming with a broken closet door that was off track. Portico bath products were too perfumey for most guests. The only saving face was our check in experience as the front desk clerk was nice and prompt when we arrived at 1amConsistent with the rest of the Hyatt's that I've stayed at. The heat/hot water was better than some of the other hotels i've stayed at. I'd come back here again if I had business in Louisville in the future.This is OK for a downtown hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the room was big enough for two. It's proximity to downtown Louisville attractions, especially 4th street live, is it's best feature. Honestly, I've had nicer rooms, more amenities and free parking at suburban Holiday Inn Expresses, but of course they don;t have that downtown buzz. You can get some really good rates on hotwire.Excellent customer service from all staff levels: Jean at the bar, the front desk staff, the housekeepers, and the bellmen. Only issue was the thin walls.I just attended a conference here, and everything went very smoothly. The staff were friendly and attentive, even when we arrived to check in at almost 4 in the morning. The hotel has obviously been remodeled recently because despite the rather dated and generic exterior, the interior and the rooms are surprisingly fresh and modern. Our room was extremely aesthetically pleasing, with simple lines, neutral colors, and solid dark wood furniture with granite countertops. The beds were the best - squishy and comfortable with ample pillows - too many pillows, about which I will never complain. I usually have to call down for more. The beds were dressed with soft down comforters with classic crisp white duvet covers and sheets. I loved the bed the moment I saw it and slept like a baby for my three nights there.At around $100 a night from Travelocity, this is a dang good deal. The rooms are nicely appointed, comfy beds - not spectacular but very nice. They have little iPod docking stations that I loved! The tv sort of sucks - no HBO so why even have the TV? I mean, I missed "Game of Thrones" but . . water pressure is good and the facility itself is quite comfortable with an indoor pool on the 4th floor, a restaurant that is open until midnight and a handy little 24 hour gym. You can't really get a better deal . . I paid just $20 less to stay in a La Quinta on the outskirts of town with no where near the services or perks.Great location, great service, clean & modern accommodations, and a great price - I booked a room on a Saturday night in November on Priceline for only $65! There's a parking garage on site with reasonable rates, 4th Street Live is next door and it's in walking distance of downtown attractions. The best thing about our stay was the down pillows and blankets - a phenomenal night's rest! We also had a few drinks in the hotel's lounge, which was cozy and nice. I would definitely stay at the Hyatt Regency again, whether I was in Louisville for work or fun.My husband and I stayed here the night and night after we got married, and I am happy to say that those at the Hyatt Regency treated us very nicely! When they saw me walk up to the front desk in my wedding dress, they immediately upgraded our room and gave us breakfast vouchers - for free! This was especially nice considering I reserved our two night stay via Hotels.com - totaling to only $79 a night! The wait-staff at their restaurant were a delight and my husband and I had a long conversation with the chef about up upcoming honeymoon in culinary Las Vegas. The hotel also has boundless conference rooms and a few nice art shops. The Hyatt makes Louisville look good - real good.Stay at the Hyatt Regency if: You are visiting Louisville for any reason; you live in Louisville and want a nice break from the monotony (or just want a nice view of the city from the 40th floor); you want to visit 4th street Live and need a place afterward to crash (the Hyatt is next door to the entertainment block); you are on business in Louisville and need a nice place to stay! This place is also probably child friendly and accommodating. Don't stay at the Hyatt Regency if: you don't like nice-ness!The very best thing about this hotel is....the EXCELLENT staff, the fitness center, and the pool area. These three things are what got 4 rather than 3 stars. I personally had issues with the lack of attention from the housekeeping staff from a dirty tub to dusty furniture and will soon write a letter to the hotel manager. If you are reading this hopefully these issues will be resolved and your stay will be better than mine. Excellent location, and enjoyed breakfast at their revolving restaurant overlooking the river and the downtown area. Their meeting facilities are excellent as well. Please note that this is an atrium style hotel so you might get some echo noise in your room during busy times...also during busy times there will be a longer wait for the elevators. Night one wasn't as restful due to the blower for the heater which is directly above the bed. Night two I asked for an extra blanket and turned the heater off. The pool area was gorgeous...yet cold....it would be nice if they checked the temperature to ensure that it is warm enough in there. I was so cold that I was not able to relax on the chairs after my swim. Also extending the pool hours to 11 PM would be great for those who dine out...gives us time to get back to the hotel and sit in the whirlpool a bit. Since it closes at 10 there just wasn't enough time. One of the very best fitness center I have ever seen at a hotel.
